Reviews.Title: “Very good find”
Reviews.Author: Eventful
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean. The staff is very customer-service oriented. They offer roll away beds. The breakfast in the mornings and the evening snacks and drinks were perfect - especially with the kids -- more food and drinks than we expected. The lobby area is great to sit and relax in. We liked that it was close to the French Quarter but NOT in the French Quarter. The French Quarter is way tooooo noisy for sleeping, in my opinion. There is a great supermarket about 2 blocks away to pick up any items one needs or wants. The Wi-Fi works! I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Carol H
Reviews.Content: Drury Inns and fantastic. They are clean, comfortable beds, nice size rooms, great bathrooms, too. The hotel has nice extras like a complete breakfast included in the stay. The afternoon has popcorn for snacking. They also have substantial snacks at early dinner time-hot dogs, mac-n-cheese and chicken fingers! The staff is friendly, efficient and helpful. Its a good location and FANTASTIC price for New Orleans!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain for New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: AScheerbaum
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Drury Inn and it was a great experience. My boyfriend and I and another couple chose to say here during Jazzfest in April 2012. The perks at the hotel are what makes it so great - a nightly happy hour complete with 3 free drinks and TONS of free food (Mac n cheese, hot dogs, chicken fingers, salad). The free morning breakfast is great too (eggs, sausage, bacon, etc). The room was spacious and far enough away so you're never bothered by the sounds of late night revelry. A little further away from the French Quarter than some hotels, but for the price and the amenities, you can't pass up the deal!

Reviews.Title: “What more could you ask for”
Reviews.Author: Len_FLC
Reviews.Content: We arrived just in time for the evening drinks and snacks. We could not believe the choice of "snacks" and drinks that was laid out for us, not to mention the afternoon popcorn and soda that is available and the excellent buffet breakfast. The front desk staff were so very helpful and very proffessional. We had a huge room with a good choice of pillows for a very comfortable bed. The location is excellent as we were able to walk to most places. We would most definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great with kids”
Reviews.Author: FItraveler2010
Reviews.Content: We had 3 suites for 3 families traveling together and were very happy with this hotel. The separate bedroom and family room were perfect for families. We were traveling with kids ages 5-13 and the evening food and cocktails were the best! The food was all kid friendly (chicken fingers, nachos, hot dogs, salad, tacos,....) so we were able to feed them, while we had a few cocktails, and then either leave them at the hotel while we went to dinner or bring them with us and let them have dessert while we enjoyed traditional New Orleans fare. It saved us a lot of money and hassle trying to find kid-friendly food at some of the nicer NOLA restaurants. Breakfast was also great and a good place to meet with the family in the morning to start the day. The pool and pool area are very small and not really made for relaxation but good enough for the kids. The location is good. It's really close enough to the French Quarter to walk but with the smaller kids and an older relative we did still end up taking quite a few cabs. It was also the end of June so the heat was a factor. If it had been cooler, we probably would have walked more. The front desk staff is phenomenal. They set up tours, made recommendations, and seemed genuinely pleased to have us there and to be helpful. Can't say enough great things about them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & affordable”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloGal017
Reviews.Content: A group of 10 girls stayed here for a bachelorette party - we had 1 suite and 2 regular rooms, but unfortunately nothing connected. The bathrooms had the sink & mirror outside of the shower/toilet which is always good for a bunch of girls getting ready! We were pleased with the location - within walking distance to Bourbon St and the street car but not too close that you would be kept up all night. It was definitely affordable, especially for being in a city center. There was free breakfast and free food & drinks at night. Obviously Nola is known for their food, but it's always nice to have that option at the hotel. This wasn't a luxury hotel but the rooms were nice enough. Best attributes would be the price and location!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and so reasonable.”
Reviews.Author: KathleenBridget
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the positive reviews on TA and, once again, the reviewers ddin't let us down. This hotel is in a great location and yes, there is valet parking at $25 a night, but we did know about it as it's made perfectly obvious when you book it. The breakfast was lovely and we enjoyed the Kickback each night. We had great lunches in New Orleans and saved some money by eating the Kickback food in the evening.We were in walking distance of the French Quarter and we didn't feel unsafe at all. The pool was out of order when we were there which was a pity, however, when I mentioned this in the hotel's questionnaire, we were immediately offered some recompense-excellent customer service in my opinion, We would defintiely book a Drury hotel if we were lucky enough to be in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to the French Quarters”
Reviews.Author: Iorus R
Reviews.Content: For a hotel that is very no nonsense they provided a lot of service. No parking space there so the parking was valet. Free food and beverages in the afternoon and big rooms. We had a good couple of nights there eventhough are room was next to another building so there was no view and the room was dark, even during the day. Breakfast was fine. Big beds, fridge, microwave, airconditioning, everything was there. Walking distance to Bourbon Street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: The_Houston_Texan
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Drury Inn from August 1-August 3, 2012. Drury Hotel is a favorite hotel chain of mine in San Antonio, TX and now in New Orleans. Along with the free breakfast and the 5:30 Kickback, we really enjoyed this hotel. I was surprised that I actually had a brief conversation with Chuck Drury in passing as I was checking out the rooftop pool (the views are excellent). He was visiting the hotel and told me to enjoy my stay. At the time I did not realize it was Chuck Drury until one of the hotel staff had pointed him out to me as he was leaving the lobby. Well Mr. Drury, I enjoyed my stay. The rooms are clean and spacious with high ceilings. The hotel is in walking distance to the French Quarter and Harrah's Casino. The hotel is just far enough away from the noise on Bourbon St. Overall, I give the Drury Inn an excellent rating. A great hotel, with a great location, and a great staff. If you are looking for a hotel in New Orleans close to the French Quarter, I highly recommend the Drury Inn. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: vivovancouver
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Huge spacious room with high ceiling and lovely window treatment, marble bathroom, excellent snacks and drinks in the evening and breakfast in the morning. Would have preferred something other than styrofoam plates and plastic cutlery, but I understand that cleaning and replacing these things jacks the price of service up terribly. All in all an excellent place to stay in New Orleans - close to the Quarter but not in it. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: lakedistrict2
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Drury in New Orleans. Our room was great with high ceilings and a lovely night skyline view out the windows. The staff was outstanding- they were very friendly and helpful. The daily breakfast was terrific. We came back in the early evenings to change and enjoyed the free drinks before heading out to partake in the nightlife. It's an easy walk to all the attractions and when your feet are tired you can catch the Charles Street trolley home ( the trolley is actually a bus in this area). Skip Cafe Du Monde and go for beignets on Bourbon Street in a lovely area that has jazz playing and outside tables. The beignets were better and the place was cleaner and more quaint. Don't make the mistake of taking the trolley out to Frenchman Street late and expecting to come home after drinks and music -the trolley's last run is at 10:30. Way too early New Orleans time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing from A to Z”
Reviews.Author: tdzarling
Reviews.Content: The entire staff at this hotel was fabulous. From check in to housekeeping to meals to customer service, this hotel has it down. The breakfast was delicious, afternoon soda/popcorn was great, and kickbacks with beverages was appreciated. The room itself was wonderful - king sized bed, sizable desk, microwave/mini fridge, and coffee maker. Some of the more pricey hotels in the city don't provide the micro/fridge or even a coffee maker in rooms. Jamie and Slade were especially helpful with the large group of high school youth--I heard from multiple youth leaders that they had a wonderful experience all around. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “They Have A High Rating Because of the Overall Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: EagleFl
Reviews.Content: We were drawn to The Drury not only for its high guest ratings but also because of everything that was included in the package i.e. breakfasts, dinners with 3 complimentary 4 oz drinks and soft drinks and popcorn in the lobby from 3 to 10 pm. We stayed three nights on our vacation. Our room was quite nice with the distinctive New Orleans high ceilings and 12 ft high windows. Wireless internet was available in the room. We thought one of the highlights of the breakfasts was the great Oatmeal which was made from scratch. Belgium Waffles. cereals, scrambled eggs, sausage patties, yogurt, and fruit were served. For the dinners, each day was a different featured item such as Chicken Tenderloins, Macaroni & Cheese, hotdogs, Tossed Chili Salad, soups, etc. There is a small rooftop pool but we never had time to use it! We were about a mile away from Cafe Du Monde; one of our planned stops. It's actually a nice pleasant walk. If time is an issue, the St Charles trolly line is adjacent to the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: fromArizona
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in a 2 room suite (we were a party of 3 adults). The location was very convenient. The French Quarter was a short walk and the area was very safe. Close to the trolley and the WWII Museum. The suite was large, but the bedroom had no window and the window in the other room had no view. The sofa bed did not pull out easily, so my son just slept on the sofa which he was ok with. It was nice having the extra space & privacy with 2 rooms and the price was right. The complimentary breakfast was nice. We didn't make much use of the evening social hour because who wants to eat hot dogs & chips when there is such great food in New Orleans, but if you are a family economizing you could easily make a meal out of it. It looked like the hotel does a lot of tour business.

Reviews.Title: “Decent business hotel but not well cleaned”
Reviews.Author: Skihist
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this hotel. I like Drury's midrange style, which puts it a step above a motel but still affordable. It's good for budget business travel. The desk was big and came with a power strip, which was very good to have. I also liked the fact that my room had a classic high ceiling and tall windows. The staff was generally quite pleasant and helpful. The room keys are wireless, which is easier and probably more reliable than inserted card keys. Location was reasonably close to both the French Quarter and the convention center, though neither is an easy walk in muggy weather. Another plus: Rouse's market, which is a lot like Whole Foods, is about a block away. I wasn't so happy with the cleanliness of the room. Here's the main thing: One day, the cleaning person didn't finish the bathroom, and left dirty towels on the floor. It was as if they left in the middle of the job. It was a very irritating thing to come back to after a long day of work, when I wanted to take a shower. I called the front desk and the problem was fixed in less than an hour, but was very inconvenient. Also, the desk had food stains, and there was a strong smell of hair oil in the room. The staff replaced the pillows and removed the armchair, which solved the problem, but it was another headache. Overall, a hotel in good shape that's pretty well set up for business travelers, but just has to work on its cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm.. OK”
Reviews.Author: davissummer24
Reviews.Content: Stayed here July 2012 with a friend. Requested a high floor room away from the elevator. Got 2nd floor(building has 9 floors) literally right next to where they are building that parking garage. Checkin-in: Was quick and painless. Pointed out my room request and was told there was nothing else available. To be honest, they were very nice and the customer service was good Room: 213. Double bed room with fridge/microwave. Room was clean. Bathroom was small but accomodating. But as we found out at 830am Saturday morning when the jackhammers or whatever they were started off we were WAY too close to the construction. Every morning except for Sunday we heard all kind of noise from the construction. I dont believe they should be booking folks in these rooms and if they do how about some warning about this??? Just a hey you are going to be near the construction would be nice. Most places 830am is not that late but in New Orleans, guests are sleeping at this time. It got so we would go take naps by the pool or have to wait til late evening to catch up on some sleep. Breakfast/happy hour: I've stayed at other Drurys where these services were pretty decent. We showed up for happy at 550pm(starts at 530) to lukewarm hotdogs and cold mac and cheese and hey we're out of this(tequila, wine for happy hour). Breakfast was lukewarm to cold biscuits, icky powdered eggs, and inedible sausage. I'm not expecting the Ritz but food shouldn't be cold. I've experienced much better at other Drury hotels. Please take notes from the Drury Plaza San Antonio(see review) We totally skipped it after the second day and went to Daisy Dukes(budget restaurant) for breakfast. Only thing that was good was the veggies on the evening snacks. Shame Pool: Was decent when folks didn't allow their kids to do cannonballs and such in the pool and 3 yr olds weren't in the jacuzzi. Location: I thought was good. I've stayed directly in the quarter and I prefer modern hotels/amenities so I was not happy at my last location(see review). It was barely a 4 block walk and there you are on Bourbon St. Recommend/return: Maybe but only if the construction is done or I can at least get a room away from it and I would not waste time with the happy hour/breakfast. I made a video of the noise in our room at 8am but TA has changed so you can now only add photos so couldn't include here.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice........”
Reviews.Author: ajhappy1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in a 2 queen room. The interior of the hotel is visually attractive and sets the mood for The Big Easy. The front desk and check in was perfect. The room was clean and well organized. The rollaway bed was delivered quickly. The only minor complaint would be the food service. The items did not stay well stocked and service was abruptly cut off on the second at 7:00PM. Having the drink machines available at all hours was helpful. I was concerned about the location being too far out from the French Quarter but it was perfect for all locales. We felt very safe walking to and fro in the evening hours. The four teenagers with us said that the pool was too small, but for younger children, it would be fine. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: otsnow63
Reviews.Content: This hotel had very nice rooms. It isn't right in the French Quarter but it is only a few blocks away. We enjoyed being a little removed from the noise of the French Quarter. The only down side to this hotel is that the parking is valet only and $25 per day. I wouldn't mind but it takes about 15-20 min for them to get your car if you need it. Also if you happen to forget something in your car, you can't just go out and get it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: DebDaveLuke
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel..the rooms were nice and clean, they have a happy hour and also a breakfast buffet that was very good. All of the staff were nice, and they even opened up the pool for my 8 year old on his birthday (at midnight) because he really wanted to go swimming on the roof. It was only for 15 minutes, but it made his day..after a very long day of traveling. Also, within walking distance to Bourbon St. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Orleans Location”
Reviews.Author: JPrice69
Reviews.Content: Easy to find. Stayed 2 nights right before Essence Music Festival. Ronaldo was an amazing receptionist. Disappointed in the $25 a night parking rate but it was cheaper than other hotels in the area and parking in New Orleans is hard to come by. Felt safe in the area. St. Charles Trolley stop right outside hotel on Carondelet Street. Easy walk to river front and French Quarter. Carondelet street turns into Bourbon Street so it's a straight shot from the hotel. We had a room on the 8th floor with 2 double beds. Room was really nice but could hear the trolley go by. Free snacks and 3 drinks in the afternoon at 5:30. Food wasn't that great. Freed breakfast in the morning which was ok. All in all, it was a really nice stay and a really great location of the city. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Far Exceeded my Expectations”
Reviews.Author: indygem
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. The lobby is marble with much of the original building's historic character in tact. At the same time, the rooms and other amenities are nicely updated (although the bathroom is a little tight - see photo). The mini fridge in the room was great, and the bed was very comfortable, with nice linens. We arrived around 5 PM just as the complimentary "happy hour" with appetizers was starting. We were each given coupons for 3 free drinks for each night of our stay and directed to the serving area. What a pleasant surprise. There was a nice selection of beer, wine and basic mixed drinks and the appetizers were substantial enough to count for dinner (stuffed baked potatoes, cheese, etc). Breakfast the next morning was similarly fulfilling -- scrambled eggs, waffles, fruit, biscuit & gravy, yogurt). Moreover, the place was immaculate. Note that I've given a 5 rating for the restaurant, but there isn't a restaurant on the premises per se. My rating is for where the drinks and food are served in the the mornings and evenings. All of the staff were friendly and helpful (although some could use a little more training about attractions and galleries on nearby Julia Street). The hotel is in an ideal location - easy to the quarter, waterfront, and warehouse districts. The parking is a bit tight but the valets did an excellent job getting cars to people or helping flag down cabs as needed (we were there during a VERY busy weekend with multiple events going on, but never had to wait more than a few minutes for service from the valets). The rooftop pool was sparkling clean. It is too bad there aren't any umbrellas on the roof, but given the brisk breezes that kick up, their absence is understandable. if you wait until later in the afternoon the shadow from the neighboring building provides sufficient shade to escape the sun. I attribute the high quality of service, cleanliness of all parts of the hotel (including stairwells), and overall feel of the place to the hands on approach of the general manager, Slade Stratman. I don't think I've ever been to a hotel where the general manager was not only so visible but responsive to every request. Whether first thing in the morning or late in the day around the pool, Mr. Stratman was there checking with guests to make sure that everything was in order and that our needs were met. I can't say enough about all the ways Mr. Stratman contributed to our groups enjoyment of the weekend in general and stay at Drury in particular. This hotel is a great value and I have already recommended it to friends who are visiting NOLA this summer. I would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the Crescent City”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after a last minute trip to the Big Easy. While I'd never heard if the hotel, I was encouraged by the reviews on TA. I really think this hotel is one of the best values in the city. Walking distance to the Quarter, pet-friendly, spacious rooms and roll-aways, nice pool and passable breakfast. It's very safe and quite - unlike a lot of Quarter options. I'd prefer the Ritz of course, but when traveling with the family and dog and/or in need of a good hotel at a good price, this hotel can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and lots of Amenities”
Reviews.Author: kz04jd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two night after our 7 day cruise ended. The staff and this hotel are super customer focused and go above and beyond to meet your needs. Since we were on our honeymoon, we booked the two room jacuzzi suite. The suite was very spacious and clean with marbled tile in the bathroom and foyer. The suite also included a mini fridge and microwave oven. On the rooftop, the hotel offers an inviting swimming pool and jacuzzi with a wonderful of downtown New Orleans. The hotel offers several wonderful freebies everyday. Starting with breakfast which includes waffles, french toast, sausage, scrabbled eggs, fresh fruit, and a variety of other foods and juices. From 5:30pm-7:00pm, they offer free appetizers/snacks including chicken tenders, hot dogs, nachos, and other items. They also offer guests (21 and over) 3 free drinks each night (beer, wined, mixed drinks, etc.) Lastly, from 3pm-10pm everyday they offer unlimited free popcorn and soda. The only negative comment I have is that our suite was adjacent to a construction site which was the only thing we had a view of from our 8th floor room. So from morning to late afternoon there was a lot of noise which inhibits any napping. I'm assuming this is a temporary issue however. Overall, I highly recommend this facility and I searched long and hard to find the right mixture of value, location, and amenities. The Drury Inn scored high in all of those categories which is reflective in their #1 Trip Advisor rating.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Wideworld10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Drury Inn for 5 days. The staff were welcoming and helpful. The suite was very comfortable and clean. The free breakfast and drinks and nibbles very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Azeret
Reviews.Content: This was our third time in New Orleans but first time not staying right in the French Quarter. The distance to the the FQ is still super close though (you are about 2 blocks from Canal St.). Overall we enjoyed our stay. The rooms are all spacious and clean. There is a great view from the roof top pool. The staff were all friendly and courteous. They also offer a number of perks suck as free hot breakfast (including make your own waffles), and an afternoon "kickback" in which you can get free drinks and snacks. If given a choice I would probably stay in the FQ during my next stay but would not hesitate to stay at the Drury if I was looking for a better deal!

Reviews.Title: “Economic”
Reviews.Author: mari866
Reviews.Content: We all enjoy our stay at the Drury Inn there were 4 of us. Whenever we go back to N.O. we will be staying there. Location is excellent, within walking distance to Canal St. & Borboun St. The staff very friendly and caring. The extras were better than expected. (Breakfast and the 5:30 to 7:00 Happy Hour) Good food. Beds were comfortable. We recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My stay was fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: Olemissmel
Reviews.Content: My husband was sent to New Orleans for business. His company booked the room, so the Drury wasn't even our decision... But it turned out to be a wonderful experience. Our room was spotless, spacious, and had a jet tub! The staff was very helpful and all smiles... For our entire 10 day stay. The hotel is within walking distance to everything we wanted, and there is a street car stop practically at the door for easy travel. Loved the free breakfast, and the afternoon snacks and cocktails. Nice option to meet and chat with fellow travelers. The Drury in New Orleans was very relaxing, and I will stay here on future trips if possible. Great job!

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite line of hotels”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn S
Reviews.Content: It was recommended that we stay at a Drury Inn when it was known we would be traveling. And I am so glad I took that advice! We stay for 6 nights and felt like we were at home. We had a two room suite and while the layout was a bit wonky (a wall jutted out preventing the door from happening completely.) it was very roomy. The towels and linens were good quality and clean. We did use the pull out sofa, which wasn't any where near being comfortable, but then what pull out ever is? The king size bed though was glorious. Yes, I sneaked a peek at the mattress and it was clean. They use light colored bedspreads instead of the dark busy ones you're afraid to touch. The free hot breakfasts were terrific. Scrambled eggs, sausages, french toast, hot waffles along with other 'continental' offerings. And the 5:30 kick back made lunch the only meal we needed to go out and find. Which given the hotel's proximity to Canal and Bourbon Streets a non-issue. The rooftop pool was small, but generally clean. Although there were a few loose tiles on the side, one actually fell off the week we were there. But we weren't there for the swimming so I didn't take off for that. The staff were great, even with a rambunctious 3 year old and a temperamental 8 year old coming and going. The front desk staff always greeted us and were very helpful. I did use the laundry room and one of the dryers was out of commission, and the vending machine was out of soap, but the deck clerk gave me some free of charge. Overall a great introduction to a chain of Inns that I've since stayed at a few more times on the trip home. Definitely will stay again. An item for the 'wish-lists' for this location - on-site parking (under construction at the time of our stay)

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and hotel”
Reviews.Author: chad b
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got married in New Orleans. We had a large wedding party stay here at the Drury Inn in New Orleans and would highly recommend this hotel!! We spent a lot of time looking online and saw the great reviews. After walking around New Orleans and seeing some of the spotty neighborhoods, we are more then thrilled that we stayed in the buisness district. It was only a short walk to anywhere we wanted. The happy hour drinks at 5:30pm were free and strong. Rolando was a awesome guy up front and even let us check-in 6 hours early after a long flight. Thank you to all the awesome staff that took care of my wife and our family!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, walking distance to French Quarter but quiet”
Reviews.Author: Flapi
Reviews.Content: No on-site parking, only valet (2 blocks away) for $25 US per night. They're building a lot behind the hotel but it won't be ready for a long time. Comfortable beds, typical Drury rooms, good service, but no rooms with balconies at this location. Great for families - find another hotel if you're a couple (lots of noise and kids running around in the lobby during breakfast & happy hour). The best thing about this place is the location - tucked away from all the noise of Bourbon Streetbut still within walking distance (10 minutes). Free wifi in rooms. Free breakfast & happy hour drinks & food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, free WIFI, cocktails, food,breakfast etc”
Reviews.Author: Tolroy
Reviews.Content: We choose the Dury Inn on location and price. The bonus was free breakfast, free 3 drinks every night with food, free WIFI, free coffee in the room, free popcorn. Easy to walk to the French quarter in about approx 15mins. Staff all very helpful. One small criticism, sun shades or something more permanent in places around the pool would be most helpful unless that is not possible due to possible windÂ

Reviews.Title: “Cost conscious and wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karen S
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Drury Inns before and have always been impressed but this Drury Inn in New Orleans was gorgeous. The lobby was elegant and beautiful. We only stayed one night as it was the only night available. The rest of our vacation stay it was booked. The hotel was spotless, the breakfast and kick-back hour are great and the manager here was very friendly and accommodating, but most Drury managers are. The staff was great. You can walk to all the tourist areas and also non-tourist areas in New Orleans from this hotel. We had a wonderful king bed handicapped room which was clean and comfortable. We will definitely stay here again when we visit New Orleans. Next time we will ensure that we can stay more than one night at this Drury Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great taste of elegant old New Orlean”
Reviews.Author: whyaske
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and were very happy with the choice. Upon entering the hotel, we encountered wonderful old elegance in the lobby with beautiful chandeliers and a grand piano. The rooms have wonderfully high ceilings and we knew that this is a hotel with character and years-old stories. The staff were extremely accommodating, answering any question we had, keeping tables clear during the breakfast and "kickback" times. It was nice to have hot and cold breakfast items, but many hotels do that now. The "lagniappe" (something extra) was the kickback time. It was great to have a late afternoon cocktail hour with drinks, hot food, including hot dogs, macaroni and cheese, nachos, fresh veggies, etc. It's a great way to have a quick bite before enjoying the nightlife in the French Quarter (10 minute walk). When back in New Orleans, we'll definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting rooms and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Zombiebaby
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The rooms were spacious and quiet with incredibly tall ceilings. The roof top pool had an awesome view of the city and the hotel is walking distance to bourbon street. The beds were comfortable and the hotel was very clean. The staff was very friendly and eager to help in any way. The only gripe I had was everything operates on key-cards and they routinely had to be reactivated in order to get them to operate the elevator and the room lock. Other than that it was a great stay and I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean - Frendly - Won't be disapointed”
Reviews.Author: gspraker
Reviews.Content: Stayed june/4&5/2012 Why do I say you won't be disapointed well my sister is very picky and she liked it a lot. This hotel with very helpful and friendly staff. Our room was light and spacious high ceilings. Great rooms !!! Top floor !! Frig in cabinet under TV. The location was excellent, positioned about 15 minutes stroll from the French Quarter, The River Walk, and Harrah's Casino . With a trolley bus stop right across the road. The Drury Inn has a 3 free drink card feature, Where free fast food and the drinks are served at around 5 - 7 p.m. And free soda machine all day. Yes you do have have to use room card to use elevators. Sounds like a pain but keeps out the ones that don't belong. Breakfast was adequate had waffles, oatmeal, eggs, sausage, Bran, yogurt & more. The parking is $25/day valet parking charge. While the car is parked off lot about 1 block away, if you want something out of car you will have to wait for them to walk to your car and drive it back to the hotel to get it out. Or have them get it and carry back. This is due to hotel expansion work on parking garage - but this will be temporary about a year or more I think there just starting. Everyone in New Orleans charges for parking due to space some charge more. We walked along the board walk for a while then headed up towards Bourbon St stopped at THE MARKET CAFE 3 draft beers and a 1 soda = $22.00. They do have glasses of White or Red wine from $28.00 to $41.00 a glass.Took tour form hotel to see the, Garden District - Cemeteries - 9 nth ward - St Charles Ave Homes $44.00 cost... I have never been here before and was not to impressed with the smells that comes from under the streets like sewer gas. Bring lots of money $6- $7 for a beer at places. And signs on doors if you enter you must buy a drink, or to use restroom. Harrah's lowest limit on black jack is $15.00 way to much for fun play for some. Had dinner at Harrah's casino Best deal in town for $18.00 -$20.00 only 10-15 min walk from hotel for food and drink included. Brother -in -law saw Coyote Ugly in we went in was happy hour I believe around 2-5 pm. To the person asking about Jimmy Buffett Margaritaville in N.O. Did no go to that one. We went to Jimmy Buffett Margaritaville in ( Bolixi, MS) to check out the buffet, it's very very small but they had grilled salmon that night so we stayed it was good. Price about $12.00... Most of the things where burgers, fast foods.. Buffet was about 50ft long. I asked about breakfast she said they use fake eggs. Hope this will help.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Speechgirl36
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just stayed at this hotel for our girl's getaway. We were both so surprised at the lovely lobby and the kindness of the staff. The rooms were huge and very clean. I am very particular about the rooms in which I stay, especially the bathrooms but they were very nice. Breakfast was great and so were the drinks and food in the evening. The streetcar stop is across the street so getting into town is not a problem. If you get a chance, stay at the Drury!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: CarolUpstateNY
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this Drury twice in 4 years and it's our choice when coming to NOLA. Their rooms are large and extremely clean. Very safe location, with ID card for elevator, pool, etc. One block from street car or easy 7 or so blocks to French Qtr. Great staff--very helpful and friendly. Their "Kick-Back" is unbelievable, but get there early or there will a line. Very full breakfast was a great way to start the day. Free coffee, soda and popcorn during the day. Everything you'd want in a hotel and more...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: eastcoastwahine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Drury Inn for a wedding over Memorial Day weekend. The location was great- very close to the cable car line and within walking distance of the river. The room was clean and well kept. Staff were very personable and friendly. In true New Orleans fashion each guest received a card for 3 free drinks during happy hour. I wish that I was able to take advantage of it, but we were super busy with wedding stuff. I did manage to grab a snack during happy hour. It was alright- nachos and hot dogs, but it wasn't as elaborate as the website mentioned. The breakfast, however, was a whole other deal. They had yogurt, cereal, make your own waffles, biscuits, gravy, eggs- it was endless. There were so many options. We did manage to take a dip in the pool which was really nice. It was kind of small but not a big issue since it was empty when we went. There were plenty of lounge chairs and clean towels. The gym, as in many other hotels, was a bit of an afterthought, but there are so many places to walk and run in New Orleans it's not a necessity to have. I would stay here again without any reservations. It was our first trip to a Drury chain but hopefully not our last.

Reviews.Title: “SO AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: jusumgirl
Reviews.Content: Huge rooms, friendly staff and super clean. What do you say? A HAPPY HOUR? Count me in! Breakfast is great with lots to choose from. Parking does cost a pretty penny ($25 a day) but we only stayed one day. Location is very convenient to French Quarter. Definitely will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “perfectly comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Shira K
Reviews.Content: For starters its america, so home of customer service. The heating was broken in our room and they immediately switched us rooms and upgraded us to a suite for the same cost. Its a great location close to everything. They offer a great breakfast buffet and a later afternoon buffet of snack and also alcoholic drinks all for free. The location is quiet besides the tram, you can hear it very clearly. we enjoyed our stay very much

Reviews.Title: “better for large families or people with pets”
Reviews.Author: Kristydietsche
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights over Memorial Day weekend ( Saturday and Sunday ). Myself, husband and baby daughter. This hotel isn't posh. There are no frills. It's a decent place to keep your stuff while you explore the city - that's it. Well, that's what it was for us anyway. While we were there, there was a large group of kids staying there as well. There were at least 30 kids. It was some sort of sports team, aged from about 7 - 10. They were LOUD. They ran, they played ball in the entrance way and they ruined the pool for us. Now, understand. I am not anti kid. I have 4 of my own and I know how kids are. But some of these kids were just out of hand. I know it isn't the hotel's fault, but the atmosphere of the hotel seemed to be accepting of all the yelling and running. Also, **someone** pulled the fire alarm twice one night and the entire hotel had to be evacuated and the fire dept. had to clear the place while we all stood out in the parking lot. NOT HAPPY ABOUT THAT! The room we stayed in was 522. It is a 2 room suite. It was spacious and the carpet was new looking, but the bathroom was not as clean as it should have been. There was mildew in the shower, stray hairs *yuck*, and the jacuzzi tub had seen better days. This is probably a good place to stay for someone who had hungry kids and needs to cut costs though. Because there is a free breakfast in the morning, and snacks and drinks at 5:30pm. The food is just food. It isn't good, but kids don't usually care. There is also free popcorn and sodas from 3pm-10pm. This hotel is pet friendly. I think that's gross, but some people seem to enjoy it. Another downer was that there seemed to only be about 3 luggage carriers in the entire hotel - which you have to load and move yourself. No help from anyone there. I can't say too many good things about my experience here. The valet guys were nice. But that's about it. I wouldn't stay here again unless I was bringing all of my kids and the dog and I didn't have the money to stay anywhere else. Oh, one more thing. It's almost impossible to catch a cab at that hotel. The cabbie told us later that they don't usually pick up from there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: arnoldo33
Reviews.Content: This was a "feel good" hotel with very helpful and friendly staff. Our room was light and spacious. The location was excellent, positioned about 15 minutes stroll from the French Quarter, but with a trolley bus stop right across the road if you felt lazy. There was a nice restaurant over the road at Le Pavilion Hotel, but the Drury Inn has this "kickback" feature where free fast food and drink are served at around 5 p.m. Breakfast was adequate. The only real downside was the $25/day valet parking charge while the car park is out of action due to hotel expansion work - but this will probably only be temporary.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lindabill03
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights. The hotel is deceptive from the outside - it looks very plain and ordinary but it is just the opposite on the inside. The lobby is very attractive and welcoming. The room was clean, comfortable and large with vaulted ceilings and very tastefully decorated. We enjoyed the happy hour with three free alcoholic drinks each and hot and cold snacks. Breakfast was also included - fairly typical choices of cereal, scrambled eggs etc.. The staff were very friendly. It's in a great location - the cable car stops out front and it's an easy 5 minute walk to Bourbon St. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Base for New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: WandererG
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and visited the sights of New Orleans. Walking distance to the French Quarter ands its various nightlife and restaurants. Hotel room spacious and equipped fine if not quite to Hilton/Sheraton standard. Service was great with adequate breakfast and a choice of some hot food around tea time all included in the rate. Only slight drawback was the bar shut by 7pm and there was no formal reataurant ( but plenty of both within 10-15 minutes walk). Free wifi , pool & basic gym add to its good value. Would use again!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at Drury Inn!”
Reviews.Author: doormold
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here for a conference being held at the Hyatt Regency. As usual, we were thrilled with the Drury chain! First of all, the hotel rate was $74/night less than what my traveling partner from work paid to stay at the Hyatt. For the short, five minute walk to the conference, Iâ€™m glad I saved my company a few bucks and would rate this as a great value in New Orleans. The hotel check in was great, but I agree that they need to do something about the parking. For $25/day, youâ€™d think it would be a bit more organized. I guess the hotel construction, when finished, will help with that problem. Otherwise, the valets themselves were responsive and helpful. The front desk was very accommodating; when we asked to extend our stay by one night, Renaldo was gracious enough to make it happen, despite being told on the previous evening that the hotel was sold out. Our room (#804) was clean, comfortable, and quiet despite facing the street. The free wi-fi worked as promised and was actually quite fast (a major accomplishment for most hotels). The lobby was clean and inviting. The breakfast buffet had enough selections, but it was extremely busy and it appeared they could have used a little more staff to manage through that busy time. We did not partake of the evening food and drink, but the happy hour crowd looked pretty happy. We are walkers, and the hotel is convenient to most everything. This made it easy to get around during our night time excursions and my husbandâ€™s daytime matchbook collecting expeditions. Overall, our stay was wonderful. We would not hesitate to stay here again and it is quite clear why the Drury Inn is ranked #1 in New Orleans hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated but a great value”
Reviews.Author: maxbmom
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here and 2 at the Marriott, and we spent the Marriott nights wishing we were here. The place does not look great, but it appears they are about to update it. The location is the central business district, but it is very close to the french quarter and close to lots of streetcars. The best qualities are the size of the room, the free breakfast and happy hour and the free wifi. We went with a toddler and their crib was a little scary. The gym is 2 treadmils, but it has a great view and the pool is on the roof and they provide separate towels.

Reviews.Title: “Drury Inns might be my new favorite chain!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan D
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful. Practically sitting in the French Quarter. Great tv, great breakfast. Location was great. No negatives about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: Vishj
Reviews.Content: very close to french quarters and nearby other 5 star properties. although the rooms are a bit old, the hotel and is staff are good. lots of freebies - meal in the evening, popcorn etc. although the terrace pool is a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mobiushorn
Reviews.Content: Room was in good shape; people at the front desk were very helpful and polite; breakfast was good (when we got up early enough to be able to eat it); nice location near Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Liked some things, but needs improvement in some areas.....”
Reviews.Author: ohcoasterfreak
Reviews.Content: Came here for three days to take in the area. Stayed in a one bedroom suite. I happened to be here on JazzFest so prices were inflated but that's on me. You can't go a weekend without something going on in New Orleans. I went in wanting to be impressed from the reviews it gets but was somewhat underwhelmed. So on to the hotel pros and cons. Pros -Decent rooftop pool and hot tub, if not a bit small. -Right next to the Carondelet(St Charles) street car line so this was a bonus. -Not far, maybe 4 blocks to Bourbon St. or to Canal St. street car line to take you to the French Market, Jackson Square or RiverWalk. -Breakfast and the evening Kickback are nice touches that add value. -Room was acceptable except for the cons below. -I liked the lobby, thought it was classy. -Front desk was pleasant and helpful. -Bed was very comfy. -Wi-Fi was good. Cons -Mold in the bedroom closet ceiling. Don't they check for this kind of thing? -The lighting is not good, at least in my room it wasn't -View from the one small window was terrible. Just an observation. Room 518 so you know. -The room was odd shaped, so tons of wasted space. -Big Con! Beware! This hotel is being renovated! I don't have a problem with that so much as the parking set-up is atrocious because of it. The valets are in constant confusion and never know for sure if your car is coming until it shows up. When it does get there, there is no room to park it because the lot is set up badly for this. When paying 25 dollars to park I need some kind of system I can trust. Either they need to start eating the cost or get a company to handle this better! Overall, I'm still on the fence if I would return to this hotel, maybe after the additions to parking and the expansion are finished I might consider it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: LorLor3
Reviews.Content: Almost afraid to add to the positive comments here -- will prices go up, availability go down? It was a great choice for Jazz Fest. Decent location right on streetcar stop, gorgeous lobby, good security, nice, clean room, beautiful marble bathroom, excellent breakfast. Very pleasant and helpful staff. Didn't make it to the manager's happy hour but it sounds great! Was thrilled to find rooftop pool and spa, but only downside is they don't seem very well-maintained. Will watch with interest the planned expansion of this property. Rates are probably lower (and better value) when it's not a major festival. Hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with excellent perks”
Reviews.Author: northlagirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in early April 2012 and we enjoyed our stay. Good security, although had some problems with our room locks. However they fixed the problem right away. All of the front desk staff were cheerful and helpful. The pool on the rooftop was quite enjoyable. We loved the happy hour time with free drinks and food. The breakfast each morning was wonderful!! Not your average continental breakfast. It is withhin decent (about 3/4 mile) walking distance to the French Quarter and Bourbon St but far enough away to be nice and quiet when sleeping. We had a suite with a king bed and a pull out sofa bed which was plenty of room for 4 of us. The bathroom is large with a huge jacuzzi tub and separate shower. For price and food, a great value!!

Reviews.Title: “All the good reviews on here are spot on!”
Reviews.Author: thecajungent
Reviews.Content: Stayed two days last week at this hotel. While there is construction at the property site, the rooms were nicely appointed, clean and comfortable. The service was excellent, from the valet, to the front desk staff, housekeepers and all staff we came in contact with. I actually started LOOKING for things to find wrong with this place. The only thing I could find was a few broken tiles along the side of the jaccuzzi on the roof top.. Yes, it isn't the Le Pavillion across the street, but value wise, excellent!!! Can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: missy123_rog
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the drury inn suites a couple of weekends ago. Nice rooms, good service, maximum security. You have to have a key to come in the doors, and even go in the elevator. Its withing good walking distance to the superdome and bourbon!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, reasonably priced and conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: TravelswithKids8
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything one could ask for in terms of a moderately priced hotel for families in New Orleans: free breakfasts, free afternoon snacks and drinks, clean rooms and comfortable beds. The hotel is popular with tour groups; there was a large group on a school field trip while we were there, which made it difficult to find seats for breakfast. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite. The bedroom was very spacious, the living room with sleeper sofa not so much. It's one of the quirks about retrofitting a hotel into an office building. The hotel is close to the French Quarter and a block from the trolley car. We didn't use the pool since we were out sightseeing. It's small and it requires two elevators to get there. They have valet parking, ~$25 a day with in and privleges. I can't remember when they're starting the addition for the hotel so check before booking if you don't want to stay there during construction.

Reviews.Title: “St. Patrick's Day and Drury Inn”
Reviews.Author: CasaBella19
Reviews.Content: We took a detour from North Louisiana on our anniversary weekend-forgetting that it was also St. Patrick's Day! We ended up in New Orleans and enjoyed touring many familiar and favorite neighborhoods. We made our way slowing down Magazine Street close to where we onced lived and realized that a St. Patrick's Day parade was wrapping up! Desperate to find accommodations my husband walked into the Drury Inn on Poydras St. and booked the last room of the hotel. The lobby was lively with happy hour and we enjoyed a quick glass of wine before going to our room on the first floor! We were amazed at the quality and comfort considering the low price we were offered! ( Ask for those military and senior discounts.) The staff was courteous and friendly, the room quiet and comfortable! The inn is close to the quarter and cost a mere $6 for a friendly cab ride! We were dropped off right at the start of the parade on Bourbon St and enjoyed a after-parade drink in another hotel on Canal. We were fortunate to meet the Grand Marshall's family and enjoy their story of life in and around New Orleans! Parking is extra but well worth the price and peace of mind knowing your car is being cared for in an off-site location.

Reviews.Title: “Save a bundle in comfortable surroundings”
Reviews.Author: thee_whiz
Reviews.Content: Pleasant staff, very comfortable room, free drinks, free food and a 5 minute walk to the French Quarter at a great price compared to "In the French Quarter." Only one whiney complaint - $25 ++ per night for the car.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for touring”
Reviews.Author: Barb41
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value, excellent location, and great staff. It offers hot breakfast items and a 5:30 kickback buffet; baked potato, chicken strips, hot dogs, mac and cheese, plus three drinks apiece. Soft drinks, coffee, and popcorn were available throughout the day until 10:00 pm. For $25 a day they offer off-site secured parking which is well worth it. If you cross the street from this hotel, you can catch the St. Charles streetcar. We purchased a day pass for $3, and you can get on and off any of the buses/streetcars in the city. We were there three days and had no need to use our vehicle. A must see is the World War II museum. There is a combination ticket for the Insectarium, Aquarium, Zoo and Imax, but they were closed on Monday so we did not get to do that. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: erin k
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and a group of friends stayed here during our friend's wedding. This place exceeded our expectations in every way. It is clean and organized and the staff is very friendly. It is located close to everywhere you want to go in New Orleans. What really makes this place, though, are the perks: the free WiFi worked without any problems, the nightly happy hour was perfect for our group to get together before going out, and the free breakfast in the morning was a great way to start the day. If you go during the warmer months, make sure to check out the rooftop pool. It is clean and the view is great!

Reviews.Title: “a friendly home away from home”
Reviews.Author: cindyBuffalo_NewYork
Reviews.Content: Decided to take a vacation at the last minute & after checking out places on-line decided on the Drury Inn & Suites. Great Choice! The hotel was fantastic! Starting with the lobby & the staff, very friendly and helpful to the room which was well furnished and super clean! The location was within walking distance of the French Quarter but far enough to get a good quiet nights sleep. Will go back to New Orleans and will stay at the Drury again!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the ports, French Quaters”
Reviews.Author: senior306
Reviews.Content: After our family cruise we had booked a room here. We got the to hotel way before check in time, once we got off the ship. They got us checked in , allowed us to park our car and had the room ready w/I hour to hour half. The French Quaters are not a far walk maybe 4-5 blocks or walk across the street and ride the street car. The breakfast was good, something my family of 5 could enjoy what was served. The evening cocktail hr was good. The parking rate was a little steep $25 and it's only valet parking. The pool and hot tub are on the roof, which are a decent size plus the views of downtown . The rooms were decent size , beds were comfortable. Would stay here again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Stayed a few days before a crusie”
Reviews.Author: Hart10
Reviews.Content: Beyond my expectations. Very fine people and great rooms. I love the location as it was close to everything however not in any of areas I would not want to be after midnight. Loved the kickbacks great option. we had large nice lunches and just a bit at night. You will not be disapointent

Reviews.Title: “Being pampered in New Orlean”
Reviews.Author: Gabrielle27
Reviews.Content: The French Quarter has an Ora of it's Own. It's A place no-one should ever touch. If you have never been there Please go for yourself. Thank You

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, good location, but wondering about the gym”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoLiketoTravel
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel a lot. Really nice staff, clean, fun and historic, and located right across the street from a trolley stop. My only complaint is that one of the reasons I booked this hotel was because it said it had a gym/exercise room. Where? There were two treadmills and one bike crowded together in a room. No weights or even room to stretch in. Why say you have one?

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons of our stay at the Drury...”
Reviews.Author: hfitzger
Reviews.Content: I booked the Drury New Orleans based on the glowing reviews that I had read on TripAdvisor for our post-cruise hotel. While we found some of the positive experiences that I had read from shared reviews, we also had some not-so-good issues that clouded my opinion of this hotel. To the hotel management's credit, they made it right (i.e., reversal of paid cost for night), but I would hesistate to stay here again, particularly since we had just stayed at the Renaissance Arts a week earlier pre-cruise for a lower rate (which offsets the free food at the Drury) and a much better experience and hotel atmosphere. Pros: Staff was friendly and helpful; free popcorn in afternoon is a nice offering; our children enjoyed the rooftop pool; location was good for being away from hustle and noise of Canal Street and French Quarter, yet within walking distance and on the St. Charles streetcar line. Cons: Cleanliness of room. While the room appeared to be generally clean, there were some very specific (gross) items that were found in the tub, on a blanket, and on the hair dryer (not to mention a french fry in plain view under the sofa). This may have been a fluke on the part of housekeeping, but it did put a damper on our experience and our impression of the hotel. We normally only book through Marriott, and have never had any problem such as this before.

Reviews.Title: “"Great time in New Orleans"”
Reviews.Author: ScottSlice
Reviews.Content: Went to New Orleans for the Final four as first time visitors. The Hotel met all of our needs, The location was great, the staff was great, the room was great and the food was more than adequate. We were able to walk everywhere, didn't even have to rent a car, We spent 4 full days and were able to see a lot of New Orleans. We caught a trolley 2 blocks away on St Charles street and headed out towards the garden district and Tulane University. The architecture and the big houses were a pleasure to see (Get the 3 dollar trolley pass- good for all day on the trolley and bus systems which will take you anywhere you want to go until four in the morning. There is store that sells fruit just a block away and there is a neat little pizza place two blocks away Reginelli's Pizzeria on Poydras Street (try the combo) so good we went back three times. The WWII museum is worth the visit, Again, you can catch a trolley and be there in less than 10 minutes. The Flea market in the French Quarter is a cool place to shop, again accessible by walking or trolley. and you can meander down to Bourbon Street on foot and get happy feet listening to the great music (a 10-15 minute walk). The NOPD were great, There was police presence everywhere, Not to rain on anybody's parade but just to make sure everyone had a good time So you felt safe whether it was four in the afternoon or four in the morning. Had reservations about going to New Orleans but by the time the trip was over I was a full blown ambassador for New Orleans. Again, Thanks to the folks at the Drury for helping make this such a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “# 1 rated three star hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuePhoenix
Reviews.Content: # 1 rated three star hotel (as I believe was advertised in the elevator) just about sums it up. Although a little dated, the rooms were clean. I wished the windows would open though. The lobby area is very nice. The hotel staff is helpful. I asked them to print my boarding pass later in the afternoon to get me in Group A of Southwest Airlines, and they were very helpful that way. The rooftop pool is simple, but adequate enough....lots of sun! The exercise room was very small with only two treadmills. The (hot) breakfast buffet and 5:30 kick off hour/food are a nice addition. You must swipe your room card to access the elevator, which is a nice security feature. The rooms have a mini frig and microwave. It is a short, safe walk to Canal St./Bourbon St., Riverwalk & casino. I would probably stay here again, although I do think there is something nice about the ambience (and getting a hotel with a little patio in a courtyard) of actually staying in the French Quarter but it's more expensive. If you are traveling with children, you will DEFINATELY get your $$$$$ worth on the buffets alone! One other point, if you have a fear of dogs do not stay here as they allow dogs in the rooms/elevators/hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Good as it gets.”
Reviews.Author: TheTorrington5
Reviews.Content: This wasn't my first choice of hotel but due to the Final Four being in town the same weekend we were due to catch a cruise ship (very bad timing) we struggled to get accommodation. Thank goodness we didn't get in our hotel of choice which was straight on Bourbon St and totally inappropriate when travelling with children. The Drury was great. Large bedroom with 2 big beds, clean and fully functioning. Only downside is no safety deposit box but the main reception will let you use one there for free. Breakfast is fine and the Kick Back snacks are ok but after eating for 1 day your not so keen to go back. Hotel could do with clamping down on the homeless people who sneak in for free coffee. Free wi-fi and free soft drinks from 3pm until 10pm. 3 free alcoholic drinks per adult each night too and they'll even make a cocktail for you. Not too far to walk from all the attractions but far enough away from the madness. If you catching a cruise, we managed to walk from hotel with all our luggage no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, great value.”
Reviews.Author: jeff6
Reviews.Content: Took TA's advice, and glad we did. Lots of small free extras -- hot breakfast, happy hour -- and unfailingly polite staff. A bit of a walk to French Quarters, but definitely within range with comfy shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Easter Weekend stay at the Drury”
Reviews.Author: YankeeinFL
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent a three day Easter weekend at the Drury in New Orleans. The location is very good. It is about a 10 minute walk to the Canal Street edge of the French Quarter. It is also very close to the St Charles Avenue Street Car Line ($1.25 each way if you would like to go into the Garden District or even farther up river.) It is about a 15 minute walk to the Superdome and to the next door New Orleans Arena (The Hive). Go Hornets! The free breakfast at the Drury is a real bonus. The breakfast food choices (eggs, waffles, sausage, french toast and biscuits and gravy were more than adequate. In the evening they offer "heavy snacks" along with three free drinks. Free self serve pepsi products are available 24/7 and popcorn is available for an evening light snack. The hotel service was fine. Our very basic guest room was not huge but we didn't seem to mind. They have 2 computers with printers available in the lobby for guest use for things like checking in for flights and printing of boarding passes. I also used the guest computer for a little surfing. They have a small, but nice, roof top pool and hot tub. Towels are available in the pool area. There are a few restaurants nearby, including the Bon Ton Cafe (only open M-F) at the corner of Magazine and Poydras. But there are hundreds of other excellent restaurants scattered throughout New Orleans, including some within reasonably easy walking distance in the French Quarter or Central Business District. The cab to and from the airport was $56 each way plus tip, for our family of four. It seemed to be about a 15 minute ride to the airport from the Drury. For Roman Catholics, you have a couple of nearby choices for Mass while at the Drury. We walked over for Easter Sunday Mass at Saint Patrick's (724 Camp St.). We were in and out in 45 minutes.My children really appreciated the brevity of the Mass.To summarize, we liked the Drury a lot. We would probably go back to the Drury in a future visit to New Orleans. Excellent value for the price. Very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Super cool decor, close to French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Bud-n-Sissy126
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with the entire stay at this hotel. Exceeded our expectations for decor, service, and quality for the price we were paying in downtown New Orleans. Nice sized rooms in this converted office building. They really put out a nice breakfast and the 5:30 - 7pm happy hour with adult drinks was unbelievable. It's only a couple blocks from Canal Street and the French Quarter. We walked to and from multiple times, and they were the most quiet, uneventful walks we've ever had. We didn't worry about being alone late at night. The walk to the French Quarter is quick, and the cross street leads right into Bourbon Street! We walked everywhere - to the Riverwalk, to the French Market, and it all seemed like short distances and well lighted.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in town!”
Reviews.Author: b52-befiftytwo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 3 18year olds for the Final Four. Absolutely perfect location. At the corner of Burbon (well, it turns into Burbon at Canal) and Poydras which is 4 blocks or so from the Super Dome. Had a corner two room suite. Good Breakfast, better snack bar in the evening. Don't really need dinner if you are on a budget. Staff is wonderful. Location even better. Wish the windows would open but the building is old and lovely. They are about to embark on an addition and remodel. Probably would still request the original part of the hotel when we come again. Will stay here whenever we are New Orleans. If only OSU had won. . . . . .

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality”
Reviews.Author: Margo H
Reviews.Content: Hotel a few blocks away from the French Quarter. It is also convenient to transit. The room we received was a good size and comfortable. The hotel offers a good continental breakfast in the morning, popcorn and fountain drinks in the afternoon, and kickbacks starting at 5.30pm. There was some good munchies especially for teenagers. There offer free wi fi, which was added bonus. We would stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: jawouds
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Drury for two nights pre cruise and were very pleased with location and "extras" It's a short walk to the French Quarter and very safe for walking at night. Evening happy hour was a bonus - three drinks and a buffet of food that could fill you up (but save a little room for enjoying New Orleans food) Lobby was spacious and nice. Our room (suite) was great - we were with several other couples so it made it easy to sit down with them while waiting for others. It was also nice in the morning as I get up much earlier than my husband and could just let him sleep. Breakfast buffet was typical Hampton fare - very filling (but again save room for some beignets at Cafe DuMonde - cab fare there was $7/pp btw)

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the cost”
Reviews.Author: palma05
Reviews.Content: Positives: Free Internet- Good Hot & cold BB- Great Kickback with 2 Drinks pp/pd & enough food for a meal - Rooftop pool & spa -Parking lot free, gated/secure - Great front desk -Good location with 1 block walk to St.Charles Cable Car, 1/4 ml walk to Canal St French Quarter, far enough for quiet night's sleep - Downstairs available conference room and reading areas - Spacious, clean lobby, friendly staff. Room has microwave/mini-fridge/safe, dresser with extra drawers, bathroom has extra towel bars and hooks, full closet. Drawbacks: Hotel and room furniture appears comfy but needs replacing as many have stains and show wear down. Standard double bedroom are small sized, lighting is poor, room is dark, only one window. Sparse fitness room. No room service, concierge, or bell captain/bell hops. Toilet/Tub/Shower area small yet adequate. Would return but upgrade to a suite for room and desk space. (Actual stay January 2011)

Reviews.Title: “outside french quarter”
Reviews.Author: vicsdahlias
Reviews.Content: just a 5-10 min walk to french quarter,a few mins. to canal street. st . charles street car on corner. We liked that it was alittle away from the quarter. rousses market around the the block ( good & decent prices)They have breakfast & 5:30pm kick back .ok food,it helps if you want to save,especially with a family.Suite was nice.Valet guys were really good.We left car in lot & walked every where,took tours & street cars.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful meals and drinks provided, and great for pet owners”
Reviews.Author: Ashley J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stopped in New Orleans for a day on a road trip from Georgia to Texas. We loved staying at the Drury for many reasons. We had our dog with us, mini schnauzer, and were able to leave him in the room while we did the touristy thing through the French Quarter, and the hotel provided a wonderful treat for him. The breakfast and kickback were wonderful and a great money saver because we were able to eat at the kickback instead of buying dinner, not to mention the free drinks we got with the kickback. The staff was friendly from the moment we showed up. The best part was the location. My husband and I were able to walk to and around the French Quarter from our hotel, but we were far enough away from all the action to have a quiet and relaxing time in our room. Although we didn't have extra time for the pool/hot tub, we did check it out. It was rooftop and we would have definitely utilized it if we had extra time. This is a great place and value for couples, families with kids, or pet owners!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Excellent Breakfast & KickBack meals, Professional Staff”
Reviews.Author: DaveRamseySays
Reviews.Content: We had one unfortunate experience during our one night stay that is described below in the email that I sent to the general manager, Slade Stratman, on 3/21/12. I paid $225 plus taxes for our one night stay in a room with two double beds (way too small), but was changed to a room with a king and a fold out bed in the living room. I don't feel I was over charged for the room, but I would have liked to have paid a little less. The location of the hotel is excellent. "I am writing to make you aware of an unfortunate issue with our one night stay in your hotel. This was also the first time that any of us had stayed in a Drury Inn. First let me begin by saying that your staff members were professional, experienced, courteous and pleasant. I hope that they are recognized for their service to their employer and guests, and that the hotel continues to employ similarly enthusiastic individuals. A young man who was the valet upon our arrival was polite and helpful when we arrived at the parking lot. I can't recall his name, but I understand that he and Kristen at the front desk are friends, and she will recall about whom I am speaking. Unfortunately upon our departure, a tall dark haired young man who was the valet at that time handed us our car key, accepted the gratuity and then departed into the hotel leaving the three of us ladies (two seniors and myself) to put all of our luggage into the trunk ourselves... Upon check in and check out, Kristen at the front desk was efficient and courteous despite the tremendous guest traffic and constantly ringing telephone. Immediately after arriving in our room we realized that it would not comfortably accommodate us, and I returned to the front desk whereupon I was attended by Leah who immediately acknowledged me and assisted with a satisfactory room change. Later that evening when I called for more pillows and blankets, Leah immediately brought them upstairs which was appreciated because it was already late in the evening and my mother in law was ready for bed. In the past at other hotels, I've waited as long as a few hours to receive additional linens although they were needed immediately. As an aside, the mattress on the foldout bed in room 818 really needs to be replaced. It was quite thin and uncomfortable and for this reason we requested more blankets and sheets to add as padding. It would have been great if an egg carton mattress pad had been available instead of attempting to use sheets and blankets to make the mattress more comfortable. The next day when we encountered the issue that I will discuss below, I was assisted by Jamie. When I explained the situation to her, she assured me that she would address the matter not only with housekeeping, but also escalate the matter to management. As we left the hotel for the day, I felt confident that she would do so. During our brief time in your hotel, we did encounter the housekeeper responsible for our room, Leovina, multiple times in the hallway as she cleaned other rooms. Each time she greeted us and smiled. Finally, we were surprised and pleased with the complimentary breakfast and kickback refreshments. The early breakfast allowed us to maximize our short time in our first visit to New Orleans. As to the issue at hand, the subject of this email provides the basic complaint. As I was getting into bed for the evening, I noticed a piece of trash on the floor immediately beneath the corner of the bed, but dismissed it as a receipt that I might have dropped earlier in the day. I decided I would pick it up in the morning when I canvassed the room before checkout. In the morning, my mother picked it up with her bare hands and realized that it was a used Trojan Condom wrapper. Of course, my mother was alarmed and disgusted, as was my mother in law and myself. I immediately called the front desk whereupon I spoke with Jamie. Upon checking out, Jamie informed me that she had indeed discussed the matter with management and that our stay would be complimentary. She also asked me to send you this email in order to facilitate the reversal of the charge on my credit card. I look forward to your reply."

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Silvercreeker
Reviews.Content: This is the most elegant Drury Inn we have stayed in, with beautiful decor in the common areas. Jamie at the front desk is one of the nicest, most personable people I've ever dealt with. The streetcar stops right on the corner outside of the hotel, which is very convenient. You must pay with exact change, and can purchase an all-day pass for only $3. when you embark. When I made the reservation on the chain's website, I was redirected to a phone number because this hotel had limited availability. I was told that there were only 2 rooms available on our dates (March 15 & 16, 2012), and they were both smoking, with 1 kingsize bed. I wanted non-smoking and 2 double beds. I made the reservation anyhow, with the assurance that if there were cancellations of the rooms I requested, we'd get one. The day before our arrival, Drury Inns sent me an e-mail and made a phone call to inform me there had been no cancellations. But we were enroute, so I didn't get the messages. When I checked in, I told Jamie I really preferred non-smoking, and she checked her computer and learned one had just become available. I was very happy. My only criticism is that, with a huge number of guests, they should have had more help at the free 5:30 Kickback. There was only one bartender, and one person serving the food. This caused long lines to form at each station.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea W
Reviews.Content: My family --husband, 8 year old son, and my parents stayed-- here for one night over March Break. I had never stayed at a Drury Inn before, but decided to give it a try based on the reviews. We arrived early and our rooms weren't ready yet, but the desk staff were great! They helped us decide between a number of different tours of the city, called and made reservations for tours for us, and went out of their way to help us plan our time in New Orleans. We had two rooms --a king suite and a king room-- both of which were great! They were clean, nicely decorated, and had awesome bathrooms! We enjoyed the free food and drinks at the 5:30 kickback as well as the breakfast in the morning. We also tried out the rooftop pool, which my husband and son loved! Definitely a great view! Overall it was a great stay. The location was a short walk to the French Quarter and a longer, but pleasant walk to the river and aquarium. If you're looking for a conveniently located hotel with nice rooms for a reasonable price, go with this one!

Reviews.Title: “Jamie at the front desk was awesome”
Reviews.Author: Ilovetotravel2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Mardi Gras and had a great time. Jamie at the front desk was so friendly and helpful. She greeted us whenever we came and went and called us by name. The hotel has a very positive energy about it and it is because of great staff like Jamie. This is the second time that we have stayed at this hotel and will always check this hotel first when we visit New Orleans. The rooms and hotel were very clean and we always felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “No Major Complaints but no big praise either”
Reviews.Author: stoner299
Reviews.Content: I'd definitely say it met most of my families basic needs. Price for room - I have 3 kids so it's nice to be able to find a reasonable price for a 2-room suite that fits all of us rather than having to use 2 rooms. On average I paid 137 per night for our 2 room suite - pretty good for New Orleans. The room wasn't that great on presentation though - carpets not real clean and everything else just ok. Staff & service - not bad. The free breakfast is best described as "you get what you pay for" but get there early or you won't have a seat. There were many foreigners and elderly in groups for some reason during our stay which made some of the lines for drinks and breakfast extra long. The 5:30 kickback is good for the free alcoholic drinks which was by far the best perk Drury had to offer. The elevators were acting up the entire time we were there and eventually they shut one down while we were there. Location - again not bad but not great. It's quite a walk into french quarter. It's almost 1 mile to cafe du monde and jackson square...about a 1/4 mile to the edge of quarter on Canal st. The walk wasn't dangerous but we did walk by a couple street sleepers on the way back one night(this was at 8pm mind you) - again not terrible but could be better. You pay $25/night for parking and then they have valet that goes about 20 feet to get your car....seems like an unnecessary addition. All in all I probably wouldn't choose to stay there again simply because I'd rather be within closer walking distance of the places I like to visit in french quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly place”
Reviews.Author: bigbluefan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from The Drury after attending mens SEC BB tournament.We did arrive early around 10 AM.We had to wait around an hour for check in for our room.The hotel is very clean and housekeeping did a very good job.We had a couple of requests and they were immediately taken care of.The breakfast had a great selection,waffles,sausage,eggs,biscuits&gravy.Oatmeal and fresh fruit.We didn't do the evening offerings as we ate our evening meal out.Our room was a king room on the corner.The room was large, well lit ,and comfortable.While the room wasn't plush it was quiet and suited us just fine.The location is right next to the St Charles streetcar and just a short walk to the quarter.

Reviews.Title: “We're Back! and the Drury is Still Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: TO_Trips
