Reviews.Content: A block from the Mardi Gras parades. Good breakfast. 5.30 Kickback with snacks and drinks. Rooftop pool and hot tub (watched some of the parade from the railing!) Easy walk to Bourbon and the Vieux Carre (which is, well, insane during Mardi Gras). Fabulous, attentive, friendly service. And all for an extremely reasonable price! I travel a lot for business, we travel a lot for pleasure. Drury is one of the best values we've ever enjoyed!

Reviews.Title: “More than expected!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brittney H
Reviews.Content: Ok, let me start by saying I do not care for hotels so it's rare that I'm impressed by one. I recently visited the New Orleans for the first time the weekend after Mardi Gras. We decided to walk around before checking in and it became late in the day. I received a call from the hotel manager who called to let me know they would still hold our room for us. I thought that was very nice. We arrived at the hotel and I was skeptical when I saw the outside of the building. My boyfriend reassured me that inside was probably much nicer and most buildings in New Orleans look like that on the outside. I was amazed from the moment we stepped foot in the lobby!!! The staff were courteous and the room was more than clean. I always inspect the bed and the shower upon entering my room and I couldn't find ONE thing to complain about, which is very rare lol. We also went down to the 5:30 Kickback where the hotel provided free food and and drinks. Overall, our stay was well worth every penny spent!! I have to say this will be my hotel of choice from now on whenever I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Now I know why this is #1 in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: KB1950
Reviews.Content: I am SO impressed with the New Orleans Drury Inn! I travel quite a bit, and am tired of overpriced big hotels that charge for everything on top of a premium price. I've also experienced some of the dirtiest rooms and the worst service in these big hotels. I read about the Drury on Tripadvisor and decided to give it a try. Wow!!! It's a beautiful hotel, well maintained. The staff was friendly and welcoming. The room was large and comfortable, and the bathroom well laid out. It's not HUGE, so it's fast and easy to get to the room. The added bonus of breakfast and an evening snack and drinks was just wonderful. They even had popcorn, which I thoroughly enjoyed while watching the Oscars! I felt like I was visiting family. I will recommend this hotel, and if I'm ever in New Orleans again I will be very happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “First stay at a Drury”
Reviews.Author: gottman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Mardi Gras. Place was packed but staff did an excellent job in keeping everything clean. Hot tub on roof could have been a bit warmer but it was enjoyable and a interesting vantage point for a parade. Over all I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place Near the French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: Frances D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel the weekend before Mardi Gras. I was a bit apprehensive because of some reviews but overall I was pleased. The staff was very nice and helpful. We left our room early in the morning and several days near noon and upon our return our room was nice and tidy. We had a jacuzzi suite and it was quite spacious...enough room for much more than two people. There are two full size closets, mini fridge, flat panel TV, livingroom, and separate bedroom. The short walk to the French Quarter was nice and there is a Domino's just around the corner for an evening snack...or there are many nicer places that deliver to the hotel. Maybe the only little thing that kind of bothered us was the view. I am not sure if all jacuzzie suites are situated in the back corner of the hotel but our view was faced west and consisted primarily of two brick walls bordering the parking lot and some buildings off in the distance. Since we didn't spend much time in our room, the view did not bother us much. It was our first trip to New Orleans for some of the Mardi Gras festivities and we look forward to staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Valerie H
Reviews.Content: It lived up to all the reviews I read. Yes it is not a swanky 5 star but it clean, centrally located, good price, easy to get everwhere, and the people were very nice!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for Mardi Gras”
Reviews.Author: Cubechick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here both before a cruise and during Mardi Gras. I thought the location very good. Just a few blocks from the French Quarter (the cross street Carondelet turns into Bourbon Street) and one block north of St. Charles. The price of your room includes wi-fi, complimentary breakfast, popcorn in the afternoon, and sodas all day. In the evening from 5:30 to 7:00 they offer free hot and cold snacks (chicken fingers, hot dogs, macaroni and cheese, chips, etc) and up to three complimentary cocktails. Be advised though that all of this food does not mean they have a restaurant or a bar. They do not. The rooms we stayed in were clean, but a bit dated with thin bedspreads and somewhat lumpy pillows. For Mardi Gras they issued wrist bands so that only people staying in the hotel could enter. They also closed a second entrance so that everyone had to pass by security. I appreciated the added security as Mardi Gras is a crazy time. Judging from the number of wrist bands I saw during our three days, I am guessing this is a common practice with a lot of the hotels. All of the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. Overall I would recommend this hotel and would likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Rick_Melinda
Reviews.Content: This is our first time staying at a Drury and we'll definitely be back! Location was excellent: about a 5 minute walk to Bourbon Street, so close enough but also far enough away to have some peace & quiet to sleep. Staff were excellent: extremely helpful! Restaurant tips: The Red Fish Grill has THE BEST po'boys. The Ste. Marie Restaurant about a block away on Poydras is fantastic (so fantastic that we ate there twice in 3 days)!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property!”
Reviews.Author: LovetoTravel9308
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews first, which why I booked this hotel, and then was able to get a great price -bonus!!. Its close to the French Quarter, Riverwalk and the WWII Museum. Everything is within walking distance. The hotel breakfast and Kickback are both outstanding and plentiful. We had great customer service and the accomodation was clean, up to date and attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: tdf531
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight before leaving on a cruise. Great location. We walked to Bourbon Street, Jackson Square and other attractions in the area. We had happy hour in evening and a good breakfast in the morning. Pool is on top floor outside--great view. The next day we even walked with our luggage to board the cruise ship.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: WorkToTravel827
Reviews.Content: This past weekend my husband and I stayed at the Drury for 4 nights and had a great experience. Check in and out was very easy. The room was a great size (we had a king room) and super clean. The staff is what really made this hotel amazing. One night at about 3AM, after drinking on Bourbon, my husband and I woke up thirsty. He tried every vending machine and they were all out of water. I called down to the front desk and the employee there was very apologetic - stating they were having problems with the delivery man filling the machines - and had 2 bottles of water free of charge at the front desk for us. Every time we had questions about the area someone was more than happy to he us out and the night before we checked out they even scheduled a cab to take us to the airport the next day. The walk to all the action was very close. It was probably about 4 short blocks. With all the parades and Mari Gras madness going on we were happy to be staying away from the noise. Plus, although we didn't use it, the trolley stops right outside. The free happy hour was a great treat as well! The 3 free drinks per person was a great way to start off our nights in Burbon. The food was ok. It seemed just like frozen apps you can get at Costco but if you're going to NOLA, you shouldn't be eating free hotel food anyway! Our two minor issues were: when the people in the room next to us took a shower (at 2am mind you) the water running next door was VERY loud. We were lucky that it only happened once so we didn't have to switch rooms. And one night we called down for another blanket and they said they were out. We just adjusted the temp in room and we were all good. All in all we loved our stay at the Drury and will definitely be staying here again on our next visit to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, close to French Quarter, Street Cars etc”
Reviews.Author: Wesley1111
Reviews.Content: Will avoid repeating much of what has already been said about this hotel, suffice to say it offers good size rooms, decent prices and is close the main attractions. Breakfast is reasonable, the usual fare and the 5:30 free food and alcohol is a popular attraction. The food is basic but plenty of people seemed to be stocking up with full plates so I guess it works if you don't want to eat out. We did enjoy a glass of wine - whats not to like! Also free sodas, coffee etc available pretty much all day. The hotel is close to the green street car, the inward loop passes on Carondolet Street right outside and one block down if you want outbound. Its only a few blocks to Canal Street and the French Quarter so we didn't bother waiting for the street car. It felt perfectly safe to walk back to the hotel. We did walk down to the river to get that streetcar line down to the French Market. Its a brisk 10 minute walk to the river but check the times as they are not very frequent after 7pm. Don't bother with a hire car unless you plan to travel out of town, its $33 by taxi from the airport. Streetcar is $3 for a day ticket. Drury looked after our luggage for us on the last morning. Staff there are very helpful and pleasant. A great choice for New Orleans,

Reviews.Title: “Drury is a great value in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: miznovember
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed at the Drury a few days in advance of our cruise out of New Orleans and everyone seemed very happy with their rooms, the service, the hosted happy hour, and the food. The hotel is within walking distance of the Quarter and the route there is well lit and safe. We enjoyed the hot appetizers and three free drinks apiece at happy hour. Though it's an older hotel, the rooms are quiet, updated and well appointed, our bed was comfortable, and the lobby is attractive and inviting. The staff was helpful. The hot breakfast is tasty with a wide variety of food. If there's any downside at all, it's the fee for parking, but we didn't have (or need) a vehicle, so it wasn't an issue. I feel like we received a great value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: fritzi_12
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay of three nights in December. The room was nice and clean and will sttay there next time we go. The staff was so friendly and went out of there way to please.Great hot breakfast,snacks in the afternoon a free special treat of free drinks and hot snacks.Close to every thing.WE will be back soon. Pat H

Reviews.Title: “so comfortable”
Reviews.Author: covanderhoek
Reviews.Content: you can find the drury hotels in several states, i went to three drury hotels and i really liked to stay with them. it looks like an ordinary hotel but it isn't. the atmosphere is really good. the employees are truly friendly and helpful. they welcome families in particular, but as a solo traveler - for sure - you will not feel misplaced. if you want to travel trough the states where you can find a drury, you definitely should go there. spacious, warm interiors and with happy hour every day ...

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Travis S
Reviews.Content: Here's the quick and dirty, this hotel is very nice, clean, and quiet. Has a solid free breakfast in the morning and an amazing afternoon snack in the afternoons with free beer and alcohol. Pool and hot tub even looked nice. Free internet woohoo. BUT..... When we went....on a weekend....for a bachelor party....it felt more like I was visiting my grandma at the old folks home. Old people like free food and booze so just imagine the 20 minute line there was in the afternoons. That's basically the only bad thing I can say about it. Everything else was fantastic. In the end, they didn't bother us, and we didn't bother them, everyone had a good time. This place would be perfect for business travelers or anyone that doesn't want to be right in the middle of the party. If you are there to see and enjoy and drink everything in the french quarter, get something a little more centrally located you can pop in and out of.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: naomiq
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Drury while we were in town for a college football Bowl game. I booked the Drury because of location to the Superdome and previous experience with other Drury's. This could not have been a more perfect stay! We were in the best location for walking to the dome, and not far from Bourbon for our walk back later that night....er...the next morning! :) I think they have the best parking rate and you don't have to wait on valet to get your car for you...I don't mind getting my own. I wish we had been able to take advantage of the evening drinks and snacks, but we were having our own with friends tailgating. And we slept too late to enjoy the breakfast, but we love that they offer those. Check out time was at 11am, we woke up at 10:50. I called down to request a late check out and instead of stating how long we could take, they ASKED us when we'd like to check out. I was thoroughly impressed by that! We had a corner room and it was wonderful. Perfectly cleaned and a great jetted tub. I would definitely stay at the Drury again, wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “As typical as Drury gets”
Reviews.Author: punkinlr
Reviews.Content: If you have ever read any of my reviews of the Drury Inn's, you'll find this no different. By far one of the best places to stay, anywhere. They really have it all together. The staff are the best, the kick-back is fantastic and the breakfast is as good. In my opinion Drury offers one of the quietest hotels we've ever stayed at. Within walking distance to the Casino, French Quarter and Bourbon Street. We highly recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: igrsod
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was clean and quiet. The staff were super helpful. The free food was great. Not necessarily the best quality, but it was great to not have to pay for one or two meals each day. We loved having a few free drinks before we hit the streets of the French Quarter each night. Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Just stay here!”
Reviews.Author: katelynno
Reviews.Content: If you are even thinking of staying here, JUST DO IT!! The staff was wonderful, the location is great, the rooms are spacious and the snacks/breakfast are fabulous. We stayed here 2 nights before our cruise with my parents and 2 young children. The hotel was clean and beautiful. We felt very safe in the area. We had the 2 room suite and we had PLENTY of room.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: kcsu
Reviews.Content: I would tell anyone to stay at this Drury Hotel. The location is great. Walking distance from waterfront, restaurants. It felt like a safe area. It is on the streetcar line. The hotel is beautiful and very clean. The staff so nice and helpful. We chatted with the manager several times during our stay. They provide breakfast and snacks at dinner as well as drinks. We stayed here before our cruise. A short taxi ride to pier. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the free food and drinks!”
Reviews.Author: Nell417
Reviews.Content: There's nothing special in the ambience or character of this Dury Inn. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and the staff polite. If you want French Quarter character you should choose another, probably more expensive hotel. However, what makes the Drury Inn valuable is the great free breakfast and the Happy Hour. The breakfast has hearty food like scrambled egg, biscuits, gravy, and sausage, as well as a nice selection of yoghurts, cereal etc. The Happy Hour gives you three free drinks; they are a little watery, but they're free! Best of all, however, is the "snacks" that come with the Happy Hour. They are actually a meal. Last week I had a baked potato with sour cream, a hot dog, nachos, and beans. Now, presubmably if you're in NOLA as a tourist you'll be going out to a local restaurant for dinner, and rightly so. But if, like me, you're in the Central Busines District for meetings and you're too tired to walk to a restaurant, you can really fill up on the food that the Drury offers and skip a meal. That's worth it to me.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with a great staff.”
Reviews.Author: kellkat2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here pre-cruise. It was a comfortable hotel with great accomidations. The location was within walking distance from everything we did. The perks, such as the breakfast, snacks, light meal in the evening with coctails was icing on the cake. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: RovingProfessor
Reviews.Content: The Drury Inn is not as close to the action as many other hotels in New Orleans, although it is only a block or two further and walking distance to the French Quarter and Superdome. I actually prefer the Drury to many hotels when I travel. They tend to offer the basics and cater to their clients. This includes happy hours and free food in the evenings. And you canâ€™t beat a hotel that provides free safe parking for their customers. That right there lowers the cost of staying here about $40.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: LuvMyLuLu
Reviews.Content: Front desk and other staff was very professional. I enjoyed being appreciated for staying here. The rooms are a good size and clean. The breakfast is nothing special but I would definitely stay here again. I also liked the fact that they take dogs. They didn't have any grassy areas for her nearby, but we made do. Great place to stay! We took a cab everywhere at night. I wouldn't walk around here after dark. Try any Brennan's restaurant for good food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: SierraGuy56
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over New Years with extended family, including our neice, her husband and their 1 year old. Very convenient location. We were able to walk to Bourbon Street, Jackson Square, and Canal St. easily and safely, day and night. There was an excellent grocery store around the corner (Rouse's), selling everything from baby wipes to fine wine. Very convenient. The 5:30 kickback and the free breakfast is a great value for families and better than expected. The front staff went out of their way to make our stay comfortable, especially Ronaldo. The only issue was the beds in our room were a bit soft for us. But this was minor. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: abhaya108
Reviews.Content: Lodged at the Drury in NOLA for a work-related training. Great location right on the trolley line...walking distance to Mother's. Walk to French Quarter. Room very comfy. Really liked the breakfast and the happy hour drinks and snacks. Very good value. No restaurant on site, but good breakfast & evening snacks (included). Go to French Qtr for meals or Mother's. I walked across the street and got a bread pudding to go from Le Pavilion (wow!)

Reviews.Title: “Charming and affordable!”
Reviews.Author: yew_hall
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 3 nights in May 2011 after a cruise. The staff was friendly and helpful, and our room was comfortable, spacious and clean. The building has old-style class and charm. When we reserved we requested a small refrigerator with a freezer unit (to re-freeze cooler pack for my husband's insulin); it was present when we arrived, but not freezing properly -- it was fixed promptly and worked fine the rest of our stay. The breakfast buffet was much nicer than average and includes do-it-yourself waffles. (Make sure to get to the breakfast within the stated hours -- they are serious about shutting down on time.) The free drink and snack time each evening was a nice perk, though we were only present for it once -- too many other things to do in the area! The rooftop pool and hot tub looked great, but the weather was a little too cool to make use of them while we were there -- go up for the area view even if you don't want to have a soak.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: Danielle M
Reviews.Content: We took a road trip through the south and stayed at six hotels all together. This ranked in the middle. We stayed at another Drury (San Antonio) that was much better. At this one the free food is just okay, but it is nice to have free food. The staff is friendly but weren't always available- the front desk was left unattended multiple times. It's in a great location- close walk to Bourbon/Canal streets, but not so close that the chaos keeps you up. The rooms were clean and provided a good night's sleep. However, the rooftop pool and hot tub were not heated. The pool wasn't heated at all, and the hot tub was maybe 85 degrees (a typical hot tub is 102). No one in their right mind would have gone in. So overall it was just okay, but it was worth it- pretty reasonable

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in a Busy Place”
Reviews.Author: Bloodhound1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before our cruise. It was a perfect location to see the sites get on the street car and leave the next day for our cruise. It was quiet and safe. My wife and I had no problems walking around the area day and night. Price was good and the room was perfect. Staff was very helpful with directions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and experience”
Reviews.Author: WesleyCPA
Reviews.Content: Very tastefully furnished, short walk to Super Dome, at trolly car stop, included breakfast and dinner meals great deal, small pool on roof, got great deal emailed after made reservation. Â Only 6 HD channels. Â

Reviews.Title: “Made the Sugar Bowl sweet!”
Reviews.Author: MickiKaye714
Reviews.Content: I had never even heard of Drury hotels, but found this hotel on tripadvisor.com when looking for accommodations for our Sugar Bowl trip. Excellent hotel, friendly and helpful staff, very nice accommodations, so many extras -- just all around a GREAT value for the money. The location was ideal -- a few blocks from the Superdome, and heading in the other direction, not far from the French Quarter. In fact, we only took a cab one time in the five days we were there because we'd been walking all day and our feet hurt! The hotel doesn't look like much from the outside (especially with the bright white Le Pavilion and Homewood Suites directly across the street) but it's very nice inside. Spacious lobby and breakfast area, very spacious suites with high cathedral ceilings. Wonderful hot breakfast with many options, and the added bonus of "The 5:30 Kickback" with free hot food and drinks in the evening. Popcorn and pop available in the lobby almost all day. This hotel really helped make our trip and would highly recommend you check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Cool NOLA Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amy B
Reviews.Content: I'm actually from New Orleans and for fun one night, booked a room in this hotel. It was very well priced and nicer than I expected. It has a cool view from the top where the pool is, a good free breakfast and dinner/snack served around 5pm I think. It is not located in the French Quarter and might take a little bit of a walk to get there, probably about 15-20 minutes. it is however, probably remarkably cheaper then French Quarter hotels for this reason. It might even be nice to be outside of the French Quarter, so you might be encouraged to check out the cool architecture of the CBD on your walk around downtown. It's in a nice neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans Xmas Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Miviw
Reviews.Content: This hotel is walking distance to all the sites.It's on Poydras. Inliked it for multiple reasons,free breakfast and evening kickback with complimentary alcohol for adults,they also have popcorn. The baked potatoes are great all the toppings are good,barbecued chicken nuggets,vegetables with dip are fresh and plentiful. The room was spacious and linens were of good quality,a large bathroom with a dispenser for shampoo,conditioner and body wash was handy,a large t.v.,comfy chair and closet completed the room. The lounge area with computers and free Wifi was also available. Parking was secure and only $17.00 a day.

Reviews.Title: “A great, fantastic experience!”
Reviews.Author: Brandon W
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in! Check-in was a breeze and had no problems getting to our room. The lobby displayed a classic 1920s hotel style, as well as a grand staircase. The hotel's elevators are room key activated only, for safety reasons. We had a smoking corner room on the ninth floor and there was no trace of smoke anywhere in the room. There was clean white sheets on the bed and clean carpets. Also to our surprise, there was a door that led out to a balcony (we was one of the two rooms to have this.), which I enjoyed being a outdoors person. The bathroom was clean and spotless. The shower provided shampoo, conditioner, and body wash, although I brought my own. The 5:30 Kickback in the lobby was like dinner to us. There was hot dogs, chicken tenders, cocktails, and liquor (2 for every person and show your room key). The pool and hot tub were clean and pristine, although I didn't use it. The views from the rooftop were breathtaking. The fitness room had a bike and step machines and two treadmills (a somewhat small room, though). The general manager and his staff were great to us. I will recommend this Drury Hotel and will stay here again when I come back to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great perks, huge cathedral ceilings”
Reviews.Author: springwilltravel
Reviews.Content: It was my first time staying at a drury hotel and was impressed with what you get for your money. The breakfast was perfect for us since we were looking just for some cereal to kick start our morning before indulging in the great food new Orleans has to offer. The free wifi was excellent and fast. We reserved a deluxe room since I wanted to make sure I got at least one window. The ceilings are at least 14 feet, we had two windows, and the bed was comfy. The location was great being only a couple blocks from the french quarter, a block from the st. Charles trolley, and walking distance to the garden district. After seeing where some of the other hotels were located, we thing we picked the right one since many of the others were in the thick of it all and we were liking our silience the street traffic can be a little loud, ESP. For those not used to it. But it's nothing really to complain about too much. For the price, amenities and location we were very happy with our stay

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Jason42503
Reviews.Content: I stayed here December 12-14 during my first visit to NOLA. This hotel is immaculately clean and very nice for the rate. I stayed in room 616. A COMFORTABLE King-sized bed, high ceilings and nice furnishings, marble floor and wall tiles in the spacious bathroom, and a big flat screen TV - overall very nice! The front desk and breakfast/dinner buffet employees were all very friendly and helpful. They stored my bags upon checkout for a few hours so I could go do more sightseeing until time for my outbound train to leave. The very friendly lady at the front desk retrieved my bags and offered to get me a taxi when I came back. (This was appreciated, but I already had one waiting out front that I'd taken back from the Quarter and the French Market after losing all track of time *easy to do!* and realizing I wasn't going to have time to walk back to the hotel and then get to the station if I didn't cab it, LOL!) The free breakfast was really good and not skimpy; biscuits and gravy, sausage and eggs, donuts, etc. The free evening cocktail hour includes 3 drinks along with a very good and tasty selection of the kinds of snacks you'd have while watching a ballgame: nachos, hot wings, chicken tenders, etc, along with baked potatoes and salad, so you really could have just this for dinner if you wanted. This was all also really good. Obviously both were a good way to save time and money. The rooftop pool and hottub are heated and looked very clean and inviting, although I never did get around to using them. (Went up there one night to get a few pictures of the skyline - you take the elevator to 9, then take the one all the way down on the left on up to 10 to go outside.) I don't currently have a laptop, although they did offer free Wifi. They have two desktops and a printer in the lobby, and these were very handy for getting and printing google map directions for my little self-guided walking tour of the Quarter, as well as checking emails, etc. The streetcars are both historic and very handy. (If you pay cash each time you ride you have to have correct change.) The best deal is to buy an all day or multi-day "Jazzy Pass" which is good for unlimited rides on all three streetcar lines (Canal, Riverfront, and St. Charles) as well as the local buses. You can do this with correct change onboard, or from a machine at the stop at Canal and Carondelet. The St. Charles streetcar stops directly beside the hotel on Carondelet (you can wait at the bus shelter across Carondelet). This one runs "inbound," and you can ride it about four blocks to Canal. At that point just get off and cross Canal, because this is where Carondelet turns into Bourbon St! I did just that and had no problems, and honestly I think walking the four or so blocks down Carondelet to get over to Bourbon would have been OK too even at night, although the streetcar is just neat, and handy if you want to save a little walking before you hit Bourbon. The streetcar coming back from Canal runs on its namesake St. Charles, and you just get off at Poydras and walk one block up that street back to the hotel. For a good way to spend part of an afternoon, also be sure to ride the streetcar out to the Garden District. Google Map the Garden District Bookstore, I forget which street you get off at but you can easily figure it out, I did. The bookstore is an awesome place to visit lots of signed books by famous local and regional authors. (I got a signed hardback of "The Help" - yay me, lol!) It is only about a block from the streetcar stop, and in the midst of many beautiful homes, and is also close to Lafayette Cemetery which is fascinating to walk through. I'm totally in love with New Orleans after one visit! Walking along the Riverwalk, through Jackson Square, and through the French Quarter early in the morning as the city is waking up is also something you don't want to miss. I also recommend the Steamboat Natchez, great food and a really good way to see the city from the perspective of the river, including the levee that broke after Katrina, the Lower Ninth Ward, and the site of the Battle of New Orleans. Again, the Drury was a great place to stay for the money. I will visit New Orleans again, and will definitely stay at the Drury when I do. One last thing: I arrived and departed by train, and I highly recommend riding Amtrak's modern version of the famous "City of New Orleans" if you want a very relaxed experience that allows you to meet fascinating fellow travelers and watch America roll by, including great views of Lake Pontchartrain and the swamps between NOLA and Hammond. Spend the extra money for a sleeper car roomette if you do. All meals included (they're good, too!), along with free coffee and juice in the sleeping car anytime you want it.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: woozyob
Reviews.Content: checked in late, and had trouble getting in. Room was nice,except was a handicapped room (wife is in a wheelchair) and toilet was to low. We spoke to the manger, and he said this was an oversight, and they would be taking care of it. Best part was the 5:30 kickback (free food and cocktails)

Reviews.Title: “Good value for New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: thatcraigguy
Reviews.Content: Not too much more I can add here that has not already been said. The rooms are basic but clean, the location is a few minutes away from the madness of the Quarter but an easy walk. Cabs are always easy to catch. The breakfast was not as fast food heavy as I expected and the evening drinks and snacks had a nice blend of junk food and healthy options. I think they were the only healthy thing I ate in my three days in the city. It would be nice if they had some local options for their evening menu but they pour a strong drink so that's always nice!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: ozziegirlz
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent 4 nights in a 1 bedroom suite. Staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful (especially you Ronaldo!). They were happy to help with booking tours, advice, everything. We didn't want to stay in the French Quarter itself and found the walk there and back very pleasant. We walked a bit at night and stuck to busy areas, and never once felt uneasy or in danger. The room itself was comfortable and spacious. The breakfast and 5.30 kickback were great and most days, after having a big lunch out, it was more than sufficient for dinner. So far I have loved all the Drury Inns I have stayed at, and if I ever make it back to NOLA, I will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Sisters Trip”
Reviews.Author: Calliegirl08
Reviews.Content: Hotel was located in a clean, safe & quite area of Downtown within walking distance (if you don't mind a bit of walking) of the French Quarter and the river. Breakfast and evening snacks pretty good and they offered wine and basic mixed drinks-free. Hotel lobby very inviting with lovely decor and after a long day you could grab a bag of popcorn for a late snack. Rooms were average but very comfortable and clean. Staff was super friendly and helpful with ideas for dining and directions and calling a cab if needed. Highly recommend Cajun Tours for their Swap and Plantation Tour. It was a long day but so worth it; their guides & drivers were exceptional. Loved NOL; people are amazing and lets not forget the incredible southern food! P.S. October weather was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The good reviews were right”
Reviews.Author: BobCNewJerseyUSA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Drury Inn while attending a convention in New Orleans. The hotel was a quick 10 minute walk to Bourbon Street and about 15 minutes to the convention center. I did have have a suite which was quite roomy. The bed was excellent as was the shower and all the ameneties. The breakfast was very good and the kickback with drinks at the end of the day was okay. I am sure for some that was their dinner and while it would suffice for some it was just okay. That being said the restaurants are too good in New Orleans to have the free dinner at the Drury. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: drdotbrown
Reviews.Content: Just returned from New Orleans! Great city full of wonderful people!! This is a wonderful location. We walked w/ our 2 kids everywhere. French quarter and superdome! Rooms were clean, snacks and happy hour were a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: RickSF
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night prior to cruise and when we arrived, we were told that the room we wanted (no smoking with two queens) was not available. I said that we can;t stay in a smoking room due to allergies/asthma; the staff apologized and gave us a room with a King and a trundle bed and told us that we don't have to pay for the night. I was surprised and I said that I was willing to pay but I took the offer. The location is great- near some nice restaurants (we ate at Reginelli's Pizza- good pizza), a couple of blocks from catholic churches, a few blocks from French Quarter/Bourbon St. and Canal St (Walgreens, CVS and other stores). Free wireless Internet. Free breakfast included scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs, waffle makers, cereal, mufins, fruits, sausage, etc. Great staff, facilities, location and had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: dragonlady2411
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and couldn't have been happier. I always look for the following in a hotel and it had it all: within walking distance of main attractions free wifi laundry bath tub free breakfast The room was large, with plenty of storage space. It also had a fridge and microwave. The bathroom was fine, with requisite toiletries provided. The breakfast set us up for the day - certainly not the large cooked breakfasts we'd eaten too many of during our travels around England, but more than I ever eat at home. The afternoon kickbacks was a bonus, as it meant we didn't have to eat out at night and that was a saving. The staff were all helpful and friendly. After walking in the French Quarter, especially Bourbon Street, we were even happier with our hotel choice. I would certainly recommend this establishment as an ideal place to stay in New Orleans, and it was great value for money, even though we stayed over Thanksgiving weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Sue S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the price and parking, but found it offered much more. It is located in the old ATT (Phone Co.) building. Has been refurbished beautifully. Staff was always pleasant and helpful. The free happy hour was a nice plus which included more than just cheese and crackers. The breakfast was also included. Our room was beautiful and clean. Tall ceilings with tall windows were a plus as well as nice furnishings. Also we didn't hear and noise from the rooms next to us. A great view from the roof top pool was fun to have. Short walk to Bourbon Street or the mall down the street on the river. Trolley car stop at the corner of the street. Parking was the least expensive off all the hotels around. For the price we paid, this was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Free Long Distance”
Reviews.Author: Holly R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Drury for 2 nights before leaving on a Caribbean Cruise Nov 6. The best place to stay in New Orleans ( I stayed at the Omni in 2007 ) This beautiful hotel looks like nothing special from the outside but it is beautiful inside ! The service was great and the people friendly. It was only about 3 or 4 blocks to Bourban Street and the same to Riverwalk and Harrah's. Perfect location. Our room was a corner room on the second floor and had 4 great big windows offering views to the South as well as the West. ( though not much of a view on second floor I will admit ) The rooftop pool was nice but the weather was cold and windy so we tried out the Hot tub instead. Felt great as the temp was only in the 60's that day ( of course in the 80's upon our return ) The free breakfast was awesome and it was never a long wait because a lot of people prefer to take their meals back to the rooms to eat. The " Kickback " starting at 5:30 was fantastic and the food ( hot dogs, hamburgers, baked potatoes, beans, salad, tacos, chicken fingers etc was sufficient after a long day in the French Quarter. We didn't have to go out for dinner. There was also 3 free drinks each which we didn't use up but made for a relaxing way to end the day before going to the room. There was free popcorn and pop and best of all " Guest can make up to one hour of domestic long distance calls per day with no access charges or per-minute fees." That meant no roaming fees to call home and what other hotel offers that ? Free WIFI made it easier to plan our day and a shuttle right outside the door if needed. The beds were comfy and our room very quiet considering it was a big Football weekend and there were many guests at the Hotel. We really enjoyed our stay and will never stay anywhere else. It was perfect in all ways ! Thank you Drury Inn ! "

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Touring New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: GoDog514
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay near the French Quarters but also wanted to be far enough away so the activity would not keep us awake into the early morning hours. The Drury Inn met this requirement. It was an easy 3 block walk to the French Quarters. We were with another couple and felt very safe walking after dark. The next morning we walked to several other tourist areas including Cafe Du Monde and Katrina Museum. Many good restaurants within walking distance, and there is a street car stop across the street . We were in a 2 bedroom suite (722) which quite roomy. The bathroom was large and had a jacuzzi. We didn't have much of a view but we didn't stay in the room that long so it wasn't a requirement for us. The breakfast and evening reception was the usual Drury style and quite adequate. Front desk staff was quite friendly. We found a good price through the Drury e-Saver site. There is a $17 per night fee for parking. Definitely would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Drury Inn & Suites New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: jvgood2
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the Drury Inn & Suites and would definitely stay there again and recommend it to friends. This was our first trip to New Orleans and we were happy to be located a short walk from the French Quarter as well as from many other sights in downtown New Orleans. The friendly staff recommended an excellent tour of New Orleans and were helpful in all respects. We also enjoyed the breakfast and the happy hour which helped to make our Halloween visit especially festive.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SNDRPRKR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Drury Inn and Suites for 8 nights in October. Arrived at the hotel at about 1.30 am after flight delays, despite the late hour check in went smoothly. We had a corner 2 room suite on 7th floor with a view of Poydras and Carandolet streets. The room was fine, bedroom was large, bathroon had full bath, there was a small fridge, a microwave, a coffee machine and a TV in both rooms. My daughter slept on the sofa bed which she said was comfortable although there wasn't much space in the room when it was pulled out. Breakfast was OK, enough to start the day and the evening kick back was an added bonus, especially the free drinks. Free soft drinks and popcorn were available from 3pm. Staff were friendly and very helpful. There was a small pool, hot tub and gym but I cannot comment on them as we didn't use them. Too much else to do. A great situation, a tram stop just across the street, a few minutes walk from Canal street and Bourbon street. Certainly would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Parking and Pet Friendly”
Reviews.Author: TJFogelberg
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked at the more upscale Lowes but after discovering pet friendly Drury Inns, realized we could stay here, save money, and get free breakfast and drinks for 4 days! What a beautiful hotel! Our suite is very comfortable and a surprise at only about $139 night. I love the surface parking right out the front door, very secure. I don't care if they charge me for it (some posts say it is free, but posted at about $17 day), still half price from Lowes $34 for each night. The 5th floor rooms don't have high ceilings or windows, but the view is great nonetheless and the fully furnished suite is very comfortable and quiet. Great views from 503. The entire property is clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Should be called the OOPS Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Newyorker2LA
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and close to the French Quarters which is nice, that being said, this place has issues and is way too expensive for what you get. I stayed there for just one night and when I arrived at my scheduled time my room was not ready and it required me to wait 40 minutes. As I was waiting the popcorn machine nearly caught on fire and required the fire department to arrive. This was good since the elevators had shutdown when the alarms went off and it locked the guests in the elevators. I finally got to my room and the sheets were stained but otherwise the room seemed clean. When I got my bill they didn't give me my AAA discount I got from reserving online. They did correct the problem when I spoke to the front desk. At $140/night with my discount this place just isn't worth the cost. There were just too many issues and I was only there for 24 hours. I couldn't imagine what would happen over the course of a week!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: tai57chi80
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Drury Inn and Suites from 11/6-11/9. We had a king room which was very comfortable. No view, but not a big deal as we were out for most of the day. Hotel was a great value as there was a nice breakfast every morning and their "5:30 Kick-Back" every night- up to three free drinks per person between 5:30 and 7PM as well as hot dogs, chicken fingers, baked potatoes, mac & cheese, salad, etc. Actually enough for dinner if you wanted (we did on Sunday when were arrived as we were tired), otherwise really nice to have. Hotel location was excellent- short walk down Caroldelet St. to Canal, and then onto Bourbon street in the French Quarter just on the other side of Canal- about 5-10 minute walk. Also easy walk down Poydras St. to Harrah's casino. Hotel staff was very friendly as well- lot's of smiles. Also helpful in getting us a cab to Frenchman St. (as well as music venue recommendations) and to the airport when we checked out. Overall, highly recommended for a stay in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value, Location, Experience”
Reviews.Author: PlateMan
Reviews.Content: Hotel is excellent and definitely a great value. STAFF -- very helpful and friendly. Constantly offered to share knowledge of their city with you and assist you in anyway possible. ROOM -- I had a corner room, with giant 20ft ceilings and windows. Bed was very comfortable, room was very clean and had just the right amount of furnishings and lighting. Free wifi was super fast. BATHROOM -- Also very clean and while a little small, very doable. Shower supplies are European/cruise style, in that they come from a giant dispenser on the wall. OTHER -- the free breakfast was a great way to start the morning and the 5:30 kickback, with free booze, was another welcome benefit. They actually make the drinks quite strong and you get three per adult. LOCATION -- Also very good. About 5 blocks to the French Quarter and area is safe during the day, and a tiny bit sketchy at night. For about $160 a night, this hotel was a great bargain and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “new orleans”
Reviews.Author: BarbMi
Reviews.Content: Hotel lobby was beautiful with tables, couches and tv's. Staff was friendly. Rooms were a little small. Location was a few block from Bourbon & Canal Streets could get street cars across from the hotel. Good breakfast and at around 5 pm cocktails and snacks. Would stay there again when in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay...”
Reviews.Author: tiff21x
Reviews.Content: The perks of this Hotel is what makes it such a great deal. Its Located within walking distance to all of the French Quarter landmarks. Very nice staff, so nice in fact the lovely lady at the front desk upon check out didnt even charge us the $10 fee for a roll away bed for one night! Parking was free, and if you've ever been to New Orleans you have no idea how cool it is to find free parking at a hotel. Free Snacks from 5:30-7pm, consisted of hot dogs, chicken tenders, nachos.. (the food wasnt that good, but if you are on a budget and dont have a lot to spend then Im sure those people would appreciate free food.. myself, I didnt) Free soda and popcorn all night, and you get 3 free alcoholic drinks. Dont let the outside of the hotel fool you.. it looked kinda questionable when we pulled up to the hotel, but inside very charming classic lobby, This no doubt will be my go-to hotel from now on when I visit New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Continuing the trend of stellar reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Travel100
Reviews.Content: I would have never considered this location had it not been for trip advisor. This is about the best value I can recall from a hotel. Usually places like this are overrun with families with small children, but I guess New Orleans is more suited for adults so it made this location bearable. New Orleans is a place where you are disappointed by hotels that are normally great, but this was probably the nicest Drury Inn I have ever stayed. Every single review is spot on, this is a great hotel for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: UmutB
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two-room suite with our 20 month old baby in October 2011. First the Cons: - Although we arrived 20 min after the check-in time, we were told that we had to wait for half an hour for our room to be ready. However, when we protested we were offered another room to freshen up before hitting town and our stuff were transferred between rooms. - The bedroom of our suite had no windows and the living area had two very small windows which did not open. As a consequence, the room was dark and the air inside was never fresh. - Dull interiors. Just an average hotel building from the 90's, nothing special. And the Pros: - Breakfast and 5:30 snack & drinks included in room price. - Very efficient wi-fi internet service included in price. - Free pop corn and soft drinks available at the lobby during evening hours. - Great location within several blocks of the French Quarter and walking distance to many attractions. - Friendly and responsive staff. Overall, the hotel is nothing special but the extras add great value. Still we felt like the hotel should not be ranked as high as it is among the hotels in the area but then again we have not stayed at the others.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again when visiting New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: GNRMatt
Reviews.Content: The Drury Inn & Suites in New Orleans was an absolute pleasure to stay in. Located on Poydras Street, it is quite close to the French Quarter, Museums and the Riverfront so that you can easily walk to all of these attractions. However, it is in a very quiet area making it a peaceful getaway from some of the noisier areas of the city. The hotel's lobby is quite pleasing when you walk in, and the rooms are clean, spacious and comfortable. The staff was extremely friendly and the room rate comes with a free hot breakfast daily, in addition to a free "happy hour" with free alcohol every night from 5:30 PM - 7:00 PM, that also includes some basic foods such as hot dogs, potatoes, mac & cheese, corn chips and chicken tenders. They offer free wi-fi and have a rooftop whirlpool and swimming pool. Their rates were also very reasonable, especially compared to other hotels in New Orleans. We'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: travel248957
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the location, price, rooms, and food included with the rooms at this location. It was wonderful not having to go out for breakfast in the morning and having the snacks/cocktails in the evening. The rooms were quiet and comfortable, the only downside was the bathroom had no fan and the floors were very slick when wet. It is right on the trolley line but still a relatively quiet location, so if you don't want to walk you can easily hop on to go see things. All front desk staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Drury Inn New Orleans, LA”
Reviews.Author: mitsugirly
Reviews.Content: Our stay prior to our cruise started by flying down to NOLA and arriving around noon. We had picked the Drury Inn due to other cc members recommending the place, plus they offered free hot food, drinks, soda, popcorn and hot breakfast. We figured you couldnâ€™t beat that deal! We managed to get the â€œcruiseâ€� deal they offered and the room was only $93.49 plus tax. Upon arriving at this place, I thought wow, this is really nice. Everything is done up in marble and chandeliers everywhere. Very nice! We made it to our room, wow again. Very nice. Once again, marble bathroom from floor to ceiling, elegantly decorated in the room (I thought at least for the price) and a really nice high dresser that had doors that opened up with drawers behind them, a microwave and a small refrigerator. The night stands were nice wood and also the tops were marble. Great place for the price. We went up to the roof to see the swimming pool and hot tub on the roofâ€¦um, not so great that day. Although the water was clear, the bottom was dirty (and not dirty like stuff in it, more like green film dirty and needed vacuumed). Needless to say, we did not swim or get in the hot tub after seeing this. Prior to checking out, I went up there to take some pictures and there were several people up there sun bathing, but I donâ€™t know if they actually got into the water. (We also managed to catch the whale tail of a Carnival ship in port from up there as well). After checking in and getting situated in our room, we took off on foot to explore the city. Beautiful place with a lot going on. I guess they were having a sea food fest while we were there. There was a lot of live entertainment going on. We walked down to the Riverfront, encountered a real train (which scared the heebie jeebies outta my 3 year old) and multiple trolleys. We stopped to take pictures at Jackson Square (the castle, horse carriage rides, fountains) and strolled along the streets looking at all of the arts being sold by the vendors. There were tons of people posing (really still) for long periods of time, dressed up weird ways, and looking like a statue. Every once in a while one would move and scare someone passing by. Hilarious! Of course, they wanted tips. We made it to CafÃ© Du Monde and had their beignets. I was having trouble understanding our waitress (and obviously she didnâ€™t understand me either because she didnâ€™t bring us the right order). For $2.49 (I think it was) you get 3 small beignets LOADED with powdered sugar. Everyone raved how great these were, but to me, they are the same thing as what you get at any fair from the vendors (funnel cakes), however, I found the beignets to not be as good as a funnel cake. Ours were a little harder than what Iâ€™m use to and the amount of powdered sugar they loaded on it made you a white sticky mess. The people there didnâ€™t seem too friendly, but the place was so busy it was VERY hard to even find a seat. When going inside to use the restroom, it was in this small cubby hole in the back in the SMALL kitchen area and there was a line. The workers were rude and kept telling people to move, bumping into everyone and didnâ€™t bother to say excuse me or anything. At one point they took the door and slammed it shut leaving some inside waiting on the restroom and others standing along a wall waiting. If they thought this made more room, they completely misjudged that because now there were more people moving around due to having to move out of the way for the door to open every time. We caught the street car back to our street that the hotel was on and decided to catch the free hot food (Kickers Meal) the hotel was offering. We did not think it was bad at all, not gourmet food, but definitely something you can make a meal out of and be satisfied. If it was bad food, you sure wouldnâ€™t be able to tell by how many people were there eating that night. It was crazy. They offered you 3 free alcoholic drinks, per personâ€¦and they WERE STRONG! Whew! They had hot dogs, mac and cheese, nacho bar, baked potato (with fixings), veggies and dip, salads, snacks, popcorn, and a soda fountain for drinks. We went back up to the room, visited with our 9/11 roll call online for a while chatting, then went to bed. We didnâ€™t sleep too well though. I thought it was the excitement of the cruise the next day, but felt like I was scratching all night. Well, when we woke in the morning, we found out why. Our room was infested with red biting ants!! There were hundreds of them forming a line across the threshold from the bathroom to the sink area. Upon a little more inspection, we found lines of them going up the night stands and onto the bed. WOW! I immediately went down to let the front desk know about the room. These people were more than kind about it and very apologetic as well. They offered let me do all of my laundry there (which we did not have time for that prior to leaving, so I just made sure I shook everything out hoping we would not take any hitch hikers with us), they offered to get us a cab to the airport and pay (which we met a very nice guy on our roll call the night before and he stopped and gave us a ride) and THEY FULLY REFUNDED MY ENTIRE AMOUNT OF THE ROOM! Wow, now that was service! They told us to stay as long as we would like, however, we wanted out of that room because we were being bitten and ended up just coming down to the lobby to wait for our ride. I was not at all expecting any of this and just wanted to inform them of the situation, but they went above and beyond and we would definitely stay with them again. I forgot to mention the free hot breakfast (eggs, sausage, biscuits/gravy etc.). It was pretty good as well. Definitely editable and filled us up prior to getting on the ship. They also had the regular cold food too (bagels, toast, muffins, cereal and so on).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyTManchester
Reviews.Content: Really can't find fault with this hotel, the location was perfect, breakfast plentiful and always hot, not keen on disposable plates etc but that was the only fault, the 5.30 kickback really went down well free wine, beer or cocktails. Some of the nicest staff I have ever met, I will certainly revist this hotel and New Orleans, one word Fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Just to get away”
Reviews.Author: omegaman76
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently ( 9-10-2011) & was pleasantly surprized by this hotel. Well kept and we enjoyed the breakfast and evening food plus drinks that was given. Love the area and the closeness of getting around to major spots in the New Orleans area.

Reviews.Title: “Pet friendly to the max- loved this place”
Reviews.Author: allaboutpadre
Reviews.Content: After being treated so badly on the road trip to New Orleans by Best Western and their outrages pet deposits this place was a Beacon of light, Real hot breakfast with meat and waffles and clean beyond belief.....anyone one in the hotel biz should stay here to see how it is done right

Reviews.Title: “Gem in the rough”
Reviews.Author: IgorCalifornia
Reviews.Content: It was my second stay in New Orleans in two weeks. The previous was one of the Hilton's. This Drury is so much better! Pros: Nice location, great service, nice size rooms, quiet AC units, breakfast included, very fast internet included, excellent happy hour food and drinks (better than usual Embassy Suites), polite people, clean rooms, free soda/popcorn 3-10 PM, and very reasonable rates! Cons: I travel every other week. It's one of very few hotels in the world I can't find negatives. Maybe breakfast menu could be a bit improved?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: ltbarr
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was fabulous. All our future stays will absolutely be here!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel for the price weÂ´ve got”
Reviews.Author: Fetsund_NorwayGry
Reviews.Content: We arrived twenty minutes before 3pm and was told to wait as our room soon will be ready. After over an hours wait the manager came and said we had to wait a bit longer, but we had to go and eat something and he said he could take our luggage into his office and we could get something to eat. The room was OK, although a bit small for five people. We had a sleeper sofa in one room and a doublebed in the second room. The pool on the roof was OK, but nothing fancy. The snack at 5.30 our children loved, but the breakfast for european standards is terrible. Probably a normal american breakfast, but for europeans it is a disgrace. There is almost nothing to choose from other then unhealthy things.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WindsorP
Reviews.Content: Like all Drury Inns,you know what to expect,and we were not dissapointed.Good service,secure parking,free snacks morning and evening,very nice lobby area and spscious rooms.Our only complaint was that the windows in the suite we had were very small,making the room very dark even during the day.Probably the best value in hotels in the central NO area.The best part for me was the location,just a short walk to the french quarter,Canal St.,Riverwalk,Charles St.,etc.Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “DownTown - Great Location w/a Rooftop View”
Reviews.Author: ratemyvacation
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night before our cruise out of New Orleans. This is a Very Nice & Clean Place to Stay. It has Private & secure parking - you have to use your room key to get in & out of the parking lot. You also have to use your room key to use the elevator & pool. It is right in the middle of downtown, not too far from Burbon Street. We loved the night time Roof Top View with the roof top swimming pool - the kids thought that was really cool! -- not to mention the 5:30 kick backs, 3-10pm popcorn & sodas, 3 bar drinks, & breakfast -- all included in the price of the room!! Book months ahead, or you will pay a much higher price, & Use their online E-Saver rate. We loved this hotel so much, we wanted to come back after the cruise, but they were booked up!

Reviews.Title: “New Favorite Hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: mysticks1
Reviews.Content: This trip was just a one night stay for a concert with just my daughter and myself. We arrived around 4:30 in the afternoon. Check in was quick and the clerk was extremely friendly and helpful. I requested the highest floor and away from street traffic and both were granted. The hotel is really nice inside and was spotless. Our room was a double and it was extremely clean and roomy. The bathroom was really nice and the beds were comfortable. We had adequate towels for the two of us. Another plus for this hotel is the secured parking lot is adjacent to the building. I really don't think there was anything that I would say needed improvement there. Customer service was great throughout the stay. You have to use your roomkey to access the hotel after 10:00 PM. You also have to use the key to operate the elevators from the lobby and to open and close the gate so be sure to keep one of your room keys when you check out if you are driving or you will have to go back inside as I did to get a key to get your car out. The hotel is walking distance to Bourbon St and the Riverwalk area (In my opinion). It may be a little far if you have any mobility issues. It is only a 4 or 5 block walk to the Superdome or the New Orleans Arena. We will be staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very good pirice! Enjoy the secret pool too.”
Reviews.Author: davem60612
Reviews.Content: March 2011 spent 5 days here with wife and 20mo daughter, well liked all around. Price was the best to be found in N.O., location was ok, free drinks and snacks nightly, easy parking, very clean rooms and common areas, but the very best part for us was the swimming pool! It was a little bitty thing, but it was all ours each time we went. On three trips to the pool we never saw another soul, despite the fully booked situation. You will NOT do better for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE YOU WON'T REGRET IT”
Reviews.Author: karajeanm
Reviews.Content: The Drury Inn is my official home away from home when Iâ€™m in New Orleans. This was my second stay at this property, and it was as good as the first time. Whatever the purpose of your trip is, this property will be able to accommodate your needs. The hotel is ideally located within walking distance to the French quarter, Bourbon Street, and the river. The following is included in your rate: full hot breakfast, WIFI throughout the property, managers cocktail reception, beverage fountain (entire day), fitness center, business center, pool, and popcorn in the afternoon. There is a $17 fee for self parking (gated and on the property), which is more than reasonable in comparison to other hotels in the area. The hotel employees are professional, friendly, and accessible. The rooms are clean, comfortable, spacious, and the dÃ©cor is pleasing to the eye. I highly recommend this property, especially if this is your first time staying in the big easy.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisitely Appointed, Value Priced”
Reviews.Author: NightSky777
Reviews.Content: Appears to be an older hotel that has been beautifully restored. There is Absolutely No evidence of any flood or hurricane damage here. Parking is secure, walking distance to the French Quarter/Bourbon street/Casino and even the Convention Center if you want to burn some calories. The Hotel is very classy inside, lots of woodowork/brass; pool table, small business center and best of all a FREE Full Breakfast buffet each morning. Also received a free Drink each evening with evening snack reception. My room was a suite with a separate TV/Living Room, and King Size Bedroom (with TV also). Bath was full of Marble. Very High ceilings also, pretty cool. It was quiet even though next to a busy street, and climate system worked fast and beautifully. The ultimate compliment: YES, I would Definitely Stay Here Again when in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “A joyful place to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Invisiblediva
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, the lobby is elelgant the rooms are so clean and well provided, lots of towels and pillows. Staff was so helpful on my first visit to New Orleans, and they have a really excellent breakfast buffet. they also put out some munchies in the late afternoon which was quite a nice treat. Free Wifi and the rooftop pool was so nice and clean, the fitness room was also really clean. this will be my go to place for future visits to New Orleans, it's close to downtown but in a quiet well kept area.

Reviews.Title: “Have already booked our next stay here.”
Reviews.Author: smsraven
Reviews.Content: Everything from check in to check out was wonderful. We had a jacuzzi suite and loved it. We had a hard time keeping the kids out of the pool long enough to actually leave the hotel. The morning breakfast was perfect; even my picky kids found something to eat. I can't speak to the free dinner and drinks, because we were never at the hotel during kickback hours.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Aseedis
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd time in New Orleans but the 1st I've taken along my 14 and 7 year old. The hotel is in the CBD which is a few blocks from the Quarter. Prepare to walk! We stayed in a king suite which had a king bed in one room with a pull out couch in the main area. The room was clean, linens were comfortable and water pressure was good.This is an older hotel....if you want a view be sure to ask for that. The one window in our suite faced the side of the hotel that featured an air duct. We didn't care as we only used the room for sleeping. There is a small pool on the roof with a separate hot tub. The fitness room had 2 treadmills and a bike. We didn't use either facility but they both looked clean. The hotel offers food and drink from 5:30-7:00......adults get 2 free alcoholic drinks per day.A suggestion if you are going out for the evening: hit the drinks at 6:30 and ask for a double and a lid on your cup (that way you can take it to go) .....we finished ours by the time we got to Lafittes Blacksmith Shoppe and were ready for another. Food offered at that time was salad, hot dogs, baked potatoes, popcorn, nachos, chips. Breakfast was the usual fare of waffles, scrambled eggs, toast, yogurt, cereal, juices, milk, coffee, sausage etc..... This seems to be a pet friendly hotel as there were many dogs there but we only saw them at breakfast.....we never heard any barking. Parking is 17$ per day (in/out) if you choose their lot...keep in mind it is New Orleans and parking is at a premium. Overall, excellent price and good for families!!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: NicholasTheGreek
Reviews.Content: The Drury Inn is always our first choice when staying in New Orleans. Walking distance to the French Quarter and Riverwalk. Quiet and clean rooms. Friendly staff. On-site parking (non-valet).

Reviews.Title: “Our Future Home Away From Home!”
Reviews.Author: tharisicia
Reviews.Content: We ended up at Drury Inn and Suites after Country Inn & Suites didn't have a room available for our pre-paid reservation. The employees there were extremely patient with us as we attempted to deal with Travelocity and Country Inn & Suites. My husband and I quickly fell in love with the General Manager, Slade Stratman and his willingness to help us. The Staff was awesome from beginning to end. The room was clean and comfortable. It fit our family of 4 perfectly. We really liked being able to park onsite and have our vehicle be secure. My daughter took advantage of the pool and enjoyed it. My son was given permission to provide entertainment on the piano during dinner. We plan to make Drury Inn our place of choice from here on. It is on the St Charles Streetcar line but well within walking distance from Canal and Bourbon.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Well Located”
Reviews.Author: freddiemon
Reviews.Content: Overall a very pleasant hotel with very nice staff who were extremely helpful to us. Would recommend this for anyone contemplating being near the French Quarter - a short walk away. The evening reception was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Another Good Experience at the Drury”
Reviews.Author: Genny77
Reviews.Content: My son and I went to New Orleans for the first time last year and loved the place. We went back this year to attend the Satchmo Summerfest, a four day tribute to all things Louis Armstrong. We decided to stay at the Drury Inn again because it is well-located (close to the St. Charles street car line and the French Quarter) and such a good value. My only complaint about this stay was at check in. I had called the Drury to state that we would be arriving on a late flight. When we got to the hotel, there was a busload of people coming in as an "overflow" from another, overbooked hotel. The beleaguered woman behind the front desk did not bother to check and see that I am a Drury Gold Key member and had made a reservation weeks ago. She kept saying that we were "overflow" and I kept telling her no, we weren't. She gave us a room which we found to have most of the lights burnt out, which I could have put up with until the next day, but the room reeked of cigarette smoke. As I have asthma, and only book nonsmoking rooms, that was unacceptable. I called downstairs from the room and got a second clerk who again continued to insist we were "overflow" but agreed to switch us to a much better room. On the other hand, the next day we dealt with Renauldo, who was extremely helpful with a little emergency as well as directions, making reservations for us, etc. He also made a mean spicy Bloody Mary which I enjoyed at the 5:30 Kickback. The little extras are what make the Drury so special. A good breakfast is free (eggs, french toast, pancakes, biscuits and gravy, sausage, fruit, cereal, yogurt, etc.) I don't know what coffee they use but I really enjoy it. Each room has its own microwave and refrigerator, so I was able to bring my son's breakfast upstairs for him (like he'd get up at 10 to eat downstairs, ha) and heat it up. Free soda and popcorn for snack time. Free Kickback happy hour at night which included 3 free alcoholic beverages, food such as hot dogs, chili, salad, baked potatoes. . .We would go to Kickback and snack, then go out to a late dinner. The rooftop pool and jacuzzi were clean and open fairly late. No spa. The "fitness center" was small but since we walk all over, we didn't need a stationary bike to get exercise. I did notice that there were two families who brought their dogs along with them, so if you have allergies, you might make a note to request a room that remains pet-free. We are already planning our next vacation to New Orleans and plan to stay at the Drury Inn again for that trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingval
Reviews.Content: This review is a little late but better late than never. My sister and I stayed here for one night pre cruise and two nights post cruise in Mid April. We enjoyed our stay here. We were really early both times but were still able to check in and get into our room. Room was clean and beds were comfortable. We had requested a room with a view and the view was okay but would have been better had we been on a higher floor. But it certainly didn't taint our stay. Hotel was in a quiet location not too far from the French Quarter. You could hear the streetcars as they do pass right by this hotel on their way to Canal street but they weren't annoyingly loud. We felt safe walking to and from the French Quarter at night too. The included breakfast was good but crowded so expect to wait for an available table. The afternoon snacks were okay. Nothing special and they tended to ran out of somethings the one night we tried the food. The popcorn and free soda were an added bonus when we returned late afternoon and needed a snack. The front desk staff were kind and helpful. Arranged a shared cab for us to the port. And somehow the cab we arranged for our early morning transfer back to the airport didn't arrive on time and the desk person went out and flagged one down for us. And it was nice to have a computer to use in the lobby. Great for checking in and printing boarding passes. Overall we considered this a great place to stay pre and post cruise. Not in the noisy thick of things but close enough to feel comfortable walking to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service & remarkable room!”
Reviews.Author: DomineeHuntsville_AL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights & hubby & both agree we would stay there again! Beautiful, high-ceiling, corner room with a great view. When making reservations you are given an option to reserve a room with a better view & that's exactly what we did. Thankfully they offer AARP, making the rate fantastic! We, too, as another reviewer commented, were there during Junior Olympic nationals & it was very chaotic at breakfast & dinnertime. However, apparently a lot of people don't notice that the cocktail & dinner/food lines are separate & we never waited in line for the free drinks. Many families had come from Cincinnati, St. Louis, & other cities for the Olympics & the food was a nice help for their budgets, I'm sure. Many people checked out on Saturday morning who had been there for the week long event, so things calmed down. We ate out for breakfast & dinner because that's just what we enjoy in NOLA. Loved the whirlpool in our nice bath, a/c was great, & only slight issue we had was we would have liked stronger water pressure in the shower. We were on the 7th floor, so maybe it had to do with that, but I didn't really think that should be the case these days. Renaldo was a wonderful & friendly help to us several times & everyone on the staff was always pleasant to us. Thanks for a beautiful, clean & friendly hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for the price”
Reviews.Author: malboU_s
Reviews.Content: We got a room with a single king for $200 a night. The room was spacious with 12' high ceilings. It had a flat screen tv, fridge and microwave. It was clean and the bathroom was large. We had a view of the street and a parking lot. Pros: Friendly, prompt service; Large, clean room; Good, inexpensive parking at the hotel with no hassle or cost of valet service Cons: the free drink cards were not worth the wait in line with all the parents trying to fill their kid's bellies on the cheap with nachos, hot dogs and cheese sauce. That was chaos. The towels in the bathroom were of low quality. I prefer large, thick, terry cloth towels. I also enjoy nice complimentary toiletries. The ones provided to us were average. In all, I think this hotel is a good choice for people visiting the french quarter on a budget if all you require is good service and a large, clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: holly4200
Reviews.Content: Things we loved: the vaulted ceiling in our room, the pool all to ourselves in the morning, the breakfast, the kickback cocktails, everything was clean, and an overall safe, comfortable environment!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice...”
Reviews.Author: Rogersjk
Reviews.Content: My husband had a conference in NO, and my son (16) and I happily tagged along. This was my 4th visit to New Orleans ("Naw'lins"), and I just love the vibe of the city - the music, food, people, everything! This was our first stay at a Drury property. I was looking for a place where three of us could coexist comfortably, and this fit the bill. The suite had a bedroom with high ceilings and a door, and the living area had a large sofabed, desk and chair. There were 2 TVs, although we didn't use them much! There was a nice (not huge) pool on the roof, but the outside temps were so high when we visited that the water didn't provide much relief. It's a nice spot to relax, though. The breakfast buffet was ample and a bit crowded on the weekend, but a table always freed up when we needed one. The hotel interior was attractive, both in the lobby and room. My only complaint would be the lack of amenities in the bathrooms. Just one very tiny bottle of shampoo and 2 soaps for 3 people. No conditioner or lotion or other niceties. The pluses far outweighed that one minus, though!

Reviews.Title: “great location but...”
Reviews.Author: quesitamama
Reviews.Content: If I could give a half star between "average" and "very good" I would. We had a great time during our stay in New Orleans. The location of the Drury was fine. We could pretty much walk anywhere. The free drink/food was really helpful for our budget, if not our waistlines... the food was pretty much what a six year old would eat: chicken nuggets, nachos, etc. There were a good amount of families and seniors partaking too. BUT if you're looking for a place for charm and character, I would not stay here. The room was very sort of 80s dated, although it was big and pretty quiet. (we were on a high floor.)
