There were a couple of treadmills on the top floor, washers and dryers, and what looked to me to be a very nice pool, although we didn't go in. The staff was nice and helpful. This is more of a do-it-yourself sort of hotel, and doesn't advertise anything otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: IIB
Reviews.Content: Nice, friendly staff. Good breakfast and nice evening social. On the weekends quite crowded for social but weeknights was easy to get food and drinks. Rooms were very comfortable and clean. About 15 minute walk to Convention Center. 25 minutes to French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, no complaints and would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: elliemc74
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast waffles were very good. Our kids liked the dinner/snack. We were allowed to check in early, park in the adjacent lot and then we walked to the Insectarium. No complaints. I loved that a guest began playing the baby grand piano during breakfast on morning. The music really added pep to the area.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL, ROOF TOP POOL, FREE BREAKFAST & EVENING DRINKS”
Reviews.Author: hotelguide1950
Reviews.Content: Stayed july 23rd and 24th , liked the door to the entrace and the elevators required your room key to make work , car parking $17 a day , its on the trolley line , and only 3 blocks to canal st and bourbon st, the pool on the roof is really small, but has a nice spa , free breakfast okay, eggs , sausage, cereal, waffles, toast etc , 5-30 till 7 free drinks and snacks, room was nice but only one sink , bathroom door is a pain, because its big and you have to get in the bathroom then close it to get in the shower , 4 elevators worked great , there is no bar or resturant in the hotel, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED!LOVED!LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: crystalmd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for Essence Festival Weekend during the 4th of July. Front desk was very helpful, although the charged the card that I booked the hotel with instead of my debit card that I had planned on using. Only complaint I would say would be the parking. We had to make-up parking spaces bc the lot was so small but it was a very busy weekend so I'll excuse that b/c everything else was wonderful. Comfy bed, large bathrooms, great breakfast and Wonderful Happy hour with 3 free mixed drinks and free food. Definitely my fav hotels thusfar!! Will definitely stay here everytime I can!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: WV_Traveler25550
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family while on business in town. We chose a two room suite with view and were well pleased with our room. Roof top pool was small but clean and the water temperature was perfect. Breakfast and evening "Kick Back" was excellent! The staff was very helpful with local directions and advice about the trolley system. I would choose this hotel if traveling to this area in future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Brokerman53
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the ratings on Trip advisor - it was everything advertised and more. The service, attitude of employees, and condition of the rooms was 5-Star. The price was more along the 3-star range. Great value, close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: LESLIE E
Reviews.Content: stayed here before and after a cruise. they kept our car in the lot for the week for $50. clean hotel. very friendly and helpful. walking distance to waterfront and french quarter but it was too hot so we took the trolly that stops right on the corner. amazing breakfast and snack/cocktail hour. popcorn and soda all afternoon. our room was 2 rooms with a king bed in the bedroom and a sofa sleeper in the living area. the sofa sleeper was the most comfortable we have slept on. we also had a roll away and that was comfortable too. 2 tv's helped greatly. the only odd thing was that there is a small window in the big room and no window in the bedroom. the other rooms(not suites) had big windows. we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service from Drury ruined my stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: bella107
Reviews.Content: Horrible customer service from this hotel completely tainted my experience staying at the Drury Inn New Orleans, as well as put a damper on my stay in NOLA. Such a shame. I chose this hotel because I usually trust Trip Advisor reviews. This hotel is decent for the price, except that during â€œspecial eventsâ€� they charge $28 dollars per night for parking, which is a bit much in my opinion. The 5:30pm "kickback" had terrible food - one night I couldn't tell if they were serving chicken fingers or fish sticks. The breakfast in the morning was OK. And it was nice having access to free sodas/water all the time. Pool was nice, although small. Rooftop had a nice view of the business district though. Nice location. Trolley stops right out front, and we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go (including Bourbon street, French Quarter, the river, etc) - never moved the car. Next time I think I want to stay in the French Quarter though - much more going on, much busier, shopping, etc. I left this hotel very unsatisfied because of the Druryâ€™s poor customer service and inefficiency. The front desk clerks at this hotel are unhelpful, impolite, disorganized, and rude. Upon check in, my friends and I paid our bill (in full) on three separate cards. However, by the time all was said and done, my credit card was double charged, and my two friendsâ€™ credit cards were double charged as well. We tried to fix this issue when we received our bill, and noticed the bogus charges. This was around 3 a.m. when we were about to get in bed. There was only one woman working the desk, who flat out denied that there was a mistake at all. Are you serious? We asked to speak with a manager, but the woman claimed there was no manager available (anyone familiar with hotels knows that there is always a manager available). I believe the manager was in the back room, but refused to come out. Instead, the woman put the assistant manager on the phone, Jacque Boutte, who was condescending and rude to my friend and I via telephone; Jacque refused to admit there was a mistake as well. We gave up until the next morning when we could talk to Jacque in person. During check out the next morning, we asked to speak with Jacque about the bogus charges on our bill. Again, he was condescending, rude, sarcastic, and indifferent to the situation. He did not apologize or explain what happened and why we were triple charged for our stay. Eventually, he agreed to credit/refund my credit card. However, upon returning home, I checked my bank account to see that there was NO refund on my card, andâ€¦get thisâ€¦there was YET ANOTHER charge to my credit card for the full amount of the hotel stay! Ridiculous right? Even more ridiculousâ€¦I called the hotel and they denied charging me again. I actually had to fax them my credit card statement to â€�proveâ€� that I wasnâ€™t lying! After I faxed my card statement, there was (again) no apology for the Druryâ€™s mistakes. Jacque (assistant manager) kept claiming that he talked with my bank, and had authorized a refund to my card for the Druryâ€™s mistakes. However, I have yet to receive a refund. It looks like I am going to have to file a claim for fraudulent charges against Drury Inn New Orleans. This hotel completely ruined my stay in the Big Easy. Be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel with lot's to offer”
Reviews.Author: beachesDallas
Reviews.Content: Had not stayed at a Drury Inn before, but we are big fans now. We had a family vacation with kids to New Orleans. We were looking for a nice, clean, reasonable priced hotel near the fun of the city and that included free breakfast. We found it here...and it included dinner food and drinks too. Close enough to walk to many attractions in New Orleans and along the trolley line. This is a great hotel. The staff were very helpful. Going out of their way to welcome us and help. Rooms were big too, which was nice. We enjoyed the roof top pool as well. Couldn't ask for more than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: southcarolinausa
Reviews.Content: Trip was with my daughter and granddaughter so we shared a suite. Everything was clean and comfortable, roomy with enough places to store our belongings and toiletries. Breakfast was good although they did run out of bananas 2 of the 3 days. We were delighted to see the hotel security on not only the outside doors at off hours but the elevator as well. I selected the hotel because I had been to the one in Greenville and was impressed; also selected it for parking on site. It would be nice to have king beds that have mattresses where you don't feel the shift of your bedmate. We used the small workout facility and was able to do so since no one else used it; the remote disappared the second morning so couldn't turn the TV off or volume down. Access to FQ was good since we enjoy walking - just a few blocks off canal street. St. Charles streetcar right there. Bubba Gumps was amazingly good as was The French Market.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: TravelTheRock
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an example of 'Southern Hospitality'. At check in the lady (I am sorry but I dont recall her name) was sheer professionalism and charm. Clearly she has been here a long time and made fell very welcome. The rooms are excellent and spotless. Self serve drinks and snacks after 3pm are great and breakfast is excellent. All other facilities are great and internet/free printing very useful. The location is great - far enough away from the noise of Bourbon St but only a 5 minute walk. Convenience store 3 blocks away and downtown shops, etc close too. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for Family Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: rustyjdcs
Reviews.Content: We could not have been happier with our stay in New Orleans. The Drury Inn & Suites was the absolute right choice for our family vacation and a very reasonable rate. The hotel lobby is elegant and clean. The room was very large with 2 big rooms, a king bed and a pull out queen sized couch/bed. The room was extremely clean, in good order and was very comfortable. Some reviewers complained about the views, but looking out the window is not high on my checklist of vacation things to do. All we paid for was the room, everything else was included -- free internet, free breakfasts, free "kick-back" dinner. The free hot breakfast had many options -- french toast, scrambled eggs, waffles, biscuits, gravy, sausage, hot and cold cereals, fresh fruit, yogurt, toast, bagels, muffins, donuts. Coffee, tea and several juices and milk. Everything was fresh and in ample supply. The 5:30 Kickback dinner was nice, especially for the kids who may not want to eat Cajun food. Food was plentiful. Hot dogs, nachos, refried beans, taco beef, chicken nuggets, baked potatoes, salad bar. 3 free adult beverages a day for each adult. Full bar -- mixed drinks, beer, wine. Fresh popped popcorn was available every afternoon and the coffee urns and soda fountains were always open. All of the employees were friendly and helpful. A little thing that Drury did right that most hotels get wrong is they actually gave us one towel for each person. Far too often, we get 3 towels for the 4 of us which necessitates a call to the front desk for an extra towel. Itâ€™s that attention to detail that makes a big difference. The Drury is a very nice place to stay, especially for families -- close enough to the hot spots but just far enough away for a tasteful family experience. The St Charles Street trolley is just at the corner and everything is in walking distance. The Drury got 4 big thumbs up from me and my family. It is a must stay hotel that we will visit again on our next visit to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise, Pre-Party, Pre-Mardi Gras option”
Reviews.Author: Escapefromthedesert
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night prior to a Norwegian Cruise. It is only a 5 mintue cab ride about $10.00 from the hotel to the port. It is possible to walk, but you might have some problems walking around the port. It is only a 5-6 block to the French Quarter or the River walk, so the location is great. Checkin was easy and the front desk friendly. The room was clean and smartly decorated. The shower had good pressure and the bed was comfortable. The only one negative that I could find was that the room did not have a safe. I was able to check valuables at the front desk for free. We had a view of the building next to us, but that was okay as we were not in the room enough. We did not partake of any of the evening amenities as far as the meals and snacks as we out in the french quarter. The breakfast was adequate with eggs, cereals, biscuits, etc. To bad that people cannot control their children as som kids were sneezing into some of the food. Coffee was good. I used the gym it was small with one bike and two treasmills. The free WIFI was a bounus. I would highly recommend this as a great place to stay will visiting N Ew Orleans

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the budget minded.”
Reviews.Author: boingo_tx3270
Reviews.Content: Great staff and very helpful and friendly. The rooms are clean!! Yea! We changed our room location from 1st floor by restrooms, to a 3rd floor with no problem. All the staff made us feel like we were special. Now the best thing for the budget. The free breakfast is great when you don't want to go out. What is even better is the 5:30 Kickback where they have free finger foods and you are able to get up to 3 adult drinks. It's a great way to save money and start off your evening. You are 4 blocks away from the French Quarter and Harrah's Casino, also 1 block from the streetcar you can catch to the Quarter. I reccommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to the Trip Advisor rating”
Reviews.Author: WatermanWife
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel due to reviews on Trip Advisor. I was immediately disappointed in the room which was not a suite, was very dark with a single very small window that looked out over an alley You cannot call a room with an exercise bike and just two treadmills a fitness room. No free weights, no elliptical, no room to do push ups or sit ups. They were unable to accommodate a request of additional hanger for the room stating what was in the closet were the only hangers available to me. The evening snack and drinks were held in a room that could not accommodate the number of guests that wanted to attend. Resulting in lines, and nowhere to sit. My husband and I skipped this "complimentary" offering and instead ate and had drinks outside of the hotel. As a result we checkout after only one night of a 6 night stay. On the plus side, staff was very pleasant although every time I had to speak to someone at the front desk it was empty and I would have to wait several minutes while staff (who you could see from the front desk) would continue to perform computer work in the back office. New Orleans has a lot of other wonderful hotels that are reasonably priced you may want to consider one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: 1980ws
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights. Family of 4. Absolutely perfect. Cannot think of one thing I could complain about. Great price, 2 free meals everyday. Nice room, WiFi. Location! I mean, what could I possibly complain about? I will recommend this hotel to anyone, and will look for the Drury brand in future travels. Kudos to a top notch staff & management who make this top notch facility tick.

Reviews.Title: “Love Drury, walk to French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: erinvic
Reviews.Content: I wish they had Drury in the west! This place was great!! The breakfast had hot and cold items. The "dinner" really is a dinner for our family. We saved so much money eating dinner at Drury, and they give you free (adult) drinks too!! The walk to Bourbon Street and the French Quarter is only 5 to 10 minutes. But, the humid heat did overwhelm us Californians....and it was only 89 degrees. (Give us 110 in the dry heat and we'll take it!!) The roof top pool and jacuzzi were so refreshing and the novelty of it was terrific for the kids. This was one of our favorites on our 28 day road trip. Staff was nice, parking was close, and the room was large enough for the 5 of us, no frills. We are booked at the St. Louis Drury for our next road trip, summer 2011!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay at for Mardi Gras”
Reviews.Author: KellyAtlanta
Reviews.Content: This hotel is walking distance to all of the major parade routes - except for St. Charles, which is a hike - but Bacchus ran right outside the hotel. PLUS you get free breakfast every morning which is crucial when you are not up for venturing outside the morning after. The security and hotel staff were nice too. Heads up, the floor we stayed on was underneath the swimming pool, so our room was oddly damp - so just be sure to check on that before booking. I can't remember what floor it was though. All in all, I recommend this hotel for Mardi Gras. It was a pretty good price per night as well.

Reviews.Title: “BEST VALUE HOTEL IN NO”
Reviews.Author: jblifeguard
Reviews.Content: First off, I am shocked that the Drury has fallen to number 2 in the top hotels list. No way it can be beaten. My wife and I were here for New Years 2010. I had wanted to stay in the Quarter, but the prices were sky high and we are by no means rich. I picked the Drury for our 3 nights stay. The prices averaged out to $175 a night if I remember correctly, a huge discount from the $250 or so average of everywhere else. To start to hotel is beautiful. The lobby exudes southern charm as does the wonderfully front desk staff (one of the employees spent 15 minutes calling various restaurants to find us some crawfish - it wasn't in season yet and was hard to come by). The happy hour food/drink and the breakfast were great. The food was plentiful and pretty good. Don't tell anyone but we actually brought some up to our rooms for late night snack (we had a fridge). The room was great. We had a larger room with huge floor to ceiling windows and the ceiling was very high. We actually had a great view of some nasty thunderstorms that rolled through one morning. Great stuff. The walk to the quarter was a snap - 3 blocks or so. Easy trolley access also. The only negative I can think of is that they were having some fire alarm problems while we were there (went off three times, once in the middle of the night which was annoying, but I'm sure that's been fixed by now). All in all, if you don't want to get ripped off in the quarter, don't want to be surrounded by the lovely, filthy debauchery of bourbon street, want good free food, a friendly staff, access to transportation to other parts of the city, and on and on and on, stay in the Drury. The Drury is the real number one hotel in New Orleans. Hopefully this review pushes it back to the top :-)

Reviews.Title: “Wow!! stay HERE!”
Reviews.Author: nancyandstu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 9 night s in May. I can't say enough about the great friendly service we recieved. The manager was on site all the time and made every effort to speak with all the guests. We had a suite room on the 6th floor with a street view. The room was lovely with 15 foot ceilings, marble bath and two large LCD TVs. Our frig kept things cold but we really shouldn't have bought any drinks or snacks because the hotel offers them for FREE! Every night from 5:30-7pm they offer a great variety of of hot snax and three free alcoholic beverages (including things like Margaritas and blood Marys as well as white, red and zinfandel wines and Bud light beer). They also offer a very nice hot breakfast in the morning. The pool and Jacuzzi on the roof were clean and warm with plenty of towels. All elevators require your room key to work so you feel very safe. If you decide to stay right in the French Quarter/ Bourbon Street (I was almost lured in by the Royal Sonesta-but so glad I picked Drury instead) I guarantee you will not get any sleep. It's like New Years Eve in Times Square every night. It was so nice to come back to the Drury and get out of the chaos of Bourbon street. Let me mention a few things I didn't see in the other reviews that you may find helpful. First, the hotel is very close to the AT&T building next door.( The Drury WAS the old telephone building until they expanded and moved next door-This accounts for the 15 foot ceiling in the Hotel. The phone company needed them to house their large equipment) The rooms that face the new AT&T building have no view at all. The hotel web offers a choice of "street view" for a little extra money. I advise unless money is very tight to get the street view or you will be dissapointed. Also, you are blocks away from many of the best restaurants in the country, Commanders Palace, Emerils, Arnauds, Restaurant August etc. Don't tank on the bar snaks at the Hotel. Go out and visit one of these great places. New Orleans is a food town go enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and better than expected”
Reviews.Author: mummar4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Drury based on other reports from Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. A short, four block walk, to the French Quarter..the famous Mother's restaurant a block away...and a one and a half mile walk to the Garden Quarter. Also the streetcars were right outside. Was able to park the car in a secure lot on the grounds ( hate valet parking ) for $17.00 per day. The room was airy, clean and well appointed. Happy Hour each night with three free ( alcoholic ) drinks per person, unlimited soft drinks, popcorn and coffee - and food such as hot dogs, macaroni, potatoes, taco bar., chicken strips. Although we did not avail ourselves of the food, it would have been plenty for dinner if needed....and many people did. Definitely would stay again. Oh, and so nice to be a little away from the drunks on Bourbon Street.........

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJames_Traveller
Reviews.Content: The Drury Inn Suites New Orleans is ideally situated for anyone wanting to explore the city, in particular the French Quarter. It is not the cheapest hotel in the area but I believe that you get what you pay for. It doesnâ€™t cost a fortune but it is clean, quiet and accommodating with staff who go out of their way to be friendly and helpful The free breakfast is superb with plenty of choice and adequate room to enjoy it. An extra feature that we discovered, which wasnâ€™t advertised when we booked, was the free evening hot food. We found the chicken, potato and salad with drinks (including wine and beer) were so good that we didnâ€™t need to go out for an evening meal. Soft drinks and coffee were permanently available and we were even able to make hot popcorn in a popcorn machine later in the evening before we disappeared for the night. This is a hotel that knows how to provide excellent service. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Situated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteveHammer
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in a Drury Inn and it will certainly not be our last. This hotel is in an ideal situation for visiting the French Quarter and Riverwalk area.There is nothing negative that I can say about this hotel. The check in was smooth and the room was spacious, very clean and nicely decorated. The rooms were also very quiet. Loved the "5.30 Kickback" . Free beer and food!. The kids also loved the rooftop pool. Another good point about this hotel was the parking. I hate having to squeeze your car in to a small underground parking garage when visiting city centre hotels. This hotel has secure outside parking and plenty of it. The hotel was full the weekend we were there but we had no problem finding a parking space. I would definitely return here and will be recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Google Found This For Us - Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: TO_Trips
Reviews.Content: Terrific value. Nice and fresh interiors and rooms. Wonderful bed. Quiet. Jetted tub in a two room suite. Brand new flat screen in each room. Cable. HBO. Free wireless internet, and is it fast! A chunk of free long distance every day ... 60 min in the US and 15 to Canada. Small refrigerator and microwave in the room. NOW add a free hot breakfast every morning. AND NOW add a 5.30 to 7pm Kickback every day. Three free alcoholic drinks. All other drinks free. Hot snacks like fried chicken. Salad. Hot dogs. Usually something different every day in addition to these basics ... say chili. Nachos with meat toppings and fixings. Mac and cheese. Wow. Seating at tables and soft seating in the Lobby. No kidding, most days we only bought lunch in a resto! Staff from front desk to breakfast and kickback servers, management, housekeeping all super friendly. Hot tub and pool on the roof. Small exercise room. We'll definitely be staying in this Drury next time we're in NOLA and will be checking out others in the Drury chain from now on when we travel. And yes they have a loyalty club to earn free room nights! PS it's just a short, safe walk - about 7 minutes - to Vieux Carre (French Quarter) and all that jazz, esp in the Royal Sonesta at Irvin Mayfields.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaryWoodbine
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family and grandchildren. Quiet location but handy for street cars. 10 minute walk to Bourbon Street and Canal Street. After visiting French Quarter near Jackson Square would have preferred to stay there as it was more up market and had nice restaurants and music. Near river too and Cafe du Monde.

Reviews.Title: “OK not great Take 2”
Reviews.Author: irishgirlNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Positives- room quiet, breakfast ok, homemade waffle machine helped make the breakfast, checkin quick no problems. Negatives- At checkin, they could have gone over the amenities, had to ask about pool, GYM, times for breakfast. Gym- could not really call it that 2 treadmills and 1 bike in the tiniest room I had ever seen. Also the was a man hanging out the 2 times I was there smoking and eating on the staircase, I don't know if he was a guest or employee. I felt very uncomfortable and did not go back after 2nd day. Pool and sauna were dirty, looked like it had never been vacuumed. Sauna was cold. stayed in a 2 room suite, only window was in living room overlooking an alley with no sunlight, not worth the money. Jacuzzi tub old and dirty. had to ask for more shampoo, gave only1 tiny container. overall had expected much more for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Drury, a class act for jazzfest.”
Reviews.Author: cutter27
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in four other hotels in the French Quarter over the years during Jazzfest this is the only hotel I'd go back too. This hotel is in the Central Business District about a ten minute safe walk from the Quarter. Courteous helpful staff, clean and very nice room and hotel. Avoid the craziness and noise of some of the hotels in quarter and stay here. Also closer to the Garden District.

Reviews.Title: “Great property and bonuses! Clean, convenient, & friendly!”
Reviews.Author: live2travelaround
Reviews.Content: We got the two-room suite. Great idea for a 9+ day stay, as it gives a place to chill, instead of sitting on a bed when not touring around. Fridge & m'wave were so handy to have! Room very clean, but not spotless (lightswitches, vents, & doorknobs a little noticeably grungy). The stuff they clean often was acceptable (toilet, vanity, sheets, towels). Tv's great quality, HBO was nice, as we caught some Treme while in NOLA. 530 kickback nice, but not super-healthy. Drinks were yummy, though! Computers work great and the free printing/copying was helpful & very good quality (b&w). Super nice people work here, the rooftop pool & hottub are neat-o, and the location is super-convenient! Seriously, others in our large group were always stopping by our room, b/c it was always on the way to the next destination!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Staff, but.....”
Reviews.Author: VacationTraveler1
Reviews.Content: Took my Grandson to New Orleans as a graduation gift. Picked the Drury due to its recommendation on Trip Advisor. A few comments. While the staff was for the most part pleasant and helpful, that was about it. The breakfast buffet was very ordinary at best. Only one woman working the buffet and she couldn't keep up. Food was rather cold. Biggest gripe was the room. Bed was good, but the room wasn't really clean. There were a pair of dirty, brown men's socks behind the right hand curtain. I didn't complain, thought I'd wait and see if the maid was paying attention. If she was vacuuming that area at all, she would notice the socks. They were there when we got there and were there when we left. If you end up in Room 406, look and see if they're still there. Lots of family and noise at night. Ear plugs helped, but still difficult to sleep. Overall, nothing to recommend the kinda dreary Drury. Bevo Lives

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: JasonTK
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short since there are plenty of other reviews but this was probably my most pleasant hotel stay ever up til now! Free breakfast, free light dinner with drinks, very clean room, friendly staff, great location, on-site self-parking in gated parking lot (not a fan of valet parking myself). No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, nice amenities, very good value”
Reviews.Author: RobertLev
Reviews.Content: We (family with two boys 8 and 11) stayed for six days in April 2011. The location was excellent- about 6 blocks to the French Quarter, same to Riverwalk, a block from the St. Charles streetcar. We appreciated the value: the suite we stayed in was large, with a fridge and microwave; the small pool and jacuzzi were nicely located on the roof; and the breakfast was hot and generous. The hotel has two computers with a printer in the lobby, and has a great complimentary snacks (hotdogs, etc) and drinks in the late afternoon. We would recommend the hotel and would stay there again. Staff was responsive, helpful, and cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DocJonesL
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 12 pm and check-in tme was at 2pm. We asked could we check in early, and with a smile the desk clerk said yes. All staff was extremely friendly, courteous and professional. I really enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: jandsmom
Reviews.Content: This place was great! The room was clean and pretty, and the bed was actually SO comfortable. We didn't hear a sound from other hotel guests all night. The staff was friendly and helpful. Free breakfast was really good as well. We will definitely stay there again. FYI...It's also a straight walking shot from the Central Business District to Bourbon Street.

Reviews.Title: “Just as advertised”
Reviews.Author: jj_msu
Reviews.Content: I was excited about staying here during a conference after reading the previous reviews and experienced what the other guests had said. It is a convenient enough location, a little removed from the quarter and downtown, but still accessible by walking and street cars. The room had great large ceilings and a view of downtown, everything was clean and well taken care of. Guest service and staff were excellent. And of course the best part of staying at a Drury Inn is the breakfast and 5:30 Kickback! Looking forward to coming back to New Orleans soon!

Reviews.Title: “Big Value in the Big EAsy....”
Reviews.Author: Curlygal001
Reviews.Content: There is so much to be said for the Drury Inn Hotel that it is hard to do it justice in just a few paragraphs. The staff was friendly and informative, the rooms were large and comfortable, and the amenities were unbelievalbe. Hot breakfast in the morning was delicious and the "Kickback" parties at 5:30 were a hoot. For my husband and I, the location was a breath of fresh air. When we were finished with the hustle and bustle of the French quarter it was just a few short blocks back to the peace and quiet of the Dury Inn. One of the many things we did was to take the St. Charles streetcar (adjacent to the Drury Inn) to the Garden District. We did a walking tour that started at the Layfayette Cemetery that was education and beautiful. We are already talking about going back and have just been home a few weeks. The Drury Inn, New Orleans, like it's people, is filled with good old fashioned charm and hospitality. BTW, here are a few tips for your trip. Taxi's are $33 to and from the airport for two people. Streetcars are $1.25 per ride, exact change. Transfers are extra. Day passes are also available for $5 pp.

Reviews.Title: “One night good stay”
Reviews.Author: Betty370
Reviews.Content: We arrived 04/02 at noon. A room was available on the first floor. Got into room, freshened up and off to FQ. It was a long day and we were tired. Got back to room about 5:00. Too tired. Decided to just stay and eat at 5:30 Kick Off. They had hot dogs, chili, baked potatoes, salad, celery sticks and carrots, chip, pretzels, tortilla chips and salsa. We had our drink tickets. I had two drinks gin and vodka and they were strong. They had wine, mixed drinks. Good for us. Saved money for another dinner. Slept well. No noise. Room had tall ceilings and we were comfortable. Breakfast next morning - Scrambled eggs, sausage, make your own waffles, french toast, gravy and biscuits, juice, doughnuts, bagels, coffee. Checked out. Everyone there was very helpful. We did take taxi to FQ, did not feel like walking. It might be quite a walk to say Jackson Square, but to get to the border of the FQ not too far.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: GML_31
Reviews.Content: Quick, efficient check-in. Our room was located with a view of Poydras, which we initially thought would lead to loud nights, but we were wrong. Our room was much larger than we expected, and had an extremely comfortable bed! The room was clean, comfortable and met all of our expectations. The only small complaint is that the walls are thin-not really bad, but you could hear certain things through the walls (like water turning on, or doors slamming). Otherwise, we have no complaints. I'd stay there again because it's far enough from the Quarter so you don't have a lot of noise yet close enough to the right parts of town so the walk isn't too bad. We would go back if it weren't a festival weekend, however, the location was key for us as we were seeing a concert at the Arena, which is a few blocks away!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Drury!”
Reviews.Author: AllesonWonderland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Drury in New Orleans 1 night before our cruise. We got into town a little earlier than expected, but the gentleman at the front desk was able to let us check in early. The hotel has a lot of nice touches, the lobby was pretty and the area for snacks/breakfast was good sized. There was plenty of room for us in our room. The flat screen TV and fridge were put to good use. I wish I would have remembered to bring along a bag of popcorn to pop in the microwave. The location is great, an easy walk to the French Quarter. Also, I forgot something and was able to pick it up at a Walgreens close by. The kids tried out the rooftop pool and hottub. The evening snacks and drinks were appreciated. There were baked potatoes, hotdogs, chili, chips and salsa, salad and more. Plus there was soda and popcorn available til late in the evening. We filled up at the delicious breakfast of eggs, sausage, biscuits and gravy, fruit, yogurt, and those ginormous Drury waffles. Parking was $12 a night during our stay, but we paid $50 total to leave our car at the hotel while we were on our cruise. There were no issues while we were away. I'd definitely stay here again the next time we go to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “My facvorite.”
Reviews.Author: BeladonaUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Drury Inn and also at La Pavilion during our first visit to new Orleans. The Drury staff were very nice. The room was lovely with a big flat screen TV. mini fridge and microwave. (Opened the fridge at La Pavilion and was charged just for looking and a drink) The king bed was very comfortable with lots of pillows to choose from for your own preference. It is a very clean hotel with a pretty lobby that's severs a decent breakfast and also food and snacks with a couple of free drinks at 5:30pm-7:pm. Parking was $17 a day, but after staying at La Pavilion and paying $35=tax =$39 per day, I think that was a fair deal. I loved this hotel and would stay here again if I ever return to New Orleans

Reviews.Title: “My second stay at the Drury...as good as the first.”
Reviews.Author: TouristLady
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Drury in 2005. I was eager to go back due to the free breakfast, 5:30 Kickback and location. It was even better this time. The evening snacks are much better than before. This time there were hot dog, baked potatoes, chicken fingers, chips and dips. And of course, let's not forget the free beverages. We had a great time each night meeting new people. The hotel is a few blocks from the French Quarter, which is a good thing. We didn't get a rental car and were able to walk everywhere, except the night it rained so hard we got a cab. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant, so outside the times of breakfast and kickback you'll have to go elsewhere. However, this is New Orleans so there are great restaurants all over. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. This time we stayed in a one room suite. Unfortunately, it wasn't soundproof so we did hear a lot. While in the bedroom reading, I could hear the tv in the living room. One afternoon, after coming back from walking around town, we found the room had been cleaned, but it had a bad smell which wasn't there before. A call to the front desk got it fixed quite quickly. If I go back to NOLA, I would definitely stay at the Drury.

Reviews.Title: “It's worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: BlueBaby05
Reviews.Content: We spent St. Patrick's Day weekend at this hotel. The service was excellent. We primarily chose this hotel because of the happy hour and breakfast that is included in the hotel cost. There was a nice variety of food (chicken tenders, small baked potatoes, nachos, salsa and chips, etc.) during the happy hour, but it runs out very quickly...so be downstairs no later than 5:45pm. The drinks were decent. I wasn't impressed with the taste of breakfast (sausage patties, french toast, self-made waffles, scrambled eggs, muffins, juice, etc.), but it is sufficient enough to hold you over until lunch. Our room and the hotel was clean. The bed spread was too thin in my opinion and the bed was moderately comfortable. We loved having a mini-fridge and microwave in our room as we were able to store and warm leftover food. The hotel is about a ten minute walk from Canal and Bourbon St. and although the streetcar runs on the side of the hotel, I could barely hear it. Note: There is a $3 tax that was added to the daily parking fee of $17/ day. We didn't find about this extra charge until we checked out. I would stay here again during a visit to the French Quarter or Central New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but not special - parking & staff were great”
Reviews.Author: ifallwasall
Reviews.Content: The best part of the stay was the service. The staff was courteous and helpful. The worst part of the stay was the other guests & thin walls. We were kept up at night by a loud party/group in the room next to us until 2am (and another guest asked the to be quiet). In a town that is unique and has style the hotel was fairly drab... They serve free food but it is meatballs! In New Orleans I would expect something a little less vanilla. Also, the room smelled like cleaning products. Not the worst but a little too strong to not be annoying. Our room had a window but looked out on an alley/air vents from the neighboring buildings. The location was fine in that we could walk to the Quarter or restaurants in the Warehouse district but far enough that the repeated walks got tiring (about a mile exactly to Cafe Du Monde). We enjoyed the exercise but it would be too much for some people. The parking was a definite plus - you park your own car with in & out and it isn't too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, nice rooms & service was excellent”
Reviews.Author: luvmypooches
Reviews.Content: We visited for 4 nights during March break. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They went out of their way to make sure our stay was enjoyable. The rooms are clean, updated with very comfortable beds. The free breakfast was good (not great) but certainly good enough to fill us up for the morning. Standard food was scrambled eggs, biscuts with gravy, waffles & cereal. The free hot snacks in the evening were not our style (hot dogs, chips, chicken fingers, meatballs) but we enjoyed a few complimentary drinks each night. The hotel is very safe, requiring a hotel key to enter the elevator. The location was good. Walking distance to the French Quarter (2 blocks) and shopping on Canal St. We also walked to the casino & riverfront (about 10-15 min). The St. Charles trolley goes right past the hotel, making it very easy to visit the Garden District and Zoo. Would definately stay again. Note: Lisa, the night desk attendant, went out of her way to help us. I was missing some clothing and unfortunately we were going to check out very early in the morning before the housekeeping staff arrived. Lisa was able to located my stuff and called up to the room that she had found it. GREAT SERVICE - very much appreciated her efforts.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in ideal location for French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: mercury50
Reviews.Content: Great value for money, fantastic suite with large flat screen tv in each room. Spotlessly clean, friendly helpful staff and the bonus of free drinks and snacks after 5.30 pm. My only negative comment is paying $17 plus tax per night for parking but you are made aware of this before you book. The hotel is in easy walking distance of the French Quarter and also the Casino.

Reviews.Title: “All I had to worry about was lunch!!”
Reviews.Author: Sollibaba
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Drury during Mardi Gras weekend, which was probably one of the busiest times of the year for New Orleans. I was concerned about the traffic and if I was going to be able to make it to the hotel by car because I knew the parade routes went through downtown New Orleans. I did not have any problems getting to the hotel because it is situated about a block away from St. Charles. Parking was also reasonable, $28 with tax for special events, but I know it is normally $17. I got to the hotel about 4 hours early on Saturday, March 5, and was able to check in at 11AM instead of 3PM. I will be forever grateful for them allowing us to check in early because the weather turned real nasty not too long after, and that would have been a damper trying to get the luggage out of the car. I was also impressed with the security measures that were taken at this hotel during such a busy time of the year. They had a police officer in the lobby checking to make sure that everyone had a wrist band, which is a way of identifying hotel guests. Room keys were also implemented to access the elevators, so I always felt safe. You could tell, this wasn't their first rodeo! The rooms and bathrooms were clean, and although the room furnishings were not impressive, the extra amenities more than made up for this. For instance, all guests receive free internet, a hot breakfast, and a dinner in the evening. In addition, guests can get up to 3 free alcohol beverages. This was very nice and unexpected, and it made me feel good about how little I paid for the room. I felt like I was getting a real deal!! Bottom line: great value with great customer service. I felt like family, not a money maker.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: patonfairmont
Reviews.Content: We found the reviews on Trip Advisor to be right on the button about the wonderful Drury in New Orleans. We had a room on the main floor with 14 ft ceilings. The snack time was friendly and the food adequate. I was not feeling well enough to go out for dinner the first night. The snacks plus a hot dog took care of our dinner. The breakfast is wonderful, the staff great, the rooms clean and linens fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, sparkling, great service"”
Reviews.Author: phurnie
Reviews.Content: Nice place, okay breakfast, went above and beyond on getting us a roll-away and extra blankets and quickly! Clean & sparkling; mattresses were too soft for 2 out of 3 of us, but were not old and dated.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and a quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanadianCapital
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel. I stayed here for one night pre-cruise during a massive convention that booked up most of the city's hotel rooms. This meant high rates and even hotwire and priceline were not useful. When we stumbled on this hotel on-line we were in luck. Rooms are clean and fairly modern. Bathroom is also clean with decent water pressure. Our room was only two away from the elevators and was very quiet. The hotel is very short walk to the French Quarter and street cars. It is actually situated on the street that becomes Bourbon Street in about two blocks. The freebies are a nice touch. The food wasn't anything stellar but it made for an adequate breakfast and a nice afternoon snack. Free beer/wine is always nice. So was the coffee, pop, and popcorn. The staff are also friendly, funny, and entertaining. A note: the hotel is no longer particularly attractive on the outside. The view from the rooms is also lousy; but you didn't come to New Orleans for the view. The inside is fine. I had no complaints about the hotel given the price. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tacky. Suites without Windows.”
Reviews.Author: travertine6
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights over New Years. The location is ok - it's in the central business district, close enough to walk to the French Quarter and near the streetcar. It's far away from the touristy stuff, but the area is desolate at night and is very modern and not typical New Orleans. We paid extra for a suite with a jacuzzi, and when we got to our room, we discovered that the bedroom had no windows. WTF?!?! How can you charge people more money for a suite and not tell them this? We asked to be moved to another suite because of this, and then they moved us to another suite without any windows in the bedroom. Finally, I read the floor plan and had to tell them which suite to put us in because apparently they did not understand what "bedroom with no windows" meant. The room we did get was nice, but no jacuzzi tub (that we had paid extra for). The design was very cheap and tacky. As for the food, we never ate breakfast there, but it looked like the typical cheap food you wold get anywhere. The free drinks at night were nice, and they did have some fresh veggies/salsa to snack on (as well as other cheap filling food if you want that). The gym was a terrible, cramped room with two treadmills and one other machine, I think. I just tried to walk more during the trip because I didn't want to use it. I think this place would be good to stay if you are on a budget w/ kids because you can feed them, and enjoy drinks in the lounge while they run around. For anyone else, I would pass.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to Drury NOLA”
Reviews.Author: PattyVW
Reviews.Content: We booked this Drury for 4 nts. in late Jan and our first Drury stay proved to be a great experience. The staff was very helpful, curteous AND genuinely friendly. The breakfast buffet and late afternoon Kickback provided basic food (scrambled eggs, sausage patties, biscuits/gravy in a.m. - hot dogs, baked beans, salad in p.m.) and there was plenty of it. The staff was constantly sweeing the dining area for re-stocking and clean-up. The property is well maintained and was extremely clean during our stay to include chandeliers in the lobby that sparkled. There are two P.C.s for printing boarding passess. Our King suite was cavernous and very comfortable. The hotel is an easy walk to the French Quarter, about 4 blocks. Would definitely stay again and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place, great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Yoda08
Reviews.Content: This Drury Hotel was clean, comfortable, spacious, & welcoming for all of the five days we stayed there. Front Desk staff were infallibly courteous and helpful. Breakfast was generous, hours of service good, location convenient , and the evening event thoughtfully served non-alcoholic beverages in some variety, in addition to enough food to make a light meal of, in a pinch. Hotel business computers worked & printed. A really solid place, excellent for its price range.

Reviews.Title: “Black Out”
Reviews.Author: PatB90745
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 5 friends for Mardis Gras 2010. It was the only place that had rooms available for us so we chose this place. It wasn't very clean but that could have been because it was so crowded. I couldn't understand all of the Cajun talk either.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: BusyBees04
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 days at the Drury and found the location, staff and amenities great. The breakfast each morning was cereal, pastries, waffles, toast, bagels and scrambled eggs and sausages. The snack each evening was the same hotdogs, chicken tenders or bites, potatoes, salad items, chips, popcorn, corn chips and salsa plus free alcohol and sodas. The same everyday but it's all free and certainly adequate for our family of 2 kids and 2 adults. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and we didn't have any issues with anything or anyone. Highly recommend hotel for the value and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a larger group”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for a bachelorette party with a group of 8 (two double rooms). Fit the bill perfectly! Location was super close to the quarter, just a 10 minute walk and you're in the heart of the action. Rooms were spacious with enough room for 4 girls to get ready at once. Free evening drinks in the lobby was a great start to the evening and saved us a few dollars compared to expensive drinks on bourbon street! Breakfast was one of the better hotel ones I have had, with a HUGE selection. I felt very safe as access to the building at night and guest floors 24/7 was key card controlled. Business center was fully functioning and another plus. Staff was great, assisted with splitting room bills and called cabs whenever we asked. All in all, the number of amenities and conveniences for this price really cannot be outdone!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel/Inn”
Reviews.Author: archer6325
Reviews.Content: The room are old but have modern conveniences. The staff are outstanding. The front desk clerks are great. Very friendly and helpful. The maid service was OK but not great. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “DRURY IS THE BEST! LOOK NO FURTHER!”
Reviews.Author: Van-Wash
Reviews.Content: My adult son and I stayed at the Drury for a week, including New Year's Eve 2011. This hotel chain is by far the best. The hotel lobby sparkled with a lovely Christmas tree and Christmas ornaments, the first thing I noticed was the marbled surroundings, a nice grand piano, a very homey atmosphere, cozy yet elegant. The "free" breakfast was truly the best ever served and so were the appetizers during Happy Hour. The rooms were nice and spacious and very clean. The staff was excellent, very friendly, congenial and at your service 24/7. Stayed at the Drury San Antonio in 2009 and I vow to stay at no place but the Drury for future travels. It was an easy 12-15 minute walk to the French Quarter, same to the Riverwalk Marketplace. Be sure to join all the major tours (Oak Alley Plantation/Laura Plantation tour, Honey Island Swamp tour, City/Katrina Tour and the Steamboat Natchez. All worth the $$$ and an experience you will never forget. I truly left my heart in NOLA! I hope to be back someday!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!!”
Reviews.Author: gagaabcam
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in both the service we received and our room..We stayed in a King suite on the 7th floor..The living room had a very small window in the corner which looked out onto the brick wall of the next building...We felt like we were staying in a box..The bedroom was completely windowless..Room was not ready at 3pm, nor was it cleaned the next day by 2pm.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Lv2TrvlMemGal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our visit to New Orleans to see the Sugar Bowl. In the past we have stayed closer to Bourbon Street. This was a perfect location to the Superdome, French Quarters/Bourbon Street and the Convention center/casinos. We were able to quickly and easily get everywhere. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was a nice large size and nicely appointed, clean and comfortable. It did not have a separate sitting area/sofa. There was a desk with a chair and one other chair. I did miss a place to sit in the evenings. They served snacks and drinks in the evening, the snacks were a bit tired. The breakfast was great! We will definitely stay here again in the our future trips to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for Bourbon Street Revelry”
Reviews.Author: JurisDr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Drury to bring in the New Year (2011). We were specifically looking for a nice hotel which was close to the French Quarter, and which was pet friendly. This hotel did not disappoint! The hotel was conveniently located to the French Quarter, only a short 4-block walk. You can also walk to Jackson Square and the Cafe Du Monde from the hotel - that is about a 7-block walk. The location of the hotel was perfect. The hotel itself was nice and clean. We opted for a 2-room suite. We were assigned Room 622. We read bad reviews about Room 222 being noisy due to its proximity to the laundry. We did not experience any issues with our room. I will say that the walls seem rather thin and you are able to hear conversations and noise coming from the adjacent rooms. However, this was not a problem for me - and I am a light sleeper. The other negative comment I have about the hotel is the poor quality of the sleeper sofa. The hotel really needs to upgrade the mattresses on the sleeper sofas. Expect to get a backache if you sleep in a sleeper sofa. They have a very nice complementary breakfast complete with scrambled eggs, sausages, french toast, waffles, fruits, toast, muffins, cereals, coffee and juice. You need not venture out of the hotel to have a very nice breakfast - except for the obligatory venture to Cafe Du Monde! They also have a very nice brunch at 5:30 p.m. The offerings vary, but the days we stayed there they offered hot dogs, chicken fingers, chicken wings, meatballs, chips, nachos, and soft drinks. The hotel is truly pet friendly, and they do not charge anything extra for the pets!! That is truly rare to see. Lastly, the staff was very friendly and accommodating. Overall, we had a great experience during out stay at the Drury, and will definitely consider staying there again in our next trip to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “The best all around”
Reviews.Author: bobodawg
Reviews.Content: We picked Drury because of past stays in the St. Louis area. With breakfast and dinner provided, we saved so much since we have children ages 8 and 12. This was our first trip to New Orleans and the location was so convenient. We took the trolley car one day and road throughout the city for only $5 each. The stop is right out the front of the hotel. The other days, we walked and everything was so close. The hotel is beautiful and so clean. The employees are so helpful and we will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean but NOT convenient...”
Reviews.Author: MarylandTravelnutz
Reviews.Content: Just made our 3rd pleasure trip to New Orleans and our first since Katrina. We loved it just as much as always. There is no place in America like the French Quarter. Based on reviews on Trip Advisor we decide not to say in the Quarter this time and tried the highly recommended Drury Inn. It is very clean. The folks are nice and helpful. But, contrary to other reviews, it is not an easy 5 minute walk to the French Quarter. It is about a 10 minute walk to the very edge of the Quarter. When it is late and dark and your are on the far side of the Quarter, it is a very long walk. It is also a bit of a nerve wracking walk at night, in the dark, once you leave the Quarter. The streets are prettty deserted and we were uncomfortable. Let's face it, this is a high crime city. The hotel itself is fine. Breakfast is ok but the hot food is pretty bad. The 5:30 snacks with hot food is really basic bit if you are depending on this for dinner, why did you come to New Orleans for in the first place? Next time we are staying in the French Quarter. Makes life a lot easier.

Reviews.Title: “Post Cruise”
Reviews.Author: glynr34
Reviews.Content: Having never stayed at Drury Inns,I used Trip Advisor to steer me in selecting a Hotel after a cruise.The staff could not have been more accomodating to my wife and I letting us check in by noon.The room was huge,clean and very impressive.We attended the social hour and it was everything they advertise.If you were not in New Orleans,you could have easily made a meal out of their appetizers.We look forward to staying at Drury Inns anytime there is one in locale that we travel to.Thanks for the hospitality,Glyn

Reviews.Title: “Comparible to an express hotel....”
Reviews.Author: gjmn
Reviews.Content: Stayed in rm 513 for one night passing through new orleans. Stayed because of rating on trip advisor. Wish I went with another place PROS- cheap. Decent area. Free wifi. Happy reception. Clean rooms. Old but comfy bed great tv w cable. Low cost easy parking CONS- room reaked of some type of deodorizer..wallpaper peeling. Windows too dirty to see out. Breakfast buffet looked good but all seating taken. You can hear through the walls. Full size double beds not queens. Overall decent place but the craziness at the breakfast buffet with no on site visible staff to corral the crowds was enough to send us four blocks away to mothers restaurant for a great new orleans experience. Room smell irritated everyone but we survived.

Reviews.Title: “My first choice in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: hollywoodChicago
Reviews.Content: We had absolutely no complaints with this hotel. Stayed here pre cruise. Previous reviews have been right on. What a comfy bed and soft linens. We felt as if we were staying in a 5 star hotel. Our king room was spacious with a large TV with cable channels. The personnel were so accommodating especially when they found us a deluxe room when we showed up post cruise with no reservation after our flight had been canceled. And this was during a Saints football weekend. The value of this hotel is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great value; no complaints”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyKilroy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on Poydras Street, which is about a 7 min walk from the French Quarter. It is a safe area, and the advantage of its location vs staying within the Quarter is that it is quiet at night and closer to the Superdome and basketball arena, Riverwalk area, and the excellent National WWII Museum. It is also very close to a really good diner called Mothers if you don't want to walk to the Quarter for a meal. The hotel offers large, clean rooms, complementary breakfast, free drinks and coffee, free dinner (they call it a snack, but with hot dogs, fried chicken, meatballs, vegetables and cocktails, I call it a buffet dinner), and friendly, helpful service. Only drawbacks are the somewhat insipid breakfast, and the old building and rooms (which admittedly is part of the charm). All in all, a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chewySTG
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here before leaving on our cruise. The "Kick back" was a welcome activity after flying all day ! A great way to relax and catch our breathe - warm treats and cool drinks. The staff were very friendly and helpfull - was refered to a very professional suttle service to take us to the docks the next morning. Used them serveral more times on our stay. Good location in downtown area close to French Quarters and Riverwalk. Room was very clean and had everything we needed for our stay. Noticed there was difference in rooms so make sure you ask for larger room. Our room was nice size and the bed was comfy. We would stay at this hotel again and recommend to friends . Oh did I mention they have a hot breakfast in the morning included in the room rate?

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment! Steer clear of Room 222”
Reviews.Author: Vauban
Reviews.Content: I was very excited by this hotel. The website looked great and the reviews on Tripadvisor were all excellent. But after a four night stay over the Thanksgiving weekend I am genuinely sorry to say that I was disappointed by my stay, and wouldn't stay there again. But first the positives: - A room that could accommodate five people. Not to be sneezed at, and always tricky for a family of two adults with three children. The room was a good size, and had two queen beds and a sofa bed. - The hotel looked modern, with tasteful furnishings and was (generally) very clean. - A good price, at least for some of the nights. On the Thursday and Sunday nights, the rooms were priced at $120. A good bargain. On the Friday and Saturday nights, it was an extra 100 bucks - which made the stay much pricier. - Location wasn't bad at all. A ten minute fast walk to the French Quarter or down to the riverfront. And right by the St. Charles streetcar. - Good freebies. The 5.30 Kickback was good - some nice food and drinks (but spirits were dispensed out of a soda fountain device, which was a bit weird; and the drinks were very small.) And breakfast was pretty good - the same every day, but a reasonable selection. So why was I unhappy? - The room (room 222) was dark and uninviting. There were no windows in the bedroom at all - and the lightswitch on the other side of the room. Not helpful. - The room was airless. Neither of the two windows in the living room area could be opened - not even a fraction. So the air was stale. And the view? The room vverlooked the trash bins, and nothing else! - The noise was terrible. The room was next to the hotel laundrette, which was self-operated and open 24/7. And when someone was using the machine, you sure knew about it. Being awoken at 1am by the sound of someone doing their laundry was not great: why couldn't they restrict the operating hours? - But worst of all was the bed. I'm usually not so fussed. But this bed mattress was so soft, it was uncomfortable to sleep in. Both my wife and I left with painful backs, the beds were so unsupportive. In a modern hotel, why were they so bad? - And there were just a number of small niggly things through our stay that made me wonder how well serviced the hotel really was: At bathtime we were realised the room was short of a few towels, so rang down to housekeeping. We were told we had to come down to reception and collect the towels ourselves: never had that happen before. At the drinks reception in the evening, all the beer was off: no explanation as to why. When the ice machine on our floor didn't work, I went up a floor to discover that theirs didn't work either. None of these a major issue of course, but they all contributed to a sense that this was a hotel not really on top of its game. - And the charge for parking was very expensive. We got stung for a premium rate on the Sunday night because of some jazz festival in town. Well I can tell you that Sunday night was quiet in New Orleans, and the car park was empty. So I'm not sure what justified the $28 charge for one night's parking! So all in all a disappointing experience. Some positives for sure, but for us it was the dark and smelly room; loud noises from the adjacent laundrette; and a really uncomfortable bed that defined the experience. Would I recommend you staty here? Not if you got our room!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: trailmix
Reviews.Content: We had a group of 10 (5 rooms) in town for a football game. I selected this property based on the TA reviews, location, and price. We were not disappointed. The hotel delivers excellent value. Rooms were clean and some of them were roomy (others weren't) - ask for the 04 stack of you are renting a king. Breakfast was fine - waffles, sausage, eggs, breads, muffins, bagels, cereals, juice, coffee. Evening snacks/drinks were really not needed given the city we were in and all the awesome dining options but I would think if you had kids with you and they were old enough to leave in the room for a few hours you would be thrilled with the oportunity to feed them chicken nuggets or hot dogs and then go out for a great meal. The drinks were either draft bud light or house wine/whiskey - 3 per person. Service was excellent all around - front desk, housekeeping and others. Rooftop jacuzzi was a nice addition. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “We got lucky. Satisfied and then some...”
Reviews.Author: marco770
Reviews.Content: We were very satisfied with our accommodations here. Located just 2 blocks from the French Quarter and right on the trolley line. Room was HUGE, 2-room suite, 2 TVS, large bath, beautiful lobby. No complaints. Bring your walking shoes because you are several blocks from the convention center (takes about 20 minutes) but everyone is walking and you can state you stayed 'in style' without paying outrageous prices. We based our selection on Trip Advisor recommendations and they were right on AGAIN! Thanx Trip Advisor for a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Close Enough to the Action, Much Nicer Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sevynsimon
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for three reasons: the TripAdvisor rating, the pictures, and all the freebies. It has lived up to all 3. Very good hotel to stay at. You will not be hungry given all the free food. You will not go without internet. You will not be disappointed. A lot of other New Orleans hotels like to describe themselves as "historical". Don't fall for it. "Historical" is a euphemism for "we cheaped out and haven't updated this place in decades". Stay at the Drury Hotel instead and enjoy the modern, comfortable, and reasonably-priced accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: pat099
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights after a 15 day cruise. The rooms are huge, very clean and an excellent bathroom. It is about 3 blocks from the French Quarter. They provided a nice what they call evening snack but it was enough to be our dinner for the first night. It is everything that you see on the website. Breakfast was also very good and included. The staff was very friendly and courteous. It can be a little noisy early evening with traffic. This was a great bargain for New Orleans although not as convenient to the Quarter as some other hotels. If you don't mind walking this could be the place for you. We will stay there again when we go to New Orleans

Reviews.Title: “We liked EVERYTHING about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jill2009
Reviews.Content: Part way through our recent trip to New Orleans, we cancelled our hotel reservations and transferred our suitcases to the Drury Inn & Suites. Although they were the same price, there was a world of differences! First, the lobby is gorgeous, with plenty of couches, chairs, big-screen TV for the games etc. Right off to the left is the spacious breakfast & evening snack area with tables. The front staff could NOT have been any more accomodating considering we walked in off the street at 12 noon (check in is at 3 pm). They found a room immediately. Our room was lovely - mahogany furniture, tiled bathroom with granite countertop. We had a king room, which was slightly larger than a standard hotel room. There was a desk, comfy chair, cabinet with mini-fridge and microwave, flat screen TV, chest of drawers and 2 bed side tables. The bed was perfect - not too hard and not too soft. Very nice linens, although the bath towels are on the small side. We were fortunate to get a room with a view (facing the south) so there was plentiful sunshine and a nice view of the business district. The wonderful breakfast buffet had typical cereal, yogurt, donuts, bagels and also hot items: scrambled eggs, sausage, french toast. Then from 3 -10 pm there are free soft drinks and popcorn off the lobby. Best of all is the free snack/drinks from 5:30pm-7pm. They offer chicken fingers, hot dogs, meatballs, a small salad selection, chips, tortilla chips. In addition each evening, every guest may have up to 3 alcohol drinks. If the lines are long (and I suspect they ususally are) and you'd like all 3, you can request them at once. They will give you a short and tall drink - but they are strong, so pace yourself and you may need extra mixers. I saw families who had their children eat here only. Presumably the adults might be going out for a nicer restaurant! Great place. I can't recommend it highly enought!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, recommended”
Reviews.Author: aud503
Reviews.Content: This is not a fancy place, but it was clean, comfortable and the staff was over the top friendly and accommodating. We stayed in a suite facing the street on the 2nd floor and were not bothered by noise. The breakfast, snacks and FREE wireless and long distance saved us a few dollars over other places we could have stayed and the room rates were great. It is a 10 min. walk to the French Quarter, and don't miss "Mother's" 4 blks down the street for real Louisiana food. We usually stay in Westin, Marriot or the occasional W Hotel but they were all booked and I was frankly skeptical about what to expect at Drury. However, we were pleasantly surprised and enjoyed our stay, and spent far less than we usually do. We'd recommend to other budget-conscious travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Mainly Good”
Reviews.Author: VivaVerdi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located. It is a three block walk to the French Quarter and right by the St. Charles trolley. Despite being located on a busy street, the hotel is quiet at night with one major exception. You hear no street noise but you can hear loud neighbors. I was awakened by drunks yelling in their room at 2 AM. It was hard to pinpoint which room the noise was coming from. My room was comfortable and clean and it was great having two large screen TVs in my suite. High speed internet was generally reliable. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfasts do not vary from day to day but are acceptable. There is a happy hour in the evening with beer and cheap wine but I wondered why anyone would want to eat frozen egg rolls and chicken fingers when you are in one of the great US eating cities. Two food recommendations. I had a superb dinner at Domenica (123 Baronne Street) - about 3 blocks from the hotel. And if you want to try beignets at Cafe Du Monde and don't want to fight the French Quarter crowds, there is a branch at Riverwalk, at the end of Poydras Street.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT! Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: LizEats
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the great Trip Advisor reviews we stayed @ Durys in New Orleans for Halloween! LOVED IT! Location is a short 5 minute walk to the French Quarter Staff is friendly and accommodating. Room was clean and spacious, bed was comfortable, TV was a big flat-screen, and the bathroom was big and modern. The 5.30 Kick Back was a added BONUS = FREE drinks and food (WOW!) Overall this hotel was a great value and I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New Orleans! PS Eat at the Gumbo Shop YUM!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: donster23
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at a Drury Inn early this year and was pleasantly surprised, so I was glad to see one for our vacation to New Orleans. For the price I wasn't expecting much but the reviews were very good and was happy to see that the hotel is easy to get to from the interstate, close to great dining and in a quite (business district) area but 4 blocks from the French quarter. I love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: lhoerner
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in this hotel. The first was before Hurricane Katrina and the 2nd was after in 2010. We remembered having a very nice stay there before so decided to try this hotel again. The location is wonderful...right next to the trolley line (but not a noice issue...very quite). The price is very reasonable. We checked around...an excellent value in my opinion. We got a 2 room King Suite for the 3 of us. We loved everything about this room. The ceilings and windows are old-style tall...which just feels right in this city. There is lots of granite everywhere. The living room is a completely separate room so everyone had their privacy. The king bed was very comfortable. My 17 year old son said the fold out couch was pretty nice too....although he wouldn't want to share it with anyone...then again, he's 6'4 and about 210 lbs.! The breakfast was a very nice buffet, hot, and plentiful with real scrambled eggs, biscuits, bacon, fruit, juice...and the evening cocktails/soda and wings, chips, baked potatoes, hotdogs, veggies, dips, & chicken fingers were plentiful and a great alternative to eating out again. We had a big lunch so just "snack food" was perfect allowing us time to enjoy the pool on the ROOF!! Parking is fenced, selfpark right next to the hotel for about $17. It is within easy walking distance of the famous "Mother's"...and all the traditional New Orleans favorites. When you consider the price of breakfast and the free alcoholic beverages and snacks...it is so worth the price....I think with parking included we paid about $150 tops. I am ready to go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: pcbcla
Reviews.Content: There are so many good reviews for this hotel but I just had to add one more! The staff was top notch and very friendly. The location is great - just several blocks from the Quarter which is an easy walk. We took advantage of the happy hour only of the two days we were there but it was a real bonus. The self parking in the gated lot was convenient and a real plus since so many hotels have valet parking only. We have been to New Orleans about six times previously but this was our first time staying here. This will be our first choice of hotels when we return!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: palicky
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered the hotel reception ( which is beautiful) we were made to feel very welcome. My wife , and my two kids ( 11 &9) had a one bedroom suite which was very clean, comfortable, had a jacuzi bathtub, free wireless and a huge flat screen TV in both rooms. We arrived at 11.00am expecting to be unable to check in till the published time of 3.00pm but we were checked in straight away and had access to our room from then on. Car parking was easy and although we only booked one night the parking was applicable till 6..00pm the next day! Free cocktails in the evening, finger food and soda and popcorn for the kids between 5.30 and 7.00pm was all fantastic and very welcome and the free breakfast for four was also excellent. All this for $180.00 a night ...................never been anywhere else with such value for money and still maintaining an excellent level of quality and service.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms...but not perfect. Great extras/service. Great Value with Group Discount”
Reviews.Author: Chipotle
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in the King Suite. The hotel lobby is beautiful (although there was an un-repaired hole in the ceiling still dripping water). The room itself was very nice (on the surface) with separate carpeted living room-office area, ceramic tiled (marble-like) bathroom & dressing area and large carpeted bedroom. The furnishings appeared fairly modern and new....including the nice high-back office chair. The room had two large flat screen TV's and had plenty of natural light from large windows. Looking closely...the ceramic tiles were uneven and had grout missing is a few areas and the carpet / walls were a little worn in a couple of areas. One of my bi-fold closet doors had fallen off and was resting against the wall when I checked in but it didn't pose a problem for me. The free internet access was extremely fast and the most reliable I had seen in a long time. We enjoyed the free breakfast on one of the two mornings. It was OK. There were a LOT of other freebies that we were unable to enjoy like the evening cocktails and the free (60 minutes) long-distance. With the group discount, we paid only $119/night for the King Suite listed online at $195. At that price, it was a GREAT value.

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe I haven't heard of Drury Inn before now, they rock!”
Reviews.Author: okisarge
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was a pleasant suprise. Never heard of Drury Inn but after reading all the positive reviews, decided to give them a try. The hotel web site didn't have a king room available but I was able to book one from travelocity. Arrived at 3 PM and check in was a breeze. The lobby was immaculate and the dark wood and marble flooring gave it an upscale, stately feel. Our room was clean, comfy, and very roomy for 2 people . We didn't spend much time in it but it was a nice place to recharge. You won't get much of a view from any of the rooms since there's only 9 floors, but you can get a decent view from the roof pool level (pool and hot tub were very well kept by the way). Parking was $19 a night (pretty cheap compared to other hotels). No valet service but the secure, private parking lot is adjacent to the hotel. Leave your car there and use public transportation if at all possible. Parking is very expensive everywhere you go but street cars, buses, taxis are just a few steps from the hotel and cheap. We were a little worried about the neighborhood after driving through a shady area off of I-10, but the area is safe and we were comfortable walking home from Bourbon St well after 12 PM. The staff was very helpful and friendly. They were able to answer all our questions and had great advice on restaraunts and other places. The free breakfast was fresh and the 5:30 kickback drinks and food is awesome. You won't get top shelf booze or steak but the price is right and it's a great way to start off a night in the French Quarter (about 4 blocks away, easy walk). The hotel doesn't sell alcohol at all, so if you want a nightcap, plan ahead. Drury Inn got it right. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for a French Quarter Trip”
Reviews.Author: HmmMan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in or near the French Quarter many times. I used to have a different favorite hotel that I have stayed at several times in a row. They were booked, and I chose Drury based on others reviews. I am glad they were booked because now I have a new favorite.
