The hotel is close enough to walk to the Quarter in just a few minutes, yet far enough to be quiet when you want to sleep. The room rates are highly competitive and parking is half the other hotels. Parking can quickly add up, especially when I never got in my car for the whole trip. The hotel is right on the trolley line, so what you can't walk to, you can ride the trolley. The room was very clean and nicely appointed. The sink is separate from the rest of the bath. A feature my wife likes, so she can get ready while I shower, and not fight the steam. All this great value would be enough to put it over the top. But, then you add in free breakfast. Eggs, biscuits, gravy, fresh made waffles, etc. And when we returned in the evening enough hors d'ors to qualify as dinner some nights, with drinks, alcoholic and otherwise. All this free food saves a lot of money on a hotel stay. Great location, great room, fantastic amenities, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Rooms and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MSUEngineer
Reviews.Content: The Drury Inn New Orleans is a very nice hotel. Although the rooms are small, they are very nice. Bedding is very comfortable. The TV in the room is huge with some HD programming. The hotel in general is very clean. I will stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in New Orleans and WILL BE BACK!!!”
Reviews.Author: Angela C
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. The property is beautiful, but besides that, the staff was amazing! They always were helpful with a wonderful attitude. I did not get to meet the manager, but she arranged a surprise that I requested for my husband for our anniversary. It was beautiful! Reymundo at the front desk is an asset to this hotel - he is wonderful!!! The room was clean and confortable. The pool was nice and fun to use in the afternoon. The hotel is just close enough to Bourbon Street to walk and far enough so you could get out of the party and relax. Thank you Drury staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: boa999
Reviews.Content: Appointed with dark mahogany and granite floors, lobby was quite impressive. The room however was a bit small but nice with a great bed, bath and TV. Internet was OK. The "Kick-Back" h'ordourves and wine at 5:30 was a nice toufch but the wine was off the bottom shelf. The breakfast was excellent. This is a mid-priced hotel with decent location to the Quarter but you can do better. I like Drury Inns but I will not stay here again because there are many hotels closer to Canal street and the Quarter. Parking adjoins the hotel but, as all New Orleans downtown hotels, is an extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Much Nicer than Expected!”
Reviews.Author: CaptainRonn
Reviews.Content: Returning from a cruise, my wife and I decided to extend our holiday by a short stay in New Orleans. The Drury is a short drive up Poydras from the cruise terminal and only about three blocks west of Bourbon Street. We arrived at the hotel about 9:30 a.m.; well ahead of the published check-in time. Knowing this, I asked if I should wait to attempt registering. The front desk clerk, Reynaldo, reviewed my reservation and told me that our room was ready. He is a most pleasant and informative young man! Our room had a king bed and a view of Poydras Street. It was fairly large and was nicely appointed and very clean. The flat screen LG television made watching the Saturday night college football games quite enjoyable. The evening reception consisted of hot dogs, baked potatos, chili, salad, salsa, vegetables, and chips; all fresh! The three free cocktails were a nice inclusion. Overall, the hotel is quite well maintained and staffed with friendly personnel. The parking is on the premises, fenced and lighted. Entry into the hotel after hours requires your room card. The roof-top pool, while small, is adequate and clean. The deck has abundant lounge chairs. This was our first stay at this hotel; but we will definitely stay here again when we return to New Orleans. It offers fairly close access to the French Quarter and a great value lodging in a city with a vast quantity of hotels with a wide variance in quality.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!”
Reviews.Author: mahidave
Reviews.Content: Awsome, old school look in lobby. Rooms really nice and all updated. Great TV, wireless, microwave, fridge in room. Full breakfast in AM. Scrambled eggs, sausage patties, biscuits, french toast, gravy, waffles and all the other stuff. Pool and Hot Tub on the roof, w/ a great view. Evenings from 530 to 7, hot dogs, chicken patties, meatballs, chips crudite,beer, wine and well drinks all free. Rates are very reasonable, and on the corner of Poydras and Carondolet, With a convenient streetcar stop. We didn't rent a car, but they have parking (steep at 17 per day)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: DeltaLady6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week while I attended a convention for my sorority. I did careful reviewing before I selected a hotel. Check- in was a breeze and our room was ready a bit early. We had a regular room. It was rather small, but the high ceilings made it appear a bit larger. The king size bed was comfortable and had nice pillows. The microwave and fridge came in handy and my husband loved the flat screen. The bathroom was roomy and the sink was outside, which was good. My husband thought the towels were thin and small and we were surprised when they did not have lotion as a toiletry. No conditioner either, just shampoo with conditioner. Staff was friendly and helpful. They have a computer area that you may use to quickly check your email and print boarding passes. The pool is on the rooftop, but in the blazing NOLA sun, there are no chairs with umbrellas. The breakfast came in handy, but it is the exact same thing everyday. I just wish they had bacon at least 2 out of 6 days. The 5:30 kickback was nice. You are guaranteed hot dogs every night and another meat like meatballs or chicken strips on random days. You will receive a card at check-in. Show this and you are allowed 3 drinks at their nightly "bar". The line is long, but they can make a good variety. Free soda and popcorn from 3-10 was great for a quick snack. Out Drury's door and to the right is Cardolet street. The St. Charles street car stops here and goes straight to Bourbon or walk down Cardolet and it turns into Bourbon when you cross over Canal. About a 10 minute walk. Dixie Gyros(Cardolet) had good, cheap, homecooked food and Mothers (Poydras) is the best if you can stand the line. Also visit the Riverwalk Mall at the end of Podrays by the Morial Convention Center. We enjoyed making Drury our home for a week and definitely would return. The extras made it well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel where you really do not pay for extras!”
Reviews.Author: kmisra
Reviews.Content: Took a trip this month (4 days) to New Orleans and landed up booking at the Drury Inn & Suites hotel in New Mexico. This was my first stay at the Drury Inn hotel chain as we do not have any in the NY-NJ areas. I have to say, I was really surprised to see that they really do give you a lot of extras. Not only was breakfast part of the deal but their 5:30 Kickback (as they call it) was wonderful. Every evening from 5:30-7pm we got hot dogs, baked potatoes, chicken fingers, chilli, salad, salsa and chips and 3 alcoholic drinks per person all FREE. Also there was free popcorn and soda after 3pm. Hotel was walking distance to Bourbon Street and tram cars were over on the next block. Parking was also cheaper compared to the other nearby hotels. Great hotel, comfortable beds and good location. Definetely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location and great service!”
Reviews.Author: shmeebee
Reviews.Content: I traveled to New Orleans with my husband for a 3 night stay. This was our first trip here and we had a blast! The Drury Inn was the perfect place to stay! The breakfast was perfect, the free drinks/food at happy hour were a plus, and the staff couldn't have been more friendly!. Our room was very clean, bigger than I expected (just a standard room) and the bathroom had a marble look. The in-room fridge & microwave was awesome. We utilized the pool every day and it was very quiet and refreshing. The fitness room contained 2 treadmills & 1 bike and a flat screen tv. No weights, but at least there was a place to run off some fun from the night before! The location was a few short blocks to anything and everything! We always opted for the main streets, and never felt scared on any of our walks around town (even at 2am). We will stay here again the next time we visit for sure! Make sure to get a "hand grenade" at Tropical Isle. 3 will get the job done. Enjoy!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of perks - perhaps to make up for shortcomings.”
Reviews.Author: wideawake02
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because there were no pet fees (in a city that seems to like to charge $50-$150 per stay). We were also excited by the free happy hour (which we missed) and the rooftop pool (which is tiny). However, regardless of these short comings, it was reasonably priced for what you got. The bed was comfortable enough and our "view" was ok (apparently "view" means you don't face a wall.. seriously). We were refunded the extra $9 we paid to get a view and a jetted tub. The staff was incredibly nice and although you pay $19 (incl. tax) to park (on non-event days), you are allowed to come and go. Definitely worth considering because of the price, especially if you have a pet. Just be aware these perks aren't in place because they're nice...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: 60795Traveler
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, excellent location. We walked to the French Quarter, the Aquarium, and the St. Charles St. street car is a block away. Enjoyed the free breakfast and happy hour! When walking home from the French Quarter at night, I'd suggest walking back up Royal Street rather than Bourbon, as when you cross Canal Street, its better lit and less desolate. We never had a problem either way, however.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Stay”
Reviews.Author: drw2112
Reviews.Content: The noise level is pretty high here. We could always hear the people in the room next to ours.Clean Comfortable room, but it doesn't help when you can't sleep because of noise. Also disturbed that this hotel has the need to charge you 17.00 a day to park in their lot when you stay at their hotel, just another fee to make money.

Reviews.Title: “Drury Inn made our stay for Essence, Festival....Superb!!”
Reviews.Author: joakley717
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Drury Inn from July 1st - 5th and every day of our stay was great. - Wonderful location on Poydras. Walking distance to the Bourbon, Superdome, and the Convention Center. - The free breakfast buffet was a nice bonus (Waffles, french toast, eggs, sausages, biscuits, fruit and drinks)! - Comfortable king size bed and a very nice sized room. - Very nice bathroom. - 3 free drinks every evening. Just an overall excellent stay. We'll definitely be back to the Drury Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: sheeray2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Drury July 1-5 for the Essence Music Festival. The staff was friendly and helpful and the room was clean with a flat screen t.v. and comfortable king size bed. The room was smaller than it appears in the pictures, but it was still nice. The "free" breakfast in the morning was the usual waffles, cereal, muffins, etc... that they have at any other hotel. The evening snack was so so, chips, chicken fingers, hot dogs, kind of childrens birthday party fare. The website said they change slightly each night, but this didn't happen. The drinks were great, the bartender was not stingy with the alcohol. Also, it was close to everything we needed, the Superdome, the convention center, The French quarter and Harrah's casino, we walked everywhere. I would stay here again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Cold showers for two days”
Reviews.Author: kcburns
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and had cold showers both days... could not get hot water in the shower on any af multiple tries throughout the day and night.... three trips to the front desk proved fruitless.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: sirsteve03
Reviews.Content: Great service. Rooms were clean and comfortable with plenty of room It is only a short 5-10min walk to French quarter. Free Breakfast, some free drinks and food in the early evening. Free soda and popcorn, Free Internet/Business Centre, Pool, Exercise Room. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves to be No 1”
Reviews.Author: lisalashes7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and was very impressed. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful and we didn't have to pay for parking so that was handy! The room was a good size and nicely decorated. The pool on the roof was great after a hot day walking around and good views. Between 5.30pm - 7pm they have free food and drink in reception, and they have a free drinks and popcorn machine running all day. This hotel was a good location - about 10 mins walk to Bourbon Street and the water front.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great extras, pretty inside.”
Reviews.Author: luckycharmsisters
Reviews.Content: Pros: Drinks/popcorn from 3-10; Snacks/drinks from 5:30-7; pretty interior; comfortable rooms; pool/hot tub on roof. Cons: parking extra/awkward parking; outside door broke causing long walk to front; ice machine broke. We encountered employees that were beyond nice but had a run-in with two who were just rude (gossiping loudly; treating customers as if they were stupid because they couldn't use elevator). Overall- good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very helpful and friendly staff, extras were well worth it.”
Reviews.Author: lzone
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in mid-June. Loved the rooftop pool; breakfast and evening food choices were great for travelling with teens. Close proximity to street car was an added bonus. Jamie and Lance at the front desk were very helpful in arranging airport taxi service, as well as a plantation tour that picked us up right at the hotel. I initially made reservations for a single room, but when a friend decided to join us, I was able to upgrade to a suite at no extra cost. Would definitely stay there again, and will look for Drury's in other cities I travel to, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I stayed here while attending the conference”
Reviews.Author: BostonWagga
Reviews.Content: For three nights after a conference we stayed here (It would have been nice to stay at this location during the conference as well). We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of our stay. The hotel was simple friendly and in close proximity to the French Quarter. Our room was clean internally, however, we noted some mold on the outside of the windows that was a little off putting. The breakfast was a nice inclusion much better that we expected and together with the afternoon drinks and food make this Hotel a great deal. We walked the short distance to Bourbon Street and felt safe walking to the French Quarter. The service was in general pretty good, but, we did have one minor moment at checkout where we ask for a Taxi to be called and they forgot to follow-up.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: mbbinsc
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night while traveling through and visiting a niece. We wish we had more time for this great hotel. Pleasant staff; evening reception with food and drinks; clean,spacious room; roof top pool and on a street car line ( the kids loved looking at them); great breakfast and easy parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer2003
Reviews.Content: We stayed here anticipating a good experience based on other reviews and weren't disappointed. It's in a good location so it's convenient for a weekend trip when you want to be close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was comfortable, well kept and well priced!”
Reviews.Author: sjpage
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and were pleasantly surprised by the quality of our stay. The hotel is classy and friendly. Our room was quiet and clean. The breakfast was better than most and the happy hour drinks and snacks are a great deal! We felt safe walking to Bourbon Street in the French Quarter, only a few minutes away. When we saw how noisy the French Quarter is at night, we were glad we elected to stay a few blocks away. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimberstudio
Reviews.Content: This hotel is blocks from the Quarter and it's right on the trolly line. We were able to walk or ride the trolly to everywhere we went. For the price Drury is the best value in New Orleans. We slept very well and the breakfast and dinner were very good. We plan on staying here again in January when we go back to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: PeterSheryl
Reviews.Content: Four night stay and this hotel is very clean and offers generous hot buffet breakfast and bonus of Happy Hour each evening which includes free cocktails etc and hot/cold snacks. Staff are very attentive and friendly. Three block easy walk to French Qtr and all the action. Would definately use this hotel for any type of visit to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible, worth the money and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Christine75
Reviews.Content: When we first walked in, the lobby was beautiful. It had lot's of marble throughout. The lady at the service desk was wonderful, made you feel right at home. When we finally made to our 2 room suite, it was way beyond our expectation. The room was georgous, high ceilings, marble bathroom, 2 flat screen tv's, microwave, refrigerator and then I walked into the bedroom. Very beautiful. Right outside our window, you can see the city, the street cars and the bridge that crosses the Mississippi. You had to have a room key to use the elevators, to enter the parking area and to leave the parking area. I felt very safe. The french quarters was a short distance and everything else was just a short distance. With 2 teenage kids we took advantage of the free breakfast and the 5:30 kickback, which servers hot wings, chicken tenders, baked potatoes, egg rolls, chips, salad and veggies. You can't beat this anywhere I else.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIFIC!!”
Reviews.Author: adrian1424
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the weekend of March 20 2010. Hotel was very clean and the staff was exceptional and very friendly. This hotel is on the same street and the same side as the superdome, about a 3 block walk. A lot of this area still shows the affect of the hurricane but it is a very nice hotel. Take full advantage of the free meals served in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “recommend for casual traveler especially with pets...”
Reviews.Author: jleib110
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at the Drury Inn this past weekend and had a nice experience. We were traveling with our dog and the hotel was very accommodating. If you don't like dogs, DO NOT STAY HERE. Several other travelers had their dogs and I could see if you're not a dog person and you get on the elevator with a dog, you may be uncomfortable. The rooms were very nice and clean and there is an adequate roof top pool. The most interesting part of the stay is that there are free food/drinks everyday at 530p. It's just hot dogs, chili, nachos, veggies and dip, etc but it's a great touch if you're traveling with friends or a young family and want to have a quick bite before a meal or even make a dinner out of it. If you're traveling to experience the food of new orleans, it's not worth it to eat the free food. You're also provided 3 free cocktails during that time. It's a pretty good deal. Also included is a free breakfast that was decent. All in all, I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone that is not turned off by the occasional dog.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of hotel”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadagain567
Reviews.Content: Rooms are big and have all the extras, microwave, fridge, digital tv, coffee maker, free internet access and even telephone calls. On top of that they is free coffee in the lobby all day. The breakfast offered a good choice from cereals, porridge etc, as well as hot food. But then from 5.30 through to 7.00 there was free drinks along with hod food and snacks, a great way to socialise with others staying in the hotel. I did not get to use the pool. Location is on a main street, 2 blocks ( 5 mins walk from canal st/bourbon st), 10 mins to the casino. At night I felt fairly safe but like anywhere it is important to be aware of your surroundings. The hotel is very good but those extras make this a winner

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and quiet”
Reviews.Author: LTtravels2003
Reviews.Content: Traveled to New Orleans on business with my family. We chose to stay here because of the free breakfast - a big plus for us. They have a reasonably priced parking lot, and the free internet was an unexpected bonus. A little bit of a walk to the French Quarter, but really close to the streetcar line if you want to head into Uptown/Garden District.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Caeli
Reviews.Content: We booked this for the Jazz Fest and are very pleased with its room, lobby area, free hot breakfast. It offers free cocktails and hot food in the evening, but missed it because it ends at 7PM (same time as the festival.) You can walk to trolly/bus to festival, but found taxi ($5 a person) more convenient. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “...in the superlative degree of comparison only”
Reviews.Author: GeoMedic
Reviews.Content: It was not the best of times, it was not the worst of times, it was a stay of convenience, it was a stay of availability... Why I'd prioritize a stay there again beats the Dickens out of me. It got the job done. Like a C student, it did what it was supposed to do but there was no flair, no interest... nothing that took it above and beyond average. The stay left me non-plussed... a grand "so-what" in the expanding universe of hoteldom. The hotel is located on Poydras, a fairly busy traffic street in the downtown area. It is about a 10 minute walk to Canal St. The Drury is in an older building a little off the tourist beaten track. On arrival I was slightly delayed as the front desk was vacant. The lobby was littered with the tired, the poor, the huddled masses yearning for early check-in, the wretched refuse of airport lore. Most were families... noisy rug rats scattered across the lobby, slobbering over the popcorn machine, swilling down Coke and Dr Pepper to fuel the irrepressible din. Luckily, I took the room less occupied by, and that made all the difference. Clean and quiet up on the 6th floor. A moderately sized, bright and airy room with 14 foot ceilings a comfortable bed and a 32" flat-screen upon which to watch the Masters (golf as opposed to literary this time) provided a nice place to hide out from work. The shower was forceful enough and hot water seemed not to be a problem even at peak use time. Temperature control in the room was excellent. Better than most hotels and that led to a good night's sleep. While there is a paucity of commercial and eating establishments in the immediate area, there is a decent convenience store about a block away for snacks and fluid. On departure, again nobody was at the front desk, so as there was no problem with the under-door bill in the room, I just left. The staff, when present was friendly and welcoming and the hotel got the job done. A number one ranking though for the city?? Not from me I'm afraid. No complaints of consequence... but still... a solid C student.

Reviews.Title: “Might Stay There Again, Might Not”
Reviews.Author: saucyredhead
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel in a convenient location just four short blocks from the French Quarter. Would've given it four stars but for the plumbing problems. Toilet stopped up our first morning there. Hotel offered us choice of a new room or "we'll fix the plumbing while you are out today." Proffered room was smaller, two Queens instead of a King, on a lower floor and with a view of (no joke) trash dumpsters in an alley! We decided to stay put. Next night at 4 AM toilet overflowed, this time flooding entire room! Were moved in the middle in the wee hours to a new, this time acceptable room and comped for one night of our stay. Complimentary breakfast and afternoon happy hour are a nice touch and appeared more than adequate. (Even though our schedule didn't permit us the opportunity to take advantage of them.) Appreciated the free wifi internet, and the complimentary coffee, juice and soft drinks available throughout the day. Parking at $17 a night isn't a bad price for New Orleans, however, the parking lot is small and we arrived back at the hotel late one evening to find it full! (Hotel did accommodate by allowing us to park in a non-marked "space" by the door, but we noticed the next morning many vehicles were double-parked and stacked -- and since there is no parking attendant, this must create a problem for some guests who get blocked in.) Will be stay there again? Maybe. If we can't do better. (You REALLY need to work on that plumbing, guys. We overheard other guests complaining about it too!)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: PCmtnchick
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend, dog and myself are driving across country. New Orleans was one of our stops. We stayed at the Drury because of it's location and the fact that they are dog friendly. The staff were VERY friendly and helpful. You have to pay for your parking but worth it. Your car stays safe! Happy hour was awesome and so was the free breakfast. Great location, within walking distance to everything in the French Quarter!! Would stay there again for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: subtchr
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Drury Inn with my 18-year-old daughter as part of a spring break road trip. We arrived on a Monday about 4:30 and checked out the next morning around 9, although we left our car in the Drury lot until late afternoon, after making sure it was okay to do so. I highly recommend this hotel for a trip to NOLA! We got a good rate, and when you add the "value" of the evening drinks and snacks as well as the breakfast, it's a steal. Each guest receives a card for up to three alcoholic drinks in the evening (5:30 - 7 when we were there, not sure if that is always the time frame), which includes beer, wine, and mixed drinks. The food offered was great - salad, veggies, dip, nachos, baked potatoes, chicken wings, egg rolls, chips, pretzels, and cheese sauce for the nachos and potatoes. It was enough for a light supper. Breakfast was the usual offerings, including waffles, eggs, sausage, etc. And there was popcorn and soda available until I think 10:00 at night. The service at the front desk was very welcoming and helpful, and the lobby is pretty. The room was well-appointed, and the wireless internet worked great. I am assuming the building was something else before the Drury, because the ceilings in the rooms are incredibly high, not something that would be built these days! Even though it was a little on the cool side, we enjoyed the rooftop pool. It was awesome floating around and looking out at the lights of the city! Unfortunately, the hot tub was not operating when we were there. The walk to the French Quarter is a pretty good hike, maybe a half mile or so, but we did not mind, since the weather was nice and we knew how far it was before we set off. Although since it was just the two of us I made sure we were back at the hotel before dark, we felt quite safe walking in the neighborhood. Overall, we found this hotel to be a GREAT value, and we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great, but be aware of tour groups”
Reviews.Author: lettuceleaf
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff and facilities were great. The location was convenient to the river, and within reasonable walking distance to WWII Museum and French Quarter, and steps away from the Streetcar to the Garden District. When we were there, there were many tour groups including two different groups of high school kids. The only problem here being that they inundate the meal areas with large groups eating at the same time, and then act as if they own the place. So, if you see a tour group there, try to find out what time they're due to head out in the morning and avoid breakfast just prior to that. Other than that, thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best value hotel in fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: IdyllicItaly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here two nights, at the beginning and end of our trip to Houma, LA. It is everything other reviewers have said - immaculate, in excellent repair, friendly competent service, and extra goodies. Besides the complimentary breakfast and hot and cold snacks and drinks in the evening (5:30 to 7 pm), they also have complimentary coffee and tea all day and complimentary soda and popcorn in the evening until 10 pm. The food is basic with nutritious options. We were very pleasantly surprised by the location. It is a few short blocks to the French quarter and the immediate surroundings are quite lovely and well-lighted. Almost directly across the street is the Le Pavilion Hotel, a white limestone gem of a building, and nearby, too, are the W Hotel and the International House. The Drury is located on the corner of Poydras and Carrollton streets. As we arrrived, we looked up and saw the green trolley car of the St. Charles line (which travels on Carrollton St. on part of its return). That afternoon, we boarded it on St. Charles St., one block away, and rode uptown beyond the Audubon Park. The trolley continues another 20 minutes or so. We got off just beyond the Audubon Park and re-boarded another trolley headed back to the hotel. Another time, we would plan to get off at one of beautiful neighborhoods and explore the area on foot. The homes are magnificent. We passed by some stunning blocks of mansions, handsome college campuses (Loyola and Tulane) and also some residential and commercial areas that were much less attractive. Be advised that the trolley runs into the early morning hours and the noise can carry upstairs to some of the hotel rooms. We discovered that our first night because we had a corner room with great views from where we could see the trolley. They have many rooms facing an interior space which must be very quiet. However, we chose the same corner room on a lower floor for our last night because we loved the views and the noise was infrequent, especially late at night. The rooftop pool, while small, is a great pleasure. It is heated so you can use it year round. At night, you can see several illuminated domes and handsome buildings. There is also a hot tub next to the pool. Probably the best surprise was the closeness of many fine restaurants, including Luke, Herbsaint, Trattoria Leonardo, and Mother's. Luke and Mother's serve three meals a day. Our first night, we had a pizza at nearby Reginelli's, which was excellent. (Reginelli's is located in at least 2 or 3 other places in New Orleans.) We looked in at Stanley! which faces Jackson Square (it's at the right when facing St. Louis Cathedral). It looks like a great place to stop for a snack any time of day or a light meal. We travel to New Orleans annually, and we will return to the Drury without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “For the same price, but a better nights sleep, stay at a Hampton or H.I. - this hotel was full of DOGS!”
Reviews.Author: Freethinnker
Reviews.Content: I was unaware of the Drury Pet policy and it was off putting to have dogs walking through the lobby, right where the food is served. Dogs in the elevator with you, dogs barking in the hallways and while you are trying to sleep! (and I am a dog owner!) I have stayed in N.O. many times, many different hotels. For the same price, or lower, you can stay in a hotel with better bedding, such as the W Hotel, or even a Hampton. The beds had thin polyester bedspreads and one very thin vellux type blanket - very old fashioned in my opinion. I was cold in my bed all night. The free food was low quality, unlike what I have had at another Drury. The breakfast was fair, similar to a Hampton Inn free breakfast. The snack fest at 5:30 was bagged lettuce, carrot sticks, celery, then for hot food, hot dogs, beans (?!?) fried chicken strips, next night there were hot wings and eggrolls. Sort of like food from a convenience store. Low grade wine and liquor, but hey it's free! Some how I was still disappointed, I suppose from my expectations from staying at the Drury in San Antonio. The room key readers in the elevators wouldn't work easily, nor at the room. The room was clean - but it did bother me to think that dogs had stayed in it before me! the room decor was fair, to out dated again, like the bedspread. No pay per view movies available - only HBO. The hotel is located in the Central Business District, so no restaurants open on the weekends. You have to walk at least 5 blocks or so before you hit Canal Street and some restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scrabble2008
Reviews.Content: Like most of the people here, I had great time there. I really enjoy my stay and I can easily return and recommand it to others. There are "extras" in Drury who make travel there a must. Location is also perfect. We had no problems with the check-in, check-out or the room. I only keep good memories of my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Bad customer service tainted the experience...”
Reviews.Author: miumiu4me
Reviews.Content: I booked a last minute room at the Drury and arrived on the same day. When I arrived, the front desk people told me I didn't have a reservation in the system, but they figured it might show up later that evening. So, they rebooked me and told me they'd check and make sure there was only one reservation in the system later that evening. When we went to check out the next morning, the front desk people checked the system and told me there was only one room reserved under my card and I'd been billed for it alone. My husband and I had breakfast (it was good) and we checked out. Three weeks later, I checked my credit card bill and noticed I'd been double billed. So, I called the Drury and was transferred to the billing department. I left two messages for them, but they never called me back. I called again and told the front desk girl what was going on. She looked me up by name and, apparently for the first time, by credit card. I explained the situation and she said she reversed the charges. I checked my credit card statement the next day and found out I had been triple charged for the room. At this point, my patience wore out. I called the Drury again, got transferred around (and accidentally disconnected), and finally got the charges straightened out. The Drury Hotel is actually quite nice. The location is decent - downtown between the French Quarter and the Garden District - and the hotel is well maintained. There are a lot of extras included. I would recommend this hotel if there hadn't been so many customer service problems with so many different employees.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexWriter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Drury for two nights. Check in was very smooth, and the rooms were great. Very clean and comfortable. Our window overlooked the street outside, and so we could watch the street car come and go. They traveled past all night, and we could hear the sound but it was not bothersome whatsoever. It was like hearing a low rumble of thunder every once in a while. While we were there we walked to the WWII museum, the Riverwalk, the French Market and Canal Street. We rode the street car from the hotel up to the beautiful Garden District and back again. The kids made use of the pool and hot tub on the roof. Parking was convenient, and the breakfast and snacks/drinks were excellent! We walked several blocks south to eat at Mother's one night (after dark) and would highly recommend. I'd like also to say that if you've heard New Orleans is dangerous, we had no experiences that would make us believe that.

Reviews.Title: “Our first trip to a Drury Inn and it won't be out last.”
Reviews.Author: manateeluvrCanada
Reviews.Content: We booked the Drury Inn in New Orleans because of the extras such as Breakfast, snacks and drinks in the evening, free internet and long distance. Our room was spacious and clean. The bed was comfortable. Breakfast in the morning was more than we expected. The evening snack did us for dinner and included were 3 drinks, wine or beer. The atmosphere was warm and friendly. The front desk staff were very helpful, especially Lance and Jamie. This is a chain we will certainly book again. Great value for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for the price and location in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: Monicakt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference. The location was great! The rooms were nice and clean. I was impressed about the refrigerator in room and fully cooked breakfast in the mornings. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: KathySBryantAR
Reviews.Content: Well, it was Voo Doo nite in N'awlins but we certainly were not under a hex ! We arrived at the Drury and much to our surprise that plain square building held the most beautifully inviting lobby and most accomodating guest service representatives that I have ever met. Upon check in the clerk explained to us that they are under renovations and that our room would not be available, I began to worry b/c there was 6 of us to share a suite. The clerk could see the worry on my face and said don't worry... we are going to give you 2 rooms for the same price. WOW.... one of which was a suite and a "spectacular" suite it was! Marble, mirrors, dark wood trims, flat screen tvs, fresh as a daisy linens and what a view from the master suite. I was on the 8th floor but on Cloud 9! Sadly we were only there for the night to catch a cruise the next day, however what time we were there was awesome the evening social was superb, hostess was so friendly, the horsdeurves were very tastey and the margaritas hit the spot! I only wish we were staying longer. The cruise of course was fantastsic (Carnival-Fantasy) but "THE Drury" is my new NOLA regular! I would recommend this to anyone and these guys were even under construction.(Quietest little workers I never did hear) !!! Thank you Drury... YOU ARE SPECTACULAR !!!! K. Stapleton - Bryant, AR

Reviews.Title: “Your Best Hotel Bet in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: LilToasty
Reviews.Content: It's no wonder this hotel is #1 on TripAdvisor for New Orleans. After a customer service disaster at the nearby Sheraton, my husband spoke with the Drury and they welcomed us to come on over. The Drury was beautifully decorated for the Christmas holidays, and has a grand piano in the lobby. The friendly front desk staff made us and our cat feel welcome. They even comped our parking in their adjacent parking lot. There is a great free breakfast and evening drinks every day. They have a pool and a little fitness center, which are free to guests. Our room was clean and the bathroom floor and walls were all granite. The hotel was an easy few-blocks walk, or few-moments drive, to the French Quarter. The Drury was far cheaper AND far friendlier than the nearby Sheraton we were supposed to stay at, so we were altogether thrilled with our stay at Drury. We would definitely stay here again if we return to New Orleans, and have already recommended the Drury Inn to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with Drury New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Hutch_Factor
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute trip to New Orleans for one night during the weekend just prior to Mardi Gras. I selected the Drury based on its high rating on TripAdvisor and the reasonable rates we found on the Internet. We were very pleased with our stay. The location was fantastic. I wanted to be close to the French Quarter without actually staying in the Quarter. The Drury was only a few blocks from the Quarter and a very short walk to the St. Charles parade route. The self-parking lot was convenient, secure, and well-attended. The room and public areas were clean and well maintained. The bathroom was clean and had a great shower. We had a great night's sleep and had a fantastic complimentary breakfast in the morning. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Merg55
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in the Quarter before but was going on a cruise and just wanted a good place to stay without paying an arm and leg. It is a nicely decorated hotel. All personal we dealt with was very nice and friendly. Our room was clean, the bed comfortable and we had a good nights sleep. The free "snacks" was enough for a small meal. Given 3 coupons for drinks. We enjoyed our food and drinks. In the morning, after a hot breakfast (not just danish and cereal) we went to the desk and they called a taxi for us. A few minutes later we were off to the cruise ship. I look forward to returning to the Drury Inn the next time we are in New Orleans. Had zero complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, clean and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Cecilesmom
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 5 days and although our room was small, we were very happy with the service and location. Since the hotel is so centrally located, we decided not to rent a car, but to walk and use the trolly system instead. We are so glad we did!! The hotel is no more than 6 blocks from the French Quarter or Garden District and an easy trolly ride to either. The breakfast was good and after some HUGE lunches, the evening snacks were often all we needed for dinner. Staff was kind, helpful and accommodating. We booked our room for $89 a night on Travelocity, which seems like a great deal!!!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: ilive4sun
Reviews.Content: We're glad we booked this hotel and can see why it's rated so highly on TripAdvisor. The location was good for us. Not right in the thick of Bourbon Street, but about a 12-15 min. walk. We liked that the parking lot was self-serve and we didn't have to call a valet if we wanted to retrieve something from the car. We walked all over the city from the hotel and didn't really need a taxi. The front desk staff there is very friendly and helpful with directions, suggestions, etc. The room was large and had a microwave, refrigerator and flat screen TV with HBO. The bathroom had good counter space, but the door was in the way of the toilet and shower area. My husband is tall, so he had trouble seeing all of his face in the mirror, but the showerhead was nice and high. Everything was in good working order. You can't beat Drury's evening cocktail hour. Our first night there, they introduced their new hot food items, which rotate throughout the week. They had egg rolls and chicken wings one night, and meatballs and chicken fingers the next. They also had the usual chips and salsa, popcorn, pretzels, etc. You get 3 drinks each, which got us tuned up for Bourbon Street nicely! We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Hopefully they will keep their rates competitive for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for saints games”
Reviews.Author: bkrpp
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, from the extended checkout to the hot breakfast in the morning. Rooms are comfortable, with plasma tv'. Afternoon snacks and happy hour is also really good. Bourbon Street is 6 blocks away on St. Charles, casino 6 blocks and superdome in other direction is 5 blocks. Half the price of other hotels with more amneities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Between French Quarter and other parts of town.”
Reviews.Author: SRBT
Reviews.Content: As you'll see in other reviews, the Drury is just wonderful! Super nice staff, clean and nice rooms, great happy hour, hot breakfast and in a good location near the French Quarter. We visited locations around the city and it was easy to get everywhere by taxi (no fighting the crowded streets of the French Quarter) and also easy to walk to the French Quarter. If you are going to spend every moment in the French Quarter stay closer but if not, this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Drury, A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: danzmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Drury for 3 nights beginning New Years Eve for the Sugar Bowl. From the first person we met at the reception desk to the security guard and housekeeping staff, everyone could not have been nicer and more accomodating. The girl who checked us in was able to get us 2 rollaways without problem, extra towels arrived promptly . The rooms are of normal hotel size, and ours was a nice room looking south toward the river. There was always a large group of us and other groups in the lobby, and we were allowed to gather there which was great. The evening reception did not have the hot food that was shown on the website, but the snacks were adequate, and nice to have cocktails at the hotel before going out for the evening. Someone else mentioned that there was a long line and only 1 person working on NYE, but the other 2 nights we were there , there was 2, so I think it was more a matter of someone not showing up for work, plus the hotel was sold out, due to the Sugar Bowl. Never had to wait long on an elevator, and the halls were surprisingly quiet for a sold out hotel at New Years. Parking was $15/night with in and out privileges which is probably lower than most hotels in the area. There is a trolley stop, which we did not use, outside of the hotel. The hotel is just about 5 easy walking blocks to the mouth of bourbon street, an easy walk to Riverwalk area and the Harrah's casino, although that walk is not very populated with people and would not recommend it at night. Superdome is on the same street about 4 block easy walk. Only advice is to please be aware of you surroundings, and walk in groups, as a couple in our group were mugged while by themselves at night. One unknowingly got his ATM card taken, and another, someone reached into his pocket for money. I would recommend the hotel, and stay there again if there for the same purpose. Might stay a little closer to French Quarter, though, if that was the primary focus for our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in downtown area”
Reviews.Author: Lucretious
Reviews.Content: we stayed on new year's eve so price was a bit high, but hotel was good if you like standard looking hotel rooms and lobbies. free breakfast buffet was good as well. we tried to take advantage of free happy hour but drink line was long and there was only one server (presumably to reduce their costs). 3 blocks or so to edge of french quarter, seemed safe and not a long walk if you don't mind walking.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: birkbee
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect- within walking distance to the French Quarter, but enough of a distance that you're away from the street traffic and noise. The lobby is beautiful and has it's own character. The rooms are spacious, clean and updated with nice flat screens, a fridge and microwave. There is free long distance within the US and free drinks from 5:30pm-7:00pm, and free juice and fountain pop in the lobby! This is where I will stay again and I'll highly recommend to anyone visiting New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: seauonboard
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 4 on Nov 27th and headed right out the door to meet up for friends for dinner. Our friends were also staying at the hotel. The hotel was very full as the Bayou Bowl was Nov 28th. We returned in time for happy hour which was very nice. There is a soda fountain bar for those that donâ€™t drink alcohol. The person running the bar can make most of the common drinks. Tips are gladly accepted and the drinks are worth a buck or two. There was popcorn and nachos. Canâ€™t remember if there was anything else. After we ate we were off again and didnâ€™t return until after 11. The bed was comfy. Breakfast in the morning was very nice. Large selection and it was hot. The parking area is small. We were going on a cruise (leaving that Saturday) and were afraid to take the luggage down and return as we were sure if we would have a space when we returned, so we asked the hotel to call a cab and the arrived quickly. Even though the cruise terminal isnâ€™t that far away I would not attempt walking your luggage down. There is a service road that runs along the pier but youâ€™re not supposed to walk in the area. People do â€“ but it is very busy when the ship is in. It is worth the $7 each to take the cab. No resturant but our friends daughter wasn't feeling well (too much junk food) and the front desk had menus for all kinds of places that delivered. They were able to get won ton soup delviered. All in all a good night.

Reviews.Title: “Taking a Cruise?”
Reviews.Author: OneSoaringSpirit
Reviews.Content: Out of everything I have researched, and called, this is the place to stay! You must call [--] and ask for the NOLA package. That comes with your hotel stay, your vehicle parked there for a week, happy hour in the evening, and a FULL breakfast. It's just dollars short of parking here, or at the port. Besides, the staff is super friendly, and for $7.00 the taxi will take you right to the door at the port! Walking distance to the Museums. Check out the WII museum!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Drury & it's staff”
Reviews.Author: coronah
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to NOLA for my 30th birthday and we chose the Drury based on a recommendation from a friend. We are so glad we did! What a great deal! Free breakfast, free drinks, free wiFi, free long distance (we're Canadian so we only got 15mins of free long distance/day but that was all we needed to call home once & check in!). We arrived early on Thursday morning thinking we'd have to just leave our luggage with the front desk as check-in time isn't til 3pm. However, we were welcomed by the nicest lady ever (Jamie at the front desk! You have fans in Canada!) who ushered us straight to our comfortable, clean, quiet room. Our friends arrived a few hours later - they had a small issue with the bathroom in their room but were promptly moved with no grumbling from staff. We took full advantage of Happy Hour every night before going out, usually bringing our drinks back up to our room (The Drury attracts a lot of Senior Citizens so we just went upstairs and left them to it rather than disturbing anybody). The beds were SO comfortable I slept like the dead every single night and was actually disappointed when I had to leave and come home to my own bed! The hotel location is about a 15 min walk from the french quarter but we walked back and forth at all hours and never had any issues or felt unsafe (quite the opposite in fact! I feel like New Orleans has an unjustified bad rep - we met some of the nicest people we have ever met in our lives in New Orleans!). The staff were all very friendly, and once again Jamie at the front desk was wonderful and even gave us some tips on places to go and advice about taking public transit. The only thing we were slightly disappointed with was that the pool was closed for maintenance during our stay. New Orleans was experiencing a crazy heat wave while we were there so it would have been nice to sit in the pool once or twice, but hey, that just gave us more time for exploring the amazing city! We thank the Drury for making our first (but not the last!) trip to New Orleans a great stay and we will recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Drury is Delightful”
Reviews.Author: BermudaQueen
Reviews.Content: The Drury Inn and Suites is a delightful place to stay when visiting New Orleans. The price was affordable. The front desk staff, Jamie and Lance are wonderful. They both were very helpful. This is something I always look for when traveling. Construction was taking place during our stay, but we never heard any type of disturbance from our 5th floor room. We had a cozy room with a fridge and microwave. The bed was very comfortable. We enjoyed the nice warm shower and tub, large tv and big comfy chair. Our room overlooked Poydras Street and St. Charles Avenue. The Street car comes right by the Drury on a daily basis. The fee is very reasonable $1.25pp or a flat fee to ride all day. The Drury's location is in the Central Business District. We loved the quietness and safety in this area. Most everything was in walking distance. There is a local convenience store 1/2 block from the Hotel called Mom's Mini Mart. A Walgreen's and CVS store are 3 blocks away. We walked 5 blocks to the Superdome to see a Monday Night Football Game (Saints vs Falcons) and the Arena to see The Hornets vs Mavericks. The French Quarter is a 4 block walk or you could catch the Streetcar. The Harrah's Casino is also a 4-5 block walk. They have the best lunch/dinner buffet in the area. While in New Orleans be sure to take advantage of the various attractions: Mardi Gras World, Imax Theater, Aquarium and the Hurricane Katrina Tour, as well as sailing the Missippi River on the Steamboat Nanchez. The Drury Inn serves a nice complimentary breakfast and refreshments in the evenings. When we return to New Orleans in the future, The Drury will be our first choice. Delightful Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: SCCoastin
Reviews.Content: We spent four days at the Drury and even with some of the hotel being renovated, it was fine. All the staff was friendly and helpful, the room was very nice and well-appointed, the breakfast buffet was good, and the evening cocktails were a nice end to long days discovering the city (again).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel at a decent rate”
Reviews.Author: bethiemae
Reviews.Content: Good location, 4 blocks from the French Quarter. The street car track is next to the hotel and you can ride to Canal St., to the Aquarium and Riverwalk, along the river side of the French Quarter, to the Garden District, Up Town and out to the zoo. We purchaced a one day pass for $5 and rode all over the place. The hotel is very nice. It is a 90 year old building that Drury spent 2 years refirbishing into a hotel. They are doing some redecorating, but it didn't bother us and our room had just been redecorated. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfasts and the happy hours. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice outside the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Cruise,J.D.
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night as a pre-cruise stay and booked the cruise package in which you pay $35 to park your vehicle at the hotel during the cruise. I had read wonderful reviews of the Drury Inn and I concur with them. It is a nice hotel with great amenities. The hotel is beautiful. There were some renovations taking place, but they did not bother us. The staff was friendly. We were given a corner room with lots of windows. The room was clean. My only complaint about the room was the lack of ventilation in the bathroom. Some of the great amenities included drink vouchers, one hour of long distance calls, and the breakfast. However, the "exercise room" is minimal - one treadmill and one bike. The exercise room is also very small. The hotel is within walking distance to the French Quarter. We felt safe walking down Poydras St. to St. Charles St. and then walking down St. Charles St. to Canal St. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for those looking to stay outside the French Quarter but close to it.

Reviews.Title: “what a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: drummerSwanseaU_k_
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for six nights this June(09) and had a very nice stay in a suite (free upgrade) the rooms were always clean and also had two televisions one in a room with desk reclining chair and sofa frig. and microwave and another in the bedroom the air con was very good and very quiet the staff were always helpfull and the pool on the roof was o.k. It was an easy walk to the French Quarter and we always felt safe. On New Orleans six days was probably to long but that is for a different review the hotel is very good

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: StephanieLuvs2Travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Drury Inn and Suites in Oct. 2009 for 3 nights while in New Orleans on a business trip. The hotel was conveniently located to where my conference was (LSU Health Science Center), and also just a short walk from the French Quarter. The room was very clean, 2 queen beds, with a mini fridge. The service was great and the staff was very helpful. Also, the breakfast was included in the price of the stay, and was delicious! Eggs, waffles, sausage... they had a full "hot breakfast" and it was good quality. They also had a happy hour every evening with complimentary beer, wine, and liquor drinks, as well as snacks. This was a really nice plus! The 2 downfalls were that 1) the exercise room was very small, and the ventilation in there wasn't great; and 2) the pool was closed while I was there. The pool is located on the roof, and I would have enjoyed at least seeing the view of the city... but, unfortunately, that wasn't even possible as the entire pooldeck was locked. Otherwise, it was a great stay, with very comfortable accomodations, conveniently located in NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - love the free breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: RAchopra
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for families with the pool on the roof, free full breakfast, and evening snacks. Very nice central location - easy walk to French Quarter, trolley, and river walk. Was nice a quiet - great service.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable,friendly, accomodating very good service”
Reviews.Author: Michael O
Reviews.Content: this hotel took great lenghts to insure an enjoyable experience, they even upgraded our room to provide a fantastic view looking in one direction at Harrah's and in the other Bourbon Street.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: jmb84
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. Hotel was very convenient to the sights of New Orleans, about a 5 block walk to Canal Street and the edge of the French Quarter and 1 block to the St Charles streetcar to the Garden District. Being closer to the French Quarter might have been nicer, but for the price of this hotel compared to others in or closer to the Quarter it was worth the extra 5 minute walk. Even late at night, felt safe walking to and from the hotel. Stayed in a deluxe king room (suite 200), room was very nice and clean...and surprisingly quiet for being only one level above busy Poydras Street. Did not take advantage of the free breakfast as there are so many good places to eat in New Orleans, but it was busy every morning and looked like a good selection. Free happy hour from 5:30 to 7:00 pm each nice was a pleasant extra. The staff was very friendly and more than willing too accomodate an early check-in, stowe luggage after checkout and calling a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: caz1949
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights room very clean and spacious with a microwave and fridge. Hotel close to everything and the streetcar. Nice rooftop pool and free breakfast. Staff very helpful and friendly

Reviews.Title: “GREAT, GREAT !!!!”
Reviews.Author: bet2Ky_
Reviews.Content: First time to visit New Orleans, had no idea where to stay. Looked on the internet and found the Drury. It was wonderful. The rooms were clean and well decorated. The staff was friendly and very helpful with directions and information. The hotel was with in walking distance of the French Quarters. They had a very good free breakfast as well as soda and popcorn in the afternoon. Will stay there again next time we are in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay here-will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Bella1949
Reviews.Content: Chose this location due to the price and the reviews. We were in town with babies, parents and grandparents and needed a location that worked well for all. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay! The happy hour was great for all of us to meet and get snacks and drinks before going out to dinner. The breakfast was wonderful! The rooms were very spacious and comfortable. The location was excellent, there is a streetcar stop right next to the hotel and we decided to get a $5 pass for one day, which allowed us to go all the way to the garden district and back to canal street and the riverwalk. Kept the grandparents from having to walk too far. It was far enough away from the French Quarter to be family friendly but close enough that we could walk to it with no problem. There is an excellent sushi bar a couple of doors down and a mini mart too. Overall, we were very impressed and will probably stay here again instead of trying to get something in the French Quarter. For the price you can't beat it! Here are the only complaints: -Our room had problems with the plumbing and for the most part we only got hot water, no cold. I let the staff know about it and they were going to take a look at it. -My sister-in-law thought her room smelled funny, maybe mildew or pee? but I didn't smell anything. They do allow pets so that may have been why. -There was a car parked on the street DIRECTLY across from our second floor room and the car alarm went off ALL NIGHT and ALL DAY! Not the hotels fault of course but if you stay there and you get a room that looks out on the street and you see a gold or tan lincoln towncar, request another room! Great hotel though and I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: bdg90210
Reviews.Content: My husband and I attended a wedding reception across the street at Le Pavillon Hotel but did not want to get a room there from the mixed reviews on this site. Well, we were happy w/ staying at the Drury. Clean throughout, fast elevators, breakfast included in $85 room rate. Parking is $15 a night, but there was a spot right next to the lobby door and the front desk clerk said it was fine that we stayed there, so we didn't have to pay to park Express checkout means no stopping at front desk again. Did not go out to the pool. My husband walked to the vending machine on the 6th floor to get a $1.50 bottle of water, the machine gave him a hawaiin fruit punch instead.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Momo3boys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on TA reviews. Everything was right on. They had nice rooms, a rooftop pool with great views, free drinks and snacks in the PM, and breakfast buffet. We were able to walk to the French Quarter with no problems. The streetcar goes up and down St. Charles Street right by the hotel for $1.25 a person. There's a $15 a night charge for parking, but if you book the cruise rate, it's free while you're gone. It costs $7 a person to take a taxi from the hotel to the cruise terminal. It was a very clean hotel with a nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Value and Service; Spacious, Quiet Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Texas_traveler
Reviews.Content: The lobby is beautiful with marble floors and a historic look. The first thing you notice when you walk into the hotel room is the ceiling--it's at least 15 feet high! The bath is nice with marble floors. I asked for a quiet room and got a corner room partially overlooking the parking lot, which had no street noise. It's every bit as nice as a 4 star hotel--with free breakfast, free happy hour and free wireless internet in the rooms! I booked through the hotel and got a AAA rate of $89! It's 5 blocks from the French Quarter and the streetcar stops right next to the hotel. (You can buy a day pass on board for $5.) The front desk staff--Ayonna especially--were very helpful. The only thing to be aware of is if you arrive tired and hungry on a Sunday night and don't feel like going to the French Quarter, there are no restaurants that walking distance that are open on Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, wonderful taff and very comfortable beds!"”
Reviews.Author: HappyArkansas
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in New Orleans. The hotel was clean and very comfortable. The location is close to food spots , shopping cultural sites. The street car is also right out the side door. It is only 5 blocks fro Bourbon Street- There was a wonderful girl at the front desk-Ayonna. She was so helpful in giving directions to the Musicians Village and how to drive to Algiers. It was nice having the free breakfast and aftyernoon drinks and snacks as well. We sat up on top of the hotel by the pool in the evenings and enjoyed the view.If you have never been to New Orleans you must eat at Acme Oyster House and Gumbo Shop - both were wonderful. In the garden Disstrict the Voodoo BarbQ is also great. Wear comfortable shoes - lots of walking in and out shops ! Great vacation- Thanks Drury !

Reviews.Title: “Great for family with kids and toddlers”
Reviews.Author: MrsEscu
Reviews.Content: I searched countless hours for a hotel to stay at that would be well suited for my family members and kids. Drury Inn was far away from all the choas and noise, but not so bad for walking distance to the French Quarter and very close to the Streetcars. Hotel was clean and spacious. The pool was great for cooling off the kids. Warm breakfast in the AM was awesome and you cannot beat the free drinks and snacks! The fridge and microwave come in handy for leftovers or in our case, we had milk bottles that needed to be kept cold and then warmed for the toddlers. Highly recommended for your NOLA stay. I would book again.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm Hotel with Big Rooms Good Location”
Reviews.Author: cara250
Reviews.Content: I liked our stay at this hotel. The rooms was large and comfortable. The location was great for walking around. We were able to securely park our car. The buffet breakfast was wonderful. The staff was very nice and helpful. Our floor was quiet. I would go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “First visit GREAT/second visit just so-so”
Reviews.Author: 1happydisneygirl
Reviews.Content: When I made our first reservation at the Drury Inn in Nov. '08, it was #1 on Tripadvisor. We stayed there one (1) night and liked it so much, we stayed a 2nd night on our return trip home. I am going to combine 2 visits into 1 review. RESERVATIONS: Made my first reservation by phone and the young lady who helped us was very sweet, advising me to check the internet 1 month prior to our visit to see if there were any specials being offered. Being that I did not solicit a discount, I was quite surprised that she made this suggestion. I did check back prior to our departure and found the room to be $10 less. We didn't know if we would be spending the night in New Orleans on our return trip. However, we loved the Drury Inn so much, we decided to stay there before catching our flight home. I made the 2nd reservation over the internet. Drury Inn has an esaver rate that is non-refundable, but runs $10 less than a refundable reservation. CHECK-IN: The first time we checked in, we were greeted by a very nice young man who was extremely friendly and helpful. He couldn't do enough for us. He explained how breakfast worked, snack time, etc. While some could find his helpfulness a bit overwhelming, we found him quite charming. Check-in was a breeze. The 2nd time we checked in, the young lady who helped us was curtious, but not much more. We had the impression that she didn't really want to be at work. (But, she was never rude.) The process wasn't nearly as pleasant an experience as the first check-in. However, unlike our first visit, we had a rental car with us and without us asking, the clerk waived the parking fee. (I believe it's $10 a day.) ROOMS: Our first room was FABULOUS. Spacious, clean, comfortable, quiet. Very comfortable beds. The bathroom was fairly large. There was the standard amenities, soaps, shampoos, t.v., refrigerator, blow dryer, etc. Unfortunately, the free internet wasn't working and we gave up on it. (Had some business we needed to take care of, but used our smart phone instead.) Our 2nd visit was very different. Our room was located on floor 8, which is the highest floor where rooms are located. The room was smaller and the beds were not nearly as comfortable. The mattresses seemed older. The beds were double beds, though I and my family were sure we had 2 queen beds previously. Also, there was a banging noise that started at midnight and continued until 7:00 a.m. in the morning. We did not get a restful night's sleep. We are fairly certain the noise was caused by the pipes in the wall. Also, the refrigerator made a leaking noise all night long. Since we arrived quite late in the evening, by the time we realized the problems, we were just too tired to asked to be moved. FOOD: Drury offers snacks in the evening that are quite good. Nachos, pop corn, soda and even alcoholic beverages. All of it being included in the price of the room. Though we don't drink alcohol, we saw that each person received a card that the attendant marked when the guest ordered alcohol. I believe each guest was entitled to 2 alcoholic beverages. All else was unlimited. Breakfast is also included with the room. I am rarely impressed with the "free" breakfast items hotels provide, but honestly, why should a hotel offer anything at all? Drury's breakfast was a cut above the chain hotels like Holiday Inn Express, etc. There were make-your-own waffles, eggs, bisquits, gravy, sausage on one visit, bacon on the other. Cereal, yogurt, apples, bananas, oj, coffee, tea, hot chocolate and a few other items. Very satisfactory. OVERALL: We did not use the pool or gym. We did use the washer and dryer. For the size of the hotel, I was surprised that there was only 1 washer and 1 dryer. And they are located adjacent to rooms, which could be quite noisy. Our 2 visits were quite different from one another. We will be passing through New Orleans again and I'm not certain if we will stay at the Drury. It's in a "nicer" part of New Orleans (is there such thing as a "nice" part of N.O.?) but I think (not sure) we might try to find a more consistent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: freddy0527
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel and staff, amenities were great, all the little "extras" were fantastic, hot breakfast was restaurant quality. Very clean, great accomodations. Highly Recommend, the roof-top pool was great too!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great value, excellent service, clean room, lots of extras!”
Reviews.Author: techwreck09
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that I don't require white glove service - ever. Nor do I stay in hotels that aren't up to par in terms of friendly staff and clean rooms. That being said, I found the Drury to be an EXCELLENT value for the money. The room was spacious and very clean, as was the bathroom, staff were very friendly and helpful - and I made multiple requests, all of which were addressed expediently and efficiently. The hotel was within walking distance of both the Convention Center AND the French Quarter, though it was easy enough to hop on the Carondelet street car to Canal Street or the St. Charles street car to head toward the garden district for only $1.25 each way! All the extras you get at the Drury aren't listed, so I'll list the ones I can remember here: free wi-fi, free local calls, an hour of free long distance per day, free cocktails & snacks from 5 until 7 each night (not top shelf liquors, but if you stick to beer it's a fine offering), and free hot breakfast every morning (eggs, biscuits, sausage, french toast, fruit, cereals, pastries, bagels, etc. - not too shabby). I would definitely stay here again - the other added bonus is that it's far enough away from the French Quarter that you can actually sleep at night but not so far that it's a pain to get there when you want to have some fun! And although I didn't have my pets with me, it sat very well with me that they do accept small pets...

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jazzrchoc
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed at a Drury Inn before but read the reviews. I was pleasantly suprised. The room was basic but good. more than enough room for me and my sister. Parking could get tricky but was fine for me as I have a hanicapped sticker. Beautiful lobby. The location was what I wanted. I did not want to be in a very noisy area. this hotel is right on one of the street car lines and we did hear it a little bit but not annoyingly so. Very convenient to everything. LOved the rooftop pool and hot tub also!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tattered and Worn Dark Claustrophobic Suite - Not What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: debijo61
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of tripadvisor.com and had few doubts about what i'd get a Drury when I made the reservations. after all....most reviews here have been excellent. i'm not sure if i just got a bad room or what, but i was appauled when i entered the room. the first thing i saw was the totally threadbare and worn couch, chair, chipped up wooden desk. the carpet was old and dark, everything about the room looked ancient. i am not exaggerating when i say the furniture looked like it should have been left at the curb...that is how worn it was. yes, the lobby and hotel were clean, but the room is where i spent my time and i was not comfortable there since it did not feel clean, was so dark, and was so worn out. everything looked this way in my room, and the living area was so very narrow i felt completely closed in. i am wondering if the suites are different than the regular rooms, or if some rooms have updated furniture but i got one that was never updated. i travel to n.o. for work now every month and have been for four months. this is the fourth hotel i've stayed at and i will not stay again. i ended up moving after the first night back to the renaissance....even though there was no free breakfast or happy hour and parking was more, the room was bright, new and didn't make me feel closed in and claustrophobic.

Reviews.Title: “good visit”
Reviews.Author: WinterGardener
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our visit to this Drury Inn. Our room was quite small- more like a room in a European city, but clean and nice. It was not like the photographs on the web site. Think old hotel that has been renovated and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, don't expect too much.”
Reviews.Author: Zaphod
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, wonderful hospitality, staff funny and very helpful. Rooms nice and clean. Beds comfortable. We were in a suite, the living room was comfy, ample workspace for two people. We were there the week before Mardi Gras on a business trip. Check in evening, our toilet overflows, we use all the towels in the bathroom to mop after we disable the float. Call to front desk. Immediate response. Front desk guy has a plunger and a plastic bag, comes in an plunges the toilet. Clears the paper. Says he's not supposed to plunge toilets. Leaves us with wet towels (and used toilet water) behind the toilet. Fortunately, the room is not level, so all the water stays mostly behind the toilet. Housekeeping gone, so fortunately, we still had two clean towels for a.m. and the detritus is not near our feet. Next day, some towels replaced, and housekeeper leaves cleaning products in bathroom and skimpy on towels. Second day, housekeeper leaves cleaning products in bathroom. Third day I notice that a little piece of plastic wrapping that I had binding some brochures in my suitcase was still laying on the floor in the bedroom. Shower has not great water pressure but is nice and roomy too. Hair dryer was awful. One day we were still in the room when housekeeping came, and when we came back in the early evening our room was not done. A call to front desk and our room was cleaned (with the leftover spray bottle in the bathroom) by time we got back from dinner. So, it's clean but some staff are a little forgetful. I was not bothered by the issues, it's a quirky little hotel. With a quirky staff...very laid back and quite fun! What did bother me, though, was one day I went down for breakfast. A youth bus group had been there the night before and they devestated the free breakfast bar. By 7:30 a.m. (the breakfast is open until 9 or so), most of the hot food was gone, and the server said they were done for the day. Huh? Otherwise, the breakfast bar was nice, all the usual stuff. The evening reception was really nice. The hotel is close to convention center, French Quarter, and all the fun places. Overall, I'd stay there again, I'm hoping that the housekeeping issues were quirks and next time I'm bringing my own hair dryer. It did have free internet in the rooms, a huge plus.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: SemperBonum
Reviews.Content: This was the first trip back to New Orleans since Hurricane Katrina. What a pleasant experience! New Orleans still has a lot of charm and uniqueness. The city is rebuilding but it is doing quite well. Would recommend to anyone. Drury Inn continues to amaze me on its overall value. I was attracted to Drury because of price and amenities. Being off the Quarter saved a lot of money on hotel rates and parking fees. The Quarter is within walking distance and on the St. Charles trolley line. Walking may be a bit uncomfortable with unfamiliar surroundings late in the evening unless you are with a group. The trolley runs about every 30 minutes on the side of the hotel. During the day you can walk everywhere or purchase a day pass on the trolley lines and ride as much as you want. Great values at the hotel include the evening reception (free drinks and snacks!) and the hot breakfast. Rooms are good. Common areas are well decorated. Overall a very nice experience . . . plus I saved a lot of money for other tourist activities!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay -- Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Pantherettie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel one day prior to cruise. Our family of three was very comfortable in the hotel and enjoyed a swim at the hotel's rooftop pool. The hotel's staff was very helpful and friendly with directions to and from the French Quarter and obtaining a cab for us the morning of our cruise (which actually left from Mobile -- long story). The price was definately reasonable at $79. I would absolutely stay there again over pricier places in the Quarter

Reviews.Title: “I great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: sav_na03
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Drury Inn was a very pleasant one. On our way to the hotel we called them and they were able to talk us directly to the hotel from blocks away. The rooms were clean, the view was AWESOME and the staff were very curtious. Although we didn't get to go in the roof top pool because of the rain it was a great perk that other hotels I researched did not offer. We also loved the breakfast! They had just about anything you would want. It was definatly not your typical breakfast and its served until 10! Check out was a breese, and although parking was limited, we could not find any nicks, scratches, or anything else. Within walking distance to just about anything. Just 4 blocks from the Superdome and close to the French Quarters.
