Reviews.Title: “Always a great value at Drury Inns”
Reviews.Author: CeeJayRocker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to boarding our cruise ship. Our rate included free parking for the duration of the cruise, which would have cost us the price of the room once over at the cruise terminal, so you can't beat the price. Check in was fast and smooth and our room was ready. Dury almost always slides the paid receipt under your door before morning, so check out is nothing more than leaving your room and walking out the front door. The evening happy hour was disappointing, but only because I'm a beer drinker, and they were out of beer. That's never happened to me at a Drury, and I'm pretty surprised that in New Orleans, you couldn't buy another keg pretty quickly. The snacks were good, and the lobby area was room and comfortable. The front desk clerk was very helpful with restaurant suggestions, directions, and hailing a cab. I felt pretty safe here. The doors locked at 10, and didn't open up until some time later. I was sitting in the hotel lobby typing this review at 5:30 am, and more than one guest came staggering in after a night on Bourbon Street. Most had trouble with their keys (imagine that . . . ) and the front desk clerk was very rigid in checking ID's and guest registrations before she let them in. You had to use your room key to go anywhere on the elevator. No key, no elevator movement. The breakfast was hot, tasty, and way above your basic continental, but that's what you always get with Drury. No surprises here. All in all, a great room at a great price, with amenities that cost much extra at most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Viajero Del Mundo
Reviews.Content: Drury is very good value for the money. We stayed on an overnight pre cruise. Rooms were large and comfy. We had a Spa tub in the bathroom but it wasn't clean as little bits of what looked liked old lavender petals came out of the jets. Need to have a shower. The breakfast was quite good. It is close enough to Riverwalk and French Quarter. Neighborhood was a bit dicey north of hotel. We were a little uncomfotable walking back late at night (1PM) as the streets were a little empty of people.

Reviews.Title: “loved the extras”
Reviews.Author: mmeoww
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel one night post-cruise, due it's location right on the streetcar line and the positive reviews here. The availability of a 1 bedroom suite sealed the deal. For the most part we were not disappointed - nice large room, beautiful hotel, great location. However, the 1 bedroom suite furniture left a bit to be desired - the recliner and pull out sofa in the living area had seen better days, and our companion found the pull out completely impossible to sleep on. She tried folding it up and sleeping on the couch - no dice, too short. She never was able to get comfortable and get any sleep. The hotel did credit us to the price of a regular room, to their credit. It might have been okay for children but I think adults will struggle with the pull out beds. On the plus side, this hotel had everything advertised - a FULL hot breakfast in the morning, evening cocktails and munchies, a free hour of long distance phone calling to catch up after our cruise. We also enjoyed relaxing in the pool/hot tub on the roof of the hotel - nice area and very soothing. There was a very small fitness area up there as well (inside) - I believe it had a treadmill, an elliptical, and something else...stairclimber, perhaps? There was no room for anything else! The staff was also very kind and helpful with our arrangements (getting in long before check in and helping us get a taxi the next morning). The location was great - we were able to walk to the French Quarter and Harrah's, as well as hop on the street car that runs directly in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: SCSweendaddy
Reviews.Content: Interesting hotel. Good location - walking distance to Fr. Quarter and easy drive to Convention Center. Nice rooms and lobby area. Breakfast and manager's reception was nice except when they host pre-cruise departures (both Thursday and Friday nights when we stayed) both were VERY crowded. Only complaint was that our shower didn't drain and it was not fixed during our four day stay despite mentioning it twice to the desk staff. All in all a good value for the money in that area. You get very good at a good price here.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: TSEJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful. The room was outstanding and the bathroom was very clean. The bed was huge and had lots of pillows except they were very firm. The staff went above and beyond to help us find things to see while we were there. Evening drinks were a bonus and free breakfast was why we booked. The price was the best. I wish more hotels were this clean and helpful. Love it and cant wait to stay there again if we pass thru New Orleans again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, affordable for neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: 81hoosier
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at the Drury. The hotel is superbly maintained and comfortable. While hotel rates are not cheap in the neighborhood, (Central Business District, four blocks from the French Quarter) this place was about as cheap as it gets. Carondolet, which runs alongside the hotel, turns into Bourbon Street four blocks down the street, so it's virtually impossible to not find the French Quarter. The St. Charles streetcar runs down Carondolet on it's way to the Quarter (too close to bother with the streetcar) and down St. Charles, one block away, on it's way west to the Garden District. One word of advice - even in the middle of winter, keep in mind that the pool (and of course, the spa tub) on the roof are well heated and are inviting in the midday sun. Take bathing suits if you want to risk spending too much time lounging on the roof of the hotel instead of exploring the intoxicating city.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Location in the City”
Reviews.Author: ohiorose58
Reviews.Content: This is an exceptional bargain for New Orleans. The location is perfect for tourist or business travelers. The breakfast and evening reception are a perfect addition to the comfort and convenience of this hotel. I found the area to be quiet and very safe, though we were there just before the SugarBowl event..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - great place”
Reviews.Author: CenTexan
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in late December. Our first stay at a Drury. The location was a bit business-oriented. Only a couple places to eat within a block or two, so we ending up driving everywhere. You can catch the streetcar just outside the hotel on Carondolet, if you are that patient. The hotel was wonderful. Great room, clean, nice furnishings, comfortable bed (a bit soft for me). Marble tiles in bathroom, etc. And we asked for a quiet room and got it. Felt like we were alone in the hotel (except for the occasional low rumble of the street car). Breakfast was good and substantial. Friendly staff. Definitely would stay here again in the Big Easy! Thanks for a great stay, Drury Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to get away”
Reviews.Author: SoutheastMOtraveler
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to get to stay at this Drury Suites while it was beautifully decorated for Christmas! VERY clean. Friendly staff. Great location. My only complaint would be that the bathroom in the guest rooms was very small.

Reviews.Title: “Loving the Drury”
Reviews.Author: ZenaTexas
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend stay at the Drury in New Orleans, LA and what a wonderful surprise. This was my first time to stay at a Drury and is was awesome - the staff was great, the hotel was beautiful, and the extras......afternoon snacks, evening socials, added security access in the elevators was a bonus and we got a great rate through their web-site !

Reviews.Title: “Loved IT!! Will stay here on next visit!!”
Reviews.Author: pbark
Reviews.Content: Drury Inn New Orleans was excellent!! My room was a nice size and always clean. The free snacks (popcorn, nachos, vegetables, peanuts, chips and salsa) & free drinks were a nice touch in the evenings. The lobby is beautiful and the location is prime. Maybe 3 blocks from Bourbon and 2 blocks from the Superdome. There is also a trolley stop on the corner near the hotel if you don't want to walk. Because they are not right on Bourbon and Canal streets there is free parking. (Some hotels in that area charge $30 a night for parking.) Wireless Internet access was free and so were long distance phone calls. This is definitely my hotel of choice when returning to New Orleans!!

Reviews.Title: “Heartily Recommended”
Reviews.Author: dkotec
Reviews.Content: Choose this hotel for a conference in New Orleans because of the reviews on tripadvisor. In actual fact turned out to be much better! I had a large room facing away from the river although with a large tub. Fantastic space in room, with free local & national calls and free wi-fi. All staff were excellent & welcoming - a problem with my phone was dealt with in an hour and the engineer left a card in case of further problems - great attention to detail. The hotel has a free breakfast (cereals, pastries and some hot items), a roof-top exercise room, small pool and jacuzzi (good enough for a bit of relaxing at the end of the day) and gives you snacks and free drinks in the early evening. All up a very good place to stay and heartily recommended. Congratulations and thanks to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “We Love Drury Inn at New Orleans....”
Reviews.Author: TraceyMcM
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel situated in a great location. Only 10 minute walk to Bourbon Street or tram right outside the door. Staff were all very courteous and helpful. Room was absolutely beautiful. King Size Bed in a huge room, big bathroom. Rooms were immaculate and very, very comfortable. Drury Inn serve free drinks and nibblies late afternoon. We enjoyed this at the end of our day. Our highlight of New Orleans was doing the Katrina Bus Tour. It was 3 hours very well spent and would recommend this to anyone visiting as staying in Downtown you wouldn't realise that anything had happened.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommend this hotel! A*!!!”
Reviews.Author: guisey3
Reviews.Content: What an absolutely fantastic hotel! The only thing we can think of to even contemplate complaining about was the eagerness of the staff to clean the room!! (we were on vacation and sometimes due to tropical rain we were still in the room or had just returned to base to freshen up when she tried to come in!!) Right thats out of the way, so I can get on with the good stuff! - it is right on the st charles street car route - buses are easily accessible on poydras - 5 min walk away from Canal St, which is ideal! - excellent security - friendly staff - free drinks, popcorn and nachos every night - free internet access - free breakfast (i miss the waffles now i'm back home :-( !!! ) if going to NOLA thoroughly recommend this hotel. we were there for 14 nights and it was fab!!

Reviews.Title: “The tops in customer service and amenities!”
Reviews.Author: PickyTravelerOhio
Reviews.Content: I returned just 2 days ago from a visit to New Orleans and stay at the Drury Inn & Suites. This is one of the few hotels that I can not find a single negative thing to say. The location is convenient to the French Quarter but just far enough away to be peaceful and offer on-site parking for a modest fee. I was immediately impressed with the beauty of the lobby and friendliness of the front desk employees. This friendliness was indicative of every employee we encountered. How wonderful to be greeted by smiling faces each morning at breakfast. Also, the security measures are terrific. If entering through a door other than the main entrance a guest room card must be used. Also, a card is required to utilize the elevators that access the guest rooms. The same is true of the parking area. The guest room was of ample size and was spotless with a fresh non-perfume type fragrance. The king-size bed was amazingly comfortable along with the abundance of soft pillows! Each room has a microwave and refrigerator, which we didn't utilize because of the wonderful reception each evening in the lobby that offers 3 alcoholic beverages per guest and an assortment of munchies. Also, free coffee, soft drinks and popcorn are available throughout the day and evening. As if this isn't enough, the free hot breakfast buffet each morning offers a wide variety of foods including yogurt, fresh fruit, rolls, cereal, scrambled eggs, biscuits and gravy, sausage, toast, bagels, and orange and apple juice. After checking out and returning to Ohio, I discovered I was missing my new prescription eyeglasses. This dampened the trip somewhat, until I logged online tonight to find a customer survey from Drury Inns. I completed it and mentioned, in the comment section, if someone found my glasses and returned them I would consider my visit over the top. In less than an hour I received an email from the manager saying the glasses were located and would be shipped to me the following day. Wow! I was stunned and delighted. This is the tops in Customer Service and you can bet I will seek out Drury Inns anywhere else I may travel. I definitely have been spoiled! Great job New Orleans Drury Inn manager and staff!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: llamacalmer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights recently with husband and 14 year old daughter. Chose hotel based on reviews written here. We were not disappointed. Hotel is well located, being about 10 min walk from the French Quarter and all its restaurants, bars etc. The room was a nice size with two double beds, and a separate lounge area. Internet access was free, as was breakfast each morning. Choice was reasonable but the disposable plates and cutlery spoilt it a bit. In the evenings, 5.30-7pm, at the managers reception you could have up to 3 drinks each which was also a nice touch. On the roof there is a small swimming pool which was never crowded, and there is also one washing machine and dryer for guests to use. All in all, good value for money, if all you want is a base while in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ally199
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and helpful, comfortable beds and extra pillows, rooms were very clean. Free breakfast buffet included the usual fare, as well as scrambled eggs, sausage, biscuits, and gravy. Hotel is in the business district, but within walking distance of the French Quarter. A trolley stop is across the street. Great value for the price. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: GoolsbeyRN
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for us. They gave us two adjoining rooms. We walked to dinner and I have to say that the walk was very nice. Didn't see any panhandlers and it's far enough away from the French Quarter that you don't have to worry about someone swinging a door open and your kids getting a shot at some topless skank performing on stage. This area of New Orleans was not flooded. The hotel was clean, breakfast was free, and not bad though not fabulous. I would stay here again. It was very reasonable at 72.00 a room per night.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LambChops26
Reviews.Content: There was a group of 6 that stayed at this hotel. My room had a great view of the river but the other rooms had a view of the AT&T building right beside the hotel, so if a view is important I would suggest requesting it when you book. Coctails in NO are about $9 each at the restaurants so the 3 free coctails you get here everynight are a big plus. The parking is great and very secure. The only reason I would not give this hotel 5 stars is that the staff although friendly enough is not helpful at all. One thing I would highly recommend is to do some prior planning and get some good maps of the city and figure out the trolley system because it is a little confusing. I don't think I would stay here again only because there were some other hotels closer to the french quarter and although 4 blocks away doesn't sound like much by the 3rd day it is a lot because you have to walk 4 or 5 more blocks in the quarter to get anywhere. Overall, this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: drgauravgoel1
Reviews.Content: Its an excellent place to stay. I found the hotel extremely clean. the hotels elevator require keys to access making them safe althought he surrounding area is safe, staff is extremely friendly. rooms are nicely decorated. only flip side is pool. if you are looking for a good swimming pool then you may not like it. Breakfast is ok. comlimentary drink in evening comes as bonus. overall a perfect place to stay and complete value for money.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cootsChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location. Very clean, comfortable beds, very elegant . . . Ceilings were 12 ft tall with beautiful draperies. Breakfast buffet very good and welcome reception at 5:30 pm with free coctails and appetizers was nice. My 2 teenage kids loved swimming on the roof top pool at night. Overlooked the city.This hotel is very convenient as it is in walking distance to the French Qtr, Bourbon St, Riverwalk, Superdome, etc. $15.00 parking fee at the hotel is reasonable. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Look at TRAVELOCITY for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: razorbackshelley
Reviews.Content: From the beginning, the hotel staff and facilities were top notch. The hotel is beautiful and only 4 blocks from Canal and Bourbon in a good part of town. The St Charles street car stops right next to the hotel for those of you that do not want to walkâ€¦ or canâ€™t walk without stumbling. The street cars were still running at 2:00am when we were making our way back to the hotel. Five Stars in my book!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tooroberts
Reviews.Content: The location is very close to the French Quarter and easily accessible from I-10. The check-in process was very quick and simple and exceeded only by the even quicker check-out. The room was very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable (with real feather pillows !!!!!!). The evening drinks and snacks were a very nice addition since we checked in right as they were being served. The breakfast served the next morning was very good quality. We will most definitely stay again and look forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans Drury Inn”
Reviews.Author: carolinacountry
Reviews.Content: The Drury Inn in New Orleans is a nice place to stay for the price. They are within walking distance of the Mississippi River and the French Quarter. Their complimentary breakfast is extremely good and they also offer free drinks and snacks (nachos, fruit, popcorn, chips and dip) in the evening. The front desk staff was very friendly. The rooftop pool was small, but offered quite a view of the city. The hotel is very secure and you have to use your key card to access the elevators. The rooms were very clean, but were small as were the beds. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “6 kids!”
Reviews.Author: getmeouttaFLA
Reviews.Content: Not too bad for price. Liked the free drinks, popcorn, and breakfast. It fit our needs and was pretty convenient to a lot of points of interest. The front desk was very nice, let us check in early and was able to recommend a couple of restaurants for big families. Needed room key to access elevator, so we felt more secure. Rooms and bed were comfortable, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PERKS”
Reviews.Author: MacTravelers
Reviews.Content: We got a good rate - $69/night - on this room that was very small, but very clean. The mattress was the best part. I usually wake up several times every night, but during our three-night stay at the Drury, I slept like a baby. And it wasn't the Bourbon Street margaritas. It was this perfect mattress! In fact, I'm currently trying to buy one directly from the manufacturer! Okay, enough about the mattress. The hotel does indeed offer a happy hour from 5:30 to 7:00 pm. Guests can have three free cocktails each and there was a snack buffet. I didn't have anything to eat -- didn't even look to see what was offered as it was too close to dinnertime, but I noticed a gentleman pouring melted cheese over nacho chips so that was one of the items. The breakfast was a lot of food -- scrambled eggs, sausage, waffles you make yourself, biscuits and gravy. Amazing that all of that stuff - the cocktails, snacks and breakfast, are all FREE. Oh and what else is free is HBO and internet access. My husband really appreciated that because he had to take care of some pressing business concerns. They also have security precautions such as needing a room key to go up in the elevator. The only bad thing about this hotel is that it was the furtherest away from the French Quarter than we've ever stayed - about four blocks west of Canal. For the most part, I felt safe walking back and forth. It's just that during the day, it was SO HOT and SO HUMID that sometimes those four blocks felt like four miles. But overall the hotel was a great bargain and a really nice, clean place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: bes166
Reviews.Content: We booked last minute at the Drury Inn and got a reasonable rate for a location that is just blocks from the French Quarter. The room was clean and comfortable, and despite being by the elevator we hardly heard any noise. The free breakfast and evening drinks were tasty enough for being free. I will definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TNgirl122
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine and I went to the 2nd weekend of Jazzfest May 3 thru May 6. I booked a room at the Drury as I have stayed in Drury Inn's in the past and have always had great experiences. This one was no exception. We arrived well before the 3pm check in time and was greeted by a great staff at the front desk. We got our keys and headed up to the 6th floor to our room. It was clean, the beds were comfy, the bathroom was well kept, we were quite pleased. We were given tips on places to eat, how the trolley cars ran, the prices (1.25, EXACT change!). The quarter is within walking distance, took the trolley to the Garden District and visited a place called Cooter Brown's. They have a vast selection of beer and the folks there are quite friendly. The free breakfast was a nice touch, food was tasty, saved some $$$ eating in each morning. The cocktail hour is always a hit! I would recommend the Drury chain to anyone! ALSO: Don't pass up the Jazz Brunch at the Court of Two Sisters. It is served daily and is NOT to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value”
Reviews.Author: mupawa
Reviews.Content: We have been to NOLA 3 times now, once pre-Katirna and twice post. We have stayed at the BW French Quarter and the W French Quarter besides this hotel, just so you get context. We travel a fair bit . This was by far the best bang-for-buck hotel we have ever stayed in ANYWHERE. we paid less than $100/night for 2 nights. The rooms was first rate, with 12 foot ceilings. The rooftop pool was perfect with great views of the city - the hot-tub was a great place to smoke a stogie and (I was careful) and the pool was well heated - vital for my 6 year old. The location was ideal as well as we were just a couple of blocks from the french quarter and near many excellent restaurants, as well my son and I walked to the D-day museum and the childrens museum from here and it took 10 minutes tops. However the best aspect of the hotel was the hot breakfast in the mornings and the 3 drinks each in the evenings. The breakfast ain't fancy (scrambled eggs etc) but it was just how I liked it, and no waiting or tipping (I did tip a buck a drink but not as much as I would wait staff). we spent our last night in NOLA at the W french quarter, very shishi, but I guess I care more about value than beautiful courtyards (how much time you gonna spend there anyway?)

Reviews.Title: “Great New Orleans Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smac67
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Drury Inn during the first week of Jazz Fest. Rate was considerably less than that of other area hotels and because of the good ratings here, I booked the room. Room was much better than I had even hoped. Ceilings were about 15ft high. 2 comfortable beds, recliner, desk and chair. Very nice bathroom. Every empoyee we came in contact with was very friendly. Free breakfast in the morning consisted of scrambled eggs and sausage (with salsa, ham and cheese to add to the eggs) biscuits and gravy, french toast, waffles and all the other breakfast items you would expect to see. Free popcorn and soft drinks thruout the day. At night, there was a free happy hour that consisted of 3 drinks, chips, cheese and salsa as well as other snacks. Free Wi-FI as well. Very easy walk to the French Quarter, less than 10 minutes. Streetcar also stops right in front of the hotel. We had a great stay and will definately be staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “What a Bargain”
Reviews.Author: 4tunate
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Drury Inn with some trepidation. An Inn sounds low end but I did not want to spend the ~200 that the other bigger name hotels were quoting. The reviews were consistently positive, so I decided to take a chance. When I arrived at the Hotel at 11:00 pm, the door had card secured entrance, which gave the impression of a safety issue. Even after checking in, the elevator required the use of your room key to go up and down. I am not sure why all this is in place, because the hotel is very nice and certainly seems very safe. The lobby is elegant, with high ceilings and good decor. The room, with a king bed and a jacuzzi, was a very pleasant surprise. It was quite large with ~14 foot ceiling and nice, tall windows. The bed and the furniture was of the level that I would have expected in a top grade hotel. The bathroom had marble tiled floor and walls. The only thing that was incongruous is the use of cheap soap, shampoo, and glasses, which were the disposable clear soft plastic variety that one finds in a motel. This is a minor issue. An added bonus is that they had unlimited free long distance calling and free wireless!!! I hate paying 10-20 extra for wireless on top of the 200+ rates at the better hotels. There was also free breakfast, but I did not try it. Overall, a fantastic value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near but not in the action”
Reviews.Author: CSDunford
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Drury Inn for 8 nights in March 08 while in NO for a Habitat build. The hotel was very nice, room was small but clean, the hot breakfast each morning was very much appreciated. Loved the location--near enough to all the "action" to walk to it, but far enough away that we could get a good night's sleep. Stayed in room 701, which was a King non-smoking at the end of a hallway. Weekends seemed fairly noisy, but during the week all was quiet. Staff was very helpful. Only complaint was that the room keycards consistently de-magnetized, even when we didn't have them near anything that should have cause it. Many others at the hotel having the same problem, so I don't think it was us. Was great having the fridge and microwave in the room so we could prepare our sandwiches for the next day. Parking was $15 per day, reasonable when compared to some of the other rates I saw. Walking in this area is much preferred to driving as there's quite a lot of construction going on, and the already narrow streets have lanes closed and all kinds of things to dodge.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vol13w
Reviews.Content: First of all,l let me say that I was very impressed. I have read other posts that say this hotel was nice but it wasn't a Marriott. I have stayed at many Marriotts and they are right, there are a lot more perks for the price here. Free breakfast, free long distance, free popcorn and beverages, etc.This hotel was in a good locaton, The price was very reasonable (90.00) and the person at the front desk was always very polite and helpful. I thought the free breakfast was good and the pool was very nice. The rooms were very clean and decorated well. In my opinon, this is a hidden gem and well worth the money! Oh yeah, very kid friendly!!!! I will be staying here next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Dog friendly! Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: GetMeOut-7
Reviews.Content: My family and 65 lb puppy had an excellent stay at this Inn. We were impressed by the price, the clean rooms, included breakfast (nice selection!), the pool, and that they welcomed our pet! There is excellent parking, and we were only 6 blocks from the the heart of activities! We were very impressed! Will stay again and visit soon.

Reviews.Title: “Cheapest nice hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: harleybonz
Reviews.Content: It's not the best hotel in New Orleans ,but for the price you will not find nothing nicer.For around $100 ,you will not beat it.It's our third time staying here in the last 4 months.It is close to the Superdome,and the Arena.The French Quarter ,and Harrahs,are about a half mile walk or a $8 cab ride.Drury Inn has breakfast included and evening cocktails.They also have a pool and hot tub.If you want to go cheap do not look any further.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: Cheezykat
Reviews.Content: My husband is a HUGE NO Saints fan - this hotel was great for our stay. There were so many free extras: internet, microwave, fridge, breakfast - but the happy hour was the nicest. This hotel is in an excellent location, not far from the French Quarter, the pier, and the Superdome! The staff was more than friendly! We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: tarebearky
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at the Drury Inn. I was in New Orleans for a conference, and because the conference hotel was quite expensive, I booked a room at the Drury Inn just down the road. It was a very pleasant walk down to the river to the conference, Harrah's casino, and the Riverwalk - only about a half mile and really a nice walk. This location was perfect for visiting the French Quarter and Bourbon St - just a few blocks down Carondelet St from the hotel! You can't beat that especially for this price. My flight arrived in the morning, so when I got to the hotel around 11 am (I took the Airport Shuttle, by the way - $30 for roundtrip) I was a bit concerned that I wouldn't be able to get into a room. I had booked a king room which they didn't have ready, but they did have a double room available, so I took that. The room was large with high ceilings and very clean, which is always most important to me. The room included two double beds, a desk with desk chair, a recliner, a tv, table, microwave, and fridge! The bathroom was quite large as well. The best thing - free internet in the rooms! I wish more hotels offered this. There's also a computer in the lobby with a printer, which is really handy for printing boarding passes, etc. All the extras at the Drury Inn are really what makes this hotel. I already mentioned the free internet. The free breakfast was also really good - waffles, eggs, sausage, bagels, muffins, biscuits and gravy, french toast, cereal, and more! And the food was really good. The nightly reception with free drinks (alcoholic -3 per person each night- and non - unlimited) and snacks (chips, salsa, and cheese dip) was also really nice. It's amazing that the Drury offers so many free extras, when the room rates are already so low! There was only one small piece of my stay that was less than perfect. When I got to my room, the toilet was stopped up. I stopped at the front desk on my way out and asked them to have someone fix it (there wasn't a plunger in the room or I'd have done it myself). The woman said she'd take care of it. When I returned a few hours later, it still wasn't fixed. So I called the front desk again. About an hour and a half later, a maintenance guy finally showed up to fix it. The man was very kind and apologetic. But I shouldn't have had to wait 7 hours to use the toilet in my room. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The lobby and room were very nice, but it's the location and all the extras that will bring me back to the Drury Inn. I'll definitely stay here on my next trip to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Minneapolis_MnMigs
Reviews.Content: Jan 14 - 17,2008 Our standard room with two beds was spacious with high ceilings and two windows with a great view looking out over St Charles trolley with city and lighted bridge in background. There was a comfortable lounge chair, good lighting and roomy desk with an adjustable chair - perfect for my laptop and their free wireless internet. Also an hour of free long distance every night. The free hot breakfast, my husband thought one of the best breakfasts ever. Delicious scrambled eggs, sausage, waffles, biscuits and gravy, rolls, even raisin bread toast along with bagels, cereal, fruit, yogurt, coffee, tea, cocoa and fruit drinks. Oh yes, there were free snacks and drinks from 5:30PM to 7 PM as well. Our room was spotlessly clean and- though we were right near the elevator -very quiet. Every staff person we met was courteous and helpful. We loved the location - on the edge of the french quarter. We'd have a big breakfast; plan to skip lunch; and spend the better part of the day wandering through the french quarter, then have an early dinner - no trouble with reservations. Area is well-lighted, trolley also stops right in front, but we felt safe walking. Best dinner was a couple blocks away at Herbsaint, which we also got from TripAdvisor, maybe #4 on popularity index. Wonderful neighborhood bistro with great food and super service. This was our first time back since Katrina and we are eager to return. We'll definitely stay at Drury Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Stunned by this gem”
Reviews.Author: Frequent-flier49
Reviews.Content: Having never stayed at a Drury property, I expected the usual chain hotel scene. I was truly overwhelmed by all the extras at Drury. I booked a standard double room at a low rate ($71) and requested a quiet location, usually ignored by most receptionists. At Drury I was given exactly what I requested, and more. The room was spacious, immaculate, quiet, comfortable (mattress and pillows were amazing). There is a free computer in the lobby to check email, etc. The free hot breakfast was more than ample and the Hispanic dining attendant was the most cheerful, pleasant person - keeping the room moving and refilling orange juice cups whenever she had a spare moment. The evening cocktail hour (and a half) was very pleasant with free drinks, chips, cheese & salsa and fresh popcorn. What floored me most was the obvious exceptional management: as I was waiting to check in for all of thirty seconds, a young man rushed across the lobby to ask if he could help in any way. When I mentioned that I was just checking in, he stated that he was a maintainance person but would immediately find the receptionist. That's a dedicated employee with a great work ethic, and also a statement about management. The Drury was exceptional across the board. Location is perfect for walks into the French Quarter, trolley to the Garden District, and safe walk back at night. I will go out of my way to book Drury property on subsequent trips, especially the Drury New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Dallas_Traveler3
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a convenient downtown location. It is a few blocks to the French Quarter, but is within walking distance. The streetcar picks up right outside the hotel so this is another option for getting the Quarter. The hotel was clean and the room was comfortable. The front desk personnel were helpful. The morning breakfast was pretty good also, however, there is just so much good food in New Orleans that it is hard to pass up any opportunity to eat at a local restaurant. This hotel was priced below the rates of others in the area and is a good deal. They also have convenient, reasonably priced parking. I would definitely stay here again. I have absolutely no complaints about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: RoswellDad
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised when we stayed here for 2 nights prior to sailing on the Carnival Fantasy. We booked 2 rooms at around $65/night each, which included a nightly happy hour and an above-average breakfast buffet (with decent scrambled eggs, waffle machine, etc). This is an older property which has been renovated very nicely. The rooms are small but functional. Everything was quite clean and staff was courteous and efficient (except for recommending dinner at Mulate's - see separate review). We were less than a 10-minute walk from the Vieux Carre, which we walked to and from several times, never feeling unsafe or nervous for a single moment. To be so close to downtown, yet in a safe location, and get decent accommodations for a modest price in a very expensive city, the Drury is an outstanding value. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, Clean, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MSSaintsFan
Reviews.Content: We were in New Orleans for a Saints game and wanted a reasonably priced yet nice, clean, and comfortable place to stay within walking distance of the Super Dome and French Quarter. The Drury was exactly what we were looking for. The complementary hot breakfast before the game was good and saved us the hassle of finding food on a crowed game morning. Parking was $15 per day which is low for New Orleans, and the parking lot was easy to get into and out of. Our room was comfortable and clean. It was small and did not have much of a view, but we were not in New Orleans to hang out in the room and look out of the window. The room did have a refrigerator which was nice for keeping our drinks cold. The lobby is beautiful, check in was fast and easy, and the staff was great. They did not charge us the cancellation fee for our second night when we had to leave a day early even though we used the esaver rate which is supposed to have a $25 cancellation fee. The walk to the French Quarter was short and well lit at night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in NO”
Reviews.Author: tripleklutz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise in New Orleans. I'd never stayed in a Drury hotel, and now I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else. The lobby was lovely, there was a full hot breakfast, sodas available during the day, staff was friendly, beds were comfortable and room was clean with marble tiles in entrance and bathroom. Most importantly, all Drury hotels are pet friendly, and my dog had a great time looking out our 8th floor window at the streets of New Orleans. It was a short walk to the french quarter, and the streetcar lines are right outside the door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Joanne H
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here from November 2 to Nov. 4th when we were visiting for a family function. We reserved one suite and one double room. Both were excellent, very comfortable and clean and nicely decorated. Rooms had microwaves, refigerators, coffee makers, and very comfy beds. Also a free hot breakfast each morning, as well as free drinks at happy hour, and snacks and soft drinks in the lobby all day. We were able to walk to Bourbon Street, Riverwalk, and Harrah's Casino. But best of all was a nightly rate WELL under the other hotels. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Drury is greatv New Orleans is fabulous”
Reviews.Author: LSUmom
Reviews.Content: We live in north Lousiana and have stayed at this hotel many times, both pre-and post-Katrina. The rooms are consistently clean and well appointed. The location is excellent (a few blocks from the Superdome) and cabs are readily available. The hot breakfast is excellent. Service is typical New Orleans: friendly but slow. Relax, have a drink, you're in the Big Easy. Note to tourists: New Orleans is perfectly safe. If you're not buying or selling drugs, you are unlikely to get in the way of violence. The tourist areas are very safe. We go often and have never felt threatened. My son lives uptown and never has any problems. Go, spend money, help the city. It's a fun, fun place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice find not too far from stuff”
Reviews.Author: aj1a
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a place that wasn't too expensive as we would only be sleeping there...this was it. Nice accomodations, good price and a surprisingly good complimentary continental breakfast. This saved us time and money because going out for our big day at the NO JazzFest. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain”
Reviews.Author: mikofcdd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went for a 3-day weekend on Thursday evening 7/26/2007 to see our daughter during her summer internship in NOLA with Shell Oil. We booked through Travelocity unsing direct NWA flights from DTW to MSY. The upcharge from just the flight cost was amazingly small for both of us. The hotel was easy to find and had on-site parking. Upon arriving I asked if we could have our daughter stay with us instead of travelling back and forth to her apartment in Kenner. I said I would pay extra if necessary. The very nice young desk lady changed our room from a king to two doubles which was fine for us at no charge. Included in the accomodations was a small hot breakfast buffet and free "well" cocktails each evening (3 per adult). The bar used a bulk liquor dispenser nozzle. There was also a Soda Fountain machine available in the lobby 24/7. We had cocktails once but ate breakfast every morning of our stay. The food was good and hot, perhaps the scrambled eggs a little salty, but I have had much worse. Twin make your own waffles etc. The public areas were very clean and neat. A lot of impressive marble and over in the corner was a gratis computer and printer for quick email or flight updates and boarding passes. The room was clean and neat. There was enough room for the three of us with the two doubles. All the service staff we met were freindly although some had limited english (Latina). The location was near enough to the FQ for us to walk it 4-5 blocks directly to west end of Bourbon St.). The Casino which we didn't go to was about twice that straight down the main street. The big bonus was when we checked out they didn't charge is for parking as we expected so all in all we got a great bargain and were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: alabamacar
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. We traveled with our two kids, age 7 and 10. Outdoor pool on rooftop was nice. Best part is the parking. We have stayed at many French Quarter hotels and you have to wait forever for the valet to get your car. You parked your own car at Drury. Excellent! I also liked the fact that you had to use your room key to activate the elevators as well as the outdoor /stairwell entrances. Rooms (we had the suite) are very spacious and the breakfast and evening cocktails/snacks and cokes and popcorn(free) are great. Staff was very accomodating. We will stay there on our next trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pet Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wkn55
Reviews.Content: This hotel is underestimated. It was a pleasant surprise. Location was central to Bourbon St., Superdome, Riverwalk. They were pet friendly and did not have any 'strict' rules for the pets except it should be under 25lbs (but i even saw a large dog on the premises too). No extra fee for pet. The free extras are: internet access in room (no charge), also internet in lobby, free HOT breakfast (sausage, eggs, orange juice, muffins, waffles, fruit....) Free soft drinks and coffee all day. Evening Happy Hour which include snacks and drinks. The lobby is CLEAN. I even saw the morning kitchen crew wiping down all the underside of the tables, window seals etc. I just can't say enough about this place except my stay was very pleasant and I will be back. Staff was also wonderful. And all this 'hospitality' was during the Essence Festival which is when you expect service to drop...but not at this hotel. They are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the "free" Happy hour”
Reviews.Author: Mayotte
Reviews.Content: First of all, if you're considering staying at this hotel I recomend trying to book it through the Drury website with the e-saver rate. This was my first time to new Orleans and it was a blast! Driving from the I-10 was easy to find the hotel as its towards the superdome. I was a bit weary of staying so close to the french quarter but the hotel is VERY secure (gated parking lot, electronic key access to hotel and elevator, etc). I felt vey safe at this hotel. The front desk staff were extremely friendly especially jamie calling everyone sweetie and hunni. We left our passports at the front desk security box free of charge (we were the only ones with a key to it). The free happy hour was great they had everything from wine to cocktails. I do not recomend the beer as it was very flat. We were also upgraded to a suite once they found out we were newly weds. Had an amazing view and a very clean hotel room. Me and my husband are clean freaks and let me just say this is one of the cleanest hotels we have ever been to. Bed was comfy. Breakfast was good. Had a good variety. No complaints from this group. If we are to stay in New orleans again we will definitley be staying at the Drury Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: JWestShuh
Reviews.Content: The hotel was average at best. In the business district which is not a location I recommend. We had to stay there because of a conference and it was more convenient. The lobby of this hotel is beautiful, but it ends there. The room was average. The problem I had was the fact that we had a sliver for a window and it was facing a large building. It was very dark and I did not feel like I was in New Orleans at all. I could have been in Atlanta, anywhere really. The bed was uncomfortable and we even found a drop of blood on the pillow. Ewww. We didn't say anything, just put it aside. The rooftop pool is pretty cool and the breakfast in the morning is a nice touch. I would not recommend this hotel to business travelers and would suggest staying in the Warehouse district and walk. We stayed in New Orleans for 4 days - 2 days here and 2 days at the Country Inn and Suites which we absolutely loved. Dark room, poor customer service, overcharged at checkout, blood on the pillow make me not want to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine...but Generic”
Reviews.Author: JB93110
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, the employees were courteous, the self-parking was free, and the buffet breakfast was fine, but we really could have been Anywhere, USA -- which was not why we went to New Orleans. The immediate neighborhood is mostly office buildings, and I would not have felt comfortable walking into the French Quarter (especially at night). We moved to a hotel in the FQ (away from Bourbon Street) and were much happier.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It 100%”
Reviews.Author: texasloves2travel
Reviews.Content: My whole experience at this hotel was great!! The staff was so friendly they made me want to work there!!! From the warmest welcome and speedy check in with Rosey who made you truly feel welcome, to the smiling faces of the housekeepers , breakfast ladies, and the whole crew. I felt like I was gonna be a bother with my 20 questions but the front desk staff always had an answer complete with a smile on there faces. The free drinks and snacks where a plus and the free internet was also great my son was so happy. It was truly a pleasure staying at the Drury Inn New Orleans and I will be back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantasitic service, location, breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jojoid
Reviews.Content: I recently booked about 25 rooms for a wedding. All of our family and friends loved the hotel and thought it was a great bargain for a downtown hotel. FIRST LET ME SAY - THE STAFF WAS THE BEST! Extremely pleasant and helpful, especially at the front desk!! The lobby is spacious and beautiful with enough room for several groups to sit and visit. The included breakfast was very good with many choices of hot and cold foods. The free drinks in the early evening are great too! We had Kings, doubles and "mini-suites" in our block of rooms. All rooms had fridges and microwaves. The mini-suite was larger than I expected - full living room and separate bedroom. Lighting in the rooms was a bit dark as it relied on 3 lamps in the living area. Our rooms were clean and well maintained, especially for this city! Location is great - just 4 blocks from the French Quarter. Close enough to party, but separate for those who want to be able to get away from Bourbon St. It is on the streetcar line, but unfortunately it is not running as frequently as pre-K and not yet going Uptown. The building is secured, requiring key cards to enter after dark, to use the elevator and parking. Our biggest complaint was that the key cards sometimes didn't work in the elevator or parking, so we had to get them reprogrammed frequently. Parking was secure, but $15/day.

Reviews.Title: “Drury pretty dreary...”
Reviews.Author: BRBelle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a one night stay at the Drury Inn and found it quite dreary! Our room had a horrible stale, almost medecinal smell and the spa tub had a fistful of hairs as well as a mysterious moldy film in it. The free drinks were okay, the snack were just that snacks - tortilla chips, potato chips and chex mix. The breakfast was not the lavish feast folks had raved about - just very rin of the mill, muffins, biscuits and make your own waffles. We expected more and have gotten much more at the same price point at other hotels inthe area - International House, Homewood Suites, the Courtyard and the W...

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: natnat919
Reviews.Content: Wow.... I booked this hotel based on the reviews on Tripadvisor, and was I pleased? OH YES. This was the most lovely room I've ever seen, the best service, everything was perfect. I paid $99 a night, got a hot breakfast buffet, got free alcohol in the evenings, 1 hour of free long distance, and a lovely room. What more could you ask for? STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Loved New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: alaskacat713
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October 2006 for 5 nights. We had a pretty good stay. We actually spent very little time in the hotel. We did enjoy the early evening snacks and drinks. Once. The morning breakfast was very nice. It included eggs, bacon, cereals, bagels, and much more. You must use your room key in the elevators to get to your room. The rooms was nice and large. Our only problem was a missing remote control that took 2 days to get replaced. The pool on the roof was very exciting for my teenage daughter. She loved it. Everyone was very friendly. I don't know if we would stay here again simply because there are so many great places to stay in New Orleans and we would love to try them all!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: lihpa
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hotel one night on recent visit to New Orleans based on tripadvisor reviews. Hotel was extremely nice, clean, pleasant staff and a great value. Good location few blocks from French Quarter. Would highly recommend it especially for the price

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret Of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: stevecayman
Reviews.Content: Though it's been a couple of months since I stayed at the Drury Inn, I thought I would give my two cents worth. Yes, the Drury Inn in New Orleans is one of the best kept secrets. As a travel agent I was in New Orleans for a whirl wind tour, different hotel evey night. The Drury Inn was my last stop and proved to be the best stop. From the moment you step into their magnificent lobby and then to receive a very warm welcome by the desk staff, you know right then this is going to be a much different hotel experience. The grandeur of the lobby is not the only place where you'll find it. It's also in the guest bathrooms and the touches found in the rooms. The free morning breakfast is far more than just coffee, juice and Danish. Having one of their hearty breakfasts will last you past lunchtime. The pool on the roof with it's panoramic views is something to enjoy any time of the day. Whether you stay for a day, a week or month, put this one high on your list of places to stay in New Orleans

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: GetawayGang
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 stayed here for 3 days of sightseeing in NO. Everything was wonderful. The staff were exceptionally friendly and accommodating, and the rooms were very spacious. There was no evidence of hurricane or flood damage at this hotel. Our boys enjoyed the rooftop pool several times, we took advantage of the workout room, and we enjoyed the complimentary hot breakfast buffet and nightly happy hours. It was an easy walk to the French Quarter -- no more than 5 minutes away. The parking lot was very convenient and the rates included unlimited in-out privileges. It is easily accessible from the freeway. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: alyson003
Reviews.Content: Staying in hotels in New Orleans right now you can't expect much service due to high shortages in employees and this hotel is not an exception. I hardly ever saw the hotel staff. The furnishings in my opinion were dark and 80ish looking. Because of the dark carpet and furniture it didn't feel very clean. The bathroom was small and just average. There was a small fridge and microwave. Internet access was free so that was nice. And they had free snacks/drinks in the evening which were good. I felt very safe; you needed your room key to use the elevator. It is only about 4 blocks from Bourbon Street and about 3 to Harrah's and the Riverwalk. It is easy to get your car from parking. They have a small gated lot next to the hotel and you can just walk and get your car anytime without having to get a valet. Overall it was an okay place to sleep, because you didn't want to spend time there. Which is good if you going to New Olreans 'cause who wants to stay in the room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “A Must Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family visited New Orleans recently. Although we've been living in North Louisiana for three years now, this is the first time that we ever visited South Louisiana. I would say that we are lucky to find a very nice hotel right in the Central Business District- Drury Inn. This hotel just made us feel so comfortable that we never really mind leaving important belongings inside the hotel while we walked around everywhere. The parking lot is so well-lighted so that we did not worry about our vehicle during the night. Considering the location of Drury Inn in Poydras Street, one will expect to pay such a substantial amount for that stay but the rate that we paid -$89.99 plus tax and $13.00 parking fee is really a bargain. The pool on the rooftop is so perfect. Anybody who comes to visit the pool on the rooftop will surely want to take a dip into the pool. In addition to that, breakfast is really so good especially the Belgian Waffle which is freshly cooked (because you are actually the one doing the cooking on the waffle maker). My daughter really enjoyed doing that. It was actually another friend who endorsed Drury Inn to us and now its my turn to endorse Drury Inn to whoever wants to visit New Orleans and I would say that it is really A Must Place to Stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Travel Agent Traveler
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and thus stay in many hotels each year. This one is a winner in its category and price range. The staff is friendly and helpful. We had a corner room that had a living room, dressing area, bath and bedroom, with plenty of windows all around. The perks that Drury offers add to the value. The free breakfast is bountiful and far superior to most offered free at hotels. The free afternoon snacks and drinks are a fun way to wind down before going out on the town at night. The adjacent parking is also free, and that is a serious cost savings in a large city. We didn't find the walk to the French Quarter to be too long, and it is very direct - right down the hotel's street is Bourbon Street. Besides, the hotel is nicely located for both the French Quarter and the action along the Riverwalk. If I were writing directly to the management, I would make a couple of suggestions for improvement. The available guest laundry is a great idea but offers just one machine for the whole hotel. We had to keep running back and forth from our room to try and find the machine available for use. And, it was hard for us to find someplace to sit to eat breakfast because groups of people just sat around at the tables (there aren't that many of them) chatting and reading after finishing. This is more rude on the guest's part than it is the fault of Drury. However, there must be some way to politely suggest that people vacate the tables when finished. All-in-all, a successful hotel with useful and friendly perks. If you remember the low price for your room, the value becomes even more apparent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Drury Inn for 4 nights. King room with jacuzzi tub very spacious and clean. Breakfast was nice. Jamie from the guest services was exceptional. Give that woman a promotion !!!! She made our stay very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected and more!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Drury Inn from June 2nd to the 7th. When we first walked in the Inn, we were pleasantly surprised. The lobby looks like it belongs in a 5 star hotel. We really enjoyed the popcorn and soda in the room as well as the cleanliness and comfort of the room. The free breakfast was okay but the free happy hour was awesome!!!!Overall, you can't go wrong by staying at the Drury Inn. Stay there!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with perks!”
Reviews.Author: tntitanterri
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the same street that turns into to Bourbon Street (only a few blocks away) so we really liked the location. The free breakfast was really good, the free happy hour was nice and the free popcorn and soft drinks was loved by our teenagers. The roof top pool was really neat being on the 10th floor. The room was nice and clean. I'd highly reccommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: GoSox8
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 6 nights at the Drury. Can't say enough good things about it. The free breakfast is average, but hey, it's free! The happy hour is a good perk. I don't recommend the margaritas, but everything else was excellent. It was nice to come back and enjoy the happy hour before going out for dinner. We had a king-sized single room. It was very clean. We had no malfunctions at all. My husband hates hotels and even he was happy! The staff is very nice and will help with anything. The rest of our experience in NO was not so great (stolen wallet, sinus infection), but we were very happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain, great hotel, not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Drury is admittedly a great bargain. In addition to the low cost, there is free breakfast and snacks and drinks in the afternoon, and there is a free parking lot adjacent to the hotel. The hotel and rooms are clean and attractive, and the staff was friendly and helpful. The catch is, it is a bit of a walk from the French Quarter. We live in New York and are accostomed to walking everywhere, so we thought we would not mind. Late at night, however, the business district is deserted, so we opted to take cabs. The cost of the cabs was not an issue, given the money we saved by staying here, but we wished we had stayed in a hotel closer to the Quarter so we could stop by quickly in the afternoon or change between touring the historical sites during the day and going out at night. We never wanted to walk all the way to the business district and back. Also, we never got up in time for the breakfast and were not around to enjoy the free afternoon cocktails. If you do not mind the inconvenience of being a walk from the Quarter, or if you plan to spend most of your time at Harrah's, then the Drury is the best bargain in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: jcomo
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on May 14, 2005 for our 12th Wedding Anniversary. We were very pleased with the Value of the Hotel. We usually stay at the Astor which is also great, however, you get a lot of extras at the Drury. The breakfast was wonderful. The room was very clean, not fancy, but clean. We come to New Orleans several times a year and will definately come back to the Drury. The parking is also a great deal. Anywhere else in New Orleans is at least $25-$30 (plus you have to tip the valet) and you do not have access to your car once you turn it over to the Hotels. The Drury has a lot directly next to the hotel and you can come and go as you please. I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a nice clean place to stay without spending a fortune. With the money you save, you can treat yourself to a few extras on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Nice, But.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Kids ran wild Sunday morning yelling in the hallway at 7:30 am most mornings. Sunday morning the maid vacumed the hallway at 8 am and weekdays at 8:30 am. This is a kid friendly hotel. Not for couples looking for romantic getaway or seniors seeking peace and quiet. Very Nice Rooms & Lobby, roof top pool is great. Everything is Very Very Nice, Great Free Breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in town”
Reviews.Author: Saintev929
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Drury and could not have been more pleased. First of all, the accomodations for just a single room surpass some suites we have stayed in in NOLA; 15 ft ceilings, floor to ceiling windows with a great view,extremely comfortable bed, large area with more than enough room to move around and marble bathrooms were a very nice touch. The evening reception was fantastic. (Allejandro, good job with those Rum and Cokes). The front office staff were the friendliest we have encountered yet in N'awlins. We travel to New Orleans quite often and we have now found our new preferred place to stay in the Big Easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Peter73981
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Drury Inn from April 14 to 17. Good room, great breakfast, short walk to French Quarter. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Drury”
Reviews.Author: TouristLady
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Drury from April 8-11 and had a great time. Dennis at the front desk was super helpful and Alejandro at the bar was great. The Drury is within a few minutes of walking to the French Quarter or the Riverfront. We walked everywhere and never had a problem. The breakfast buffet included in the room price is quite good. You can even make yourself some Belgian waffles - they provide all the fixins. Just make sure you go early before everything is gone - they're not too quick on replenishing the food. The evening happy hour is wonderful. Each person gets 3 free drinks and they aren't stingy. There are some munchies served as well. Overall, it's quite relaxing. Considering what we paid, I think we got good value for our money. We went during the French Quarter Festival, so the prices were higher than other times, but still much less than the other hotels we were considering.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Drury and New Orleans Recommendations”
Reviews.Author: czechred
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the Drury New Orleans. Excellent location, walk about 4 blocks to Canal, cross over and you're right on Bourbon Street. Great hot breakfast buffet ( the fresh made Belgian waffles were the best), but same thing every morning, so don't expect a great variety. 3 free drinks and munchies, Monday - Thursday. Rooms were spacious, clean, get the 2 room suite if you are able, better than the single room accommodation. Husband could sleep while I watched the 2nd TV in the living room. Only thing I didn't like was room faced the building next door and was a little dark. If you want a view and more light spring for the city view rooms. Very nicely furnished lobby. Staff was friendly and helpful with tourist questions. Hotel is right on the trolley line to the Garden District. Get on right on Poydras toward Canal and stay on it when it swings aroung and goes up St. Charles Ave. Better way to get a seat when it's crowded. THis location was walkable to everywhere including the Riverfront. Ate at Commander's Palace for lunch, they have regular sized 25 cent Martinis at lunch. Also ate a NOLA's, very, very good but like most of New Orleans' better restaurants, it was pricey but worth it for the food and the excellent service. Best oysters were at the Acme Seafood House off Bourbon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went for a conference in May 2004. This was actually the cheapest hotel in the conference recommeded hotel brocher. I was amazed how good this hotel is. The rooms are AWESOME. The ceilings are high, the rooms are clean and greater large windows. The service is amazing and they have free drinks, nachos and snacks in the evening. I will most definitely recommend this. Good job guys.

Reviews.Title: “The best deal in town”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Drury last week and can confirm that the reviews on here are still valid: this has to be one of the best deals in a town where the hotels enjoy an occupancy level that seems to have made many of them a bit arrogant. Location is really convenient for both French Quarter and CBD, and the St Charles streetcar stops just a block away. Checked in early without problems, and found the room to be spacious, clean and to expectations. High-speed internet in the room and an hour's long distance calling is free, which can be a huge hassle-saver (look up restaurants and attractions etc.) Even a couple of complimentary drinks in the fridge and popcorn in the microwave, ready to go. The breakfast was good, though admittedly not fantastic, but chances are you will be stuffing yourself with fantastic food during your stay in this city anyway, so no need to go overboard at breakfast time. Same thing goes for the rooftop pool - more of a bathtub, really, but hey, this is just too good a place to sit around a pool. Staff was friendly and helpful thorughout. I had the dubious pleasure of staying at three different hotels during my visit(!), this one was hands down the best one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Drury during a conference in July 2004. I was very surprised and pleased at the condition of the hotel. Nicely kept/decorated lobby, and my room was fabulous. I had a room on the end of the hotel and I had tall windows on 2 sides of the room which allowed for a terrific view of the city. Marble bathrooms were very nice and I just overall enjoyed my stay thoroughly. Plus this was the cheapest hotel on the travel list so I really felt like I got a good deal! I would definitely stay there again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 nights at the Drury in New Orleans. The location was great, definitely not on the french quarter, but close enough to count. We liked the secured parking and the ability to come and go at any time. We were in a King suite with two children (age 3 and 8 ) and never felt crowded. The high ceilings give a feel of spaciousness I have not experienced in other hotels. The kids swam in the rooftop pool. We chose to check out New Orleans with our car, but the location was good enough for energetic people ( and those without small children) to easily walk down to the main part of Riverwalk mall, the aquarium and Harrahs. We did not use the cable system, once again because of small children, but it was very accessible. The morning breakfast was EXCELLENT. Hot and cold foods. The evening snack time with drinks was WONDERFUL. We had been heading out to find dinner on our second night and almost got too full on nachos and drinks at the snack time (beer for my husband, margarita for me and the kids had pepsi). The ambience is plush and old world looking, but nice. We will definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to anyone looking for a good price, good location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased With Drury”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Drury Inn 1/28/05-2/1/05. We had an excellent vacation & the Drury was just a wonderful place to stay.It has an excellent location, the staff was very nice & friendly, & the room had everything that we needed, including a fridge & microwave. The free soft drinks & popcorn were a nice surprise! They even allowed us to check in 3-4 hrs early. I'm sure we'll stay here again. We usually go to New Orleans a couple times a year & will be sure to check the Drury Inn out the next time we vacation there.
